campaign.story:
A 70-page original graphic novel from writer Dave Ebersole and artist Vinnie Rico about an infamous robber meeting the love of his life on his final heist.  
Dave Ebersole and Vinnie Rico team up with letterer Cardinal Rae and designer Seth Darnall, to tell a pulp western queer romance in this stand alone graphic novel TOMMY DAKOTA AND THE SHOOTOUT AT THE BURGUNDY TEN.
THE STORY 
THE BURGUNDY TEN: Once a nice place for respectable people, but not anymore. Now they don’t clean the floors unless it’s to mop the blood off ‘em.
The saloon is home to a high-stakes underground poker game that features a cadre of gamblers, criminals, and rogues. 
TOMMY DAKOTA: Infamous robber, renowned desperado, and legendary outlaw. Society shunned him years ago, so Tomas De Santos changed his name, joined the military, and hid his passions to be just like everyone else. When that wasn't enough, this queer Latino threw away a life of service for a life of crime.  If this world wouldn’t take him, he would take what he wanted. Since then, the thrill of the heist and the promise of the payoff are all he's needed...until he met Jep Walker.

JEP WALKER: Jep, the Burgundy Ten bartender, has been trying to find the right scheme to get out from the life he’s been living and a past that still haunts him. When he joined forces with Goldie, he never imagined his heart would be on the line. After Tommy Dakota walked into the bar, everything changed.
GOLDIE HESSER: A former high roller turned crook bound and determined to rob the game. All she needs is a bandit crazy enough to help her pull it off.  

Now this terrible trio has a plan to take the ultimate prize and the payoff of a new life.
Their plan is set. Their crew is ready. Their dreams are within their grasp. What could go wrong? 
TOMMY DAKOTA AND THE SHOOTOUT AT THE BURGUNDY TEN  is a modern pulp western with a queer romance at its heart. We hope you'll come along for the ride! 

REWARDS!
The main reward of the campaign features a copy of the graphic novel in print and digital. There are some other great rewards too! 
Every pledge over $10.00 gets you an MP3 of the Tommy Dakota Theme Song by singer/ songwriter/ punk rock piano player Mike Maimone. This song is an exclusive feature of the campaign. 
Every pledge over $20.00 comes with this swanky Burgundy Ten coaster. 

For $30.00 you get a signed copy of the book plus this full color 8.5 X 11 exclusive print  "Under The Stars" by Tommy Dakota artist Vinnie Rico. 
UNDER THE STARS 
The $40.00 tier gets you all of the above and includes a PDF of Dave's full TOMMY DAKOTA SCRIPT to Vinnie (complete with reference photos and sketches) 
Portrait of the writer by the artist.
Higher pledge tiers can opt for something more unique, like a one-on-one script review with Dave. Discuss your comic book script, screenplay, theater script, short stories, or a longer prose project. It’s up to you!
Vinnie is offering up full color digital portraits perfect for your profile picture on social media or for printing and framing.
portrait of the fabulous Courtney by Vinnie
Guest star in the bar! You could be a featured extra at the bar in the book! We'll draw you right into the heart of the danger.

Add on rewards gets you signed copies of both the single issues and the graphic novel of DASH: The Case of the Mysterious Zita Makara, Dave and Vinnie's first book together. 
cover art by Delia Gable
THE CREATORS 
Dave and Vinnie met a few years back when Vinnie took over the interior art for DASH from Northwest Press. Since then Dave and Vinnie have become close collaborators and fierce friends. Tommy Dakota And The Shootout At The Burgundy Ten marks their first book as co-creators.
Late night working session
From Dash 5 art by Vinnie, words by Dave
DAVE EBERSOLE (writer and co-creator) 
Best known for being the writer and co-creator of Dash from Northwest Press, of which he's currently working on with Vinnie, and Delia Gable. Also a theater director and playwright, Dave has had his work produced in Philadelphia, New York, and Las Vegas. He lives right outside Philly with his Yorkie Ernie, who is a jerk sometimes but it’s ok because he’s cute… sometimes. Find him on Twitter at @debersol
VINNIE RICO(artist and co-creator) 
A Mexican comic artist who's very interested in social issues and pizza. In addition to being the interior artist on DASH, he has collaborated on comics like The End is Totally Nigh, written by Kara Barrett, and Fake Empire, written by Eric Palicki. Find him on Twitter and elsewhere at @ricomics.
 (Fake Empire #1 art by Vinnie Rico, written by Eric Palicki) 
CARDINAL RAE (letterer)
A letterer and graphic designer with Fenix Works, Inc. in New Jersey. They've worked with Image Comics (Crowded, Rose, Where We Live), DC Comics (The Coming of the Supermen), Dynamite Entertainment (Xena: Warrior Princess), A Wave Blue World (This Nightmare Kills Fascists), Dark Horse (Once Upon A Time Machine), Oneshi Press (Pack, Tracy Queen), and other publishers. They also designs logos for comic books and other comics related things.
SETH DARNALL (production & logo)
Seth is a visual artist who specializes in "swirly, drippy, abstract color bombs." Curator of the Fire and Air Gallery, Seth has also spent twelve years in print and digital design. Find more at sdarnallart.com 
MIKE MAIMONE (theme song writer)
Describing the front man of Chicago garage rock veterans Mutts, Daytrotter said Mike Maimone “goes from zero to a hundred quicker than most.” Relocating to Nashville in January 2020, he moved characteristically fast and was named a Lightning 100 Local Artist of the Week in February. A prolific songwriter, Mike has published over 100 songs that are as diverse as his life has been. Find out more on mikemaimone.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is our first Kickstarter, we've worked together for years on DASH and have developed a process that brings out the best from both of us. We have a specific timeline in order to get the book completed. Sometimes life does get in the way, but we’re confident with the printer we’ll be using, and the time allotted, that we’ll be able to deliver the book to backers on time.

We’ll be updating regularly so everyone can see where we are in the process. 

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello!
Hope everyone has had a great weekend! On Friday, a little before noon we reached the end of our campaign. With $18,089 pledged from 509 amazing backers, we crossed the finish line, and WOW…it still seems so unreal. We put this out there and you made it happen!
I'll be honest, I was a little dumbstruck as to what to say. I have so much gratitude to express to so many people and I didn’t know if I had the right words. I still don’t think I have the right words.  From everyone who backed the campaign, shared it, featured it, blogged about it, had us on podcasts to talk about it, screamed it from the mountain tops, every inch of support helped get us there.

updates.update_userinfo: CLOSE TO THE FINISH LINE WITH A FEW MORE PAGES!
updates.update_content:
HELLO EVERYONE!
We have crossed the 400 backer threshold and we’re still going! This week we close out the campaign and even though we’ve said it many times before, we can’t say it enough, THANK YOU!
As promised, here are the next few unlettered pages from Vinnie. These pages pick up with Tommy finishing his big flirt with Jep and now gets down to business with Goldie.

HELLO EVERYONE!
It’s been another crazy week and the campaign has been going strong, thank you for all the support! We were blown away by how fast you got us to our goal. Then with lightning speed, you helped us reach our stretch goal. Right now we are on track to hit 400 backers! That’s incredible!

Hello everyone!
It’s been a crazy week for so many reasons, but the most important one is we've reached 322 amazing backers which has unlocked our stretch goal!
There will now be a black and white pin up section in the book featuring the amazing talents of Fell Hound, Jack Foster, Alex Schlitz, Micha Weltsch, and . We’ll be revealing these through the updates as they progress.

Hello everyone!
It’s been a little more than a week since we launched and we are now 144% funded! We can’t thank you enough for making this book happen and making it possible for us to make it.
We have a stretch goal!

Well in only a few days of launching, with the amazing generous support of 183 backers, we not only reached our goal but we’re now exceeding it!
THANK YOU!

HELLO!
It hasn’t even been twenty-four hours and already we are 63% funded with 113 amazing backers.
We are blown away! On top of that Kickstarter also made us a “project we love” and we’re pretty sure you all had something to do with that.
THANK YOU!

campaign.story:
This 40 page fully illustrated hardback book will be a wonderful way to let children of LGBTQIA+  families see themselves represented, on the page. My father, Robert Schanke who is one of the grampas mentioned in the title, and I, Julie Schanke Lyford, have co-written one of the very first children's picture books to feature Gay grampas! 
Where is the money going?  We are using it to help bring this book we've dreamed of publishing for YEARS to life!  A large portion goes to pay for the illustrator so that she can create all of the original artwork  for the book. Also, even though we have a publisher, we still have to pay for things like the printing cost, the cover design and the typesetting of the book.   We want this to look fantastic, and so we are bringing in the experts to help us make this a professionally produced book.
There are many different levels to pledge and MANY fun rewards.  The different levels feature everything from having the child of your choice included in the final book to fabulous pride themed cheesecake from Muddy Paws Cheesecake.   
 About Julie 
Being a mother, I have read many picture books to my children.  However, there were NONE that showed OUR family unit, a family with gay grampas.  Working together with my father, Robert, we have taken a true story and turned it into a beautifully illustrated picture book.  
Grampas Bob and Jack
About Robert
During my 40 years of teaching theatre at various colleges, I also authored eight books focusing on LGBTQIA+ artists in the American theatre. Co-authoring this children's book, however, has been a highlight of my career. In being autobiographical, it has allowed me to express my joy of being a grampa and part of a loving, modern family. 
Katy Introducing Her Two Grampas to Her Classroom
Why the Need for THIS Book? 
Several children’s books focus on children with their gay parents. Few, if any, however, deal with their gay grandfathers. This book, a true story, with dozens of colorful original images, tells the story of a first-grade girl with a lisp who is always misunderstood by her classmates and teacher. One day when she talks about her two gay grampas, she becomes very frustrated when they think she means grampa and gramma. With the help of her big sister, she is able to let her teacher know what she is trying to say.  Finally, because she has such love for her gay grampas and so much trust in their understanding her, she unexpectedly shines when introducing them at a classroom party for grandparents. 
Be a character in the book!!
Exclusive Peeks Behind-the-scenes - How a Book Is Created
How is the Magic Made?
Julie has been working with Mariia Luzina, a fantastic Ukrainian illustrator who currently lives in Pomigliano D`Arco,  Italy.  Mariia has brought the story to life with her imaginative and heartfelt images.  We communicate daily and work on the sketches to make sure they tell the story we are wanting to tell and showing the emotion that is happening at that part of the story.
Mariia has been stuck inside during the COVID-19 lockdown in Italy so it's given her plenty of time to create wonderful images for the book!!  Here are a few examples:
We start with a character study.
Then we move on to a sketch for a page in the book - we talk about the images I am looking for her to create.  I send her examples to use for ideas...You can see the photo I sent her made its way into Katy's thought bubbles below! 
  After talking about the image - we change things - note the change in Katy's facial expression and the fact that we can see the girls more clearly in the beach image.
Katy's Wonderful Memories with Her Grampas
 Love is Love Pin 
This beautiful Love Is Love Rainbow Pin features the phrase "Love Is Love" across a silver heart with a rainbow-striped background. It's a perfect representation of your support and gay pride. The sterling silver-plated pin is 5/8 by 5/8 inch and has a tac backing. 
 Pride Cheesecake 
Voted as “Best Cheesecake in Minnesota” many times over, Muddy Paws Cheesecake has even been given as gifts to 800 attendees at the Emmy Awards and served at the Obama Whitehouse!  
Muddy Paws Cheesecake

We are thrilled to be published by WiseInk Press
Wise Ink believes in books that matter
“The books that stand out for us are ones that are authored by people with a broad vision for them,” said Wise Ink co-founder Dara Beevas. “We see a lot of great manuscripts, but when they are written by an author who sees the potential for that manuscript to positively impact the world, that’s when we get really excited.  Wise Ink is a boutique publishing company created to help passionate authors through the hurdles of publishing. Wise Ink believes in helping writers and thought leaders who are seeking a purpose-driven, intentional, and informed approach to publishing.  Wise Ink believes in helping writers and thought leaders who are seeking a purpose-driven, intentional, and informed approach to publishing."
www,wiseink.com
ZERO-WASTE PUBLISHING
Wise Ink created a business model that has as little negative impact on the environment as possible, and offsets the environmental impact of the printed material the books generate. They have committed funds to a replanting project, which plants trees in forests that have been devastated by a number of environmental and man-made crises. In 2017, they partnered with The Arbor Day Foundation to facilitate the planting of 6,000 trees a year in some of our most critically devastated forests (planting in spring and summer). Through Neighborhood Forest, they helped elementary schools plant nearly 800 urban trees. Learn more about the Arbor Day Foundation’s reforestation projects here. Learn more about Neighborhood Forest here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our illustrator is finalizing the illustrations for the book and we plan to have the book to the publisher by the end of July. It will then go through final typesetting and final proofs before going to the printer. We do not have control of the timing of the actual printing. The plan is to have the books printed by December 1. 

The individual books must then be packaged separately and with care. We will do everything we can to ensure they arrive safely and quickly to your door.

However due to COVID-19, there might still be unforeseen production and delivery delays. If delays occur we will keep you all updated and get rewards and books to you as quickly as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Our tradition lives on even 11 years after this article was published. The family recipe for Julekake (Christmas Bread) was brought over from Norway in 1897 by Robert’s great grandmother. The recipe has survived over the years even as distance has separated our family. Read the Des Moines Register article below to learn why this recipe is so important to our family.

campaign.story:
What Is It? 
Hitting the streets of Manchester and bashing back against the haters
 Glitter Vipers is the 60 page story of Manchester drag queen Bi Phallicia and her friends who find themselves victims of an awful hate crime and decide that they are going to fight back. So they strap up, hit the streets and are ready to fight back against bigotry with a sequin baseball bat and some bad ass righteous fury! 
The fabulous Bi Phallicia
Follow the most fabulous street gang in the world as they patrol the Gay Village, step up to bigoted politicians and bash down the bashers. And in the midst of it all, they discover there's a conspiracy behind it all!
They're sick of being seen as victims! Sick of having crimes against them ignored! The Glitter Vipers are here to fight back!
The story is a brisk 60 pages, with a few behind the scenes extras thrown in too to give you a great little package in a glitter grindhouse revenge fantasy!
The gang's all here! Art by Katie Fleming
Who Are the Glitter Vipers?
 Bi Phallicia  - Bi Phallicia, real name Jason Filson, is a Manchester drag queen of some repute, who as well as her weekly shows runs a support group for those that have been victims of abuse, bigotry or hate crimes. Unfortunately, she finds herself becoming not just the organiser but also one of the members. She takes on the lead in the Glitter Vipers gang when they decide to fight back. 
Jesus Moretti - Jesus is a Colombian immigrant living in Manchester, UK and close friends with Bi and her group. He's dating Anton Bakunin. He's a broader, tougher looking man who came to the UK to live a more open and free life as a gay man. 
Anton Bakunin - Anton had a rough upbringing, finding it a lot harder to hide who he is as a gay man. An Eastern European immigrant who fled his home where being gay can result in being 'vanished', Anton came to the UK to try and find peace. Unfortunately, homophobia isn't just something that happens 'somewhere else'. 
Melissa 'Mel' Carter - Mel is a garage worker in Manchester, and is dating Bri. They are attendees of the support group after the pair were attacked by homophobes on a tram.  Mel is very tough, and has been harbouring a lot of anger over the surprise attack they suffered, and is eager to make sure nothing like it ever happens again.
 Bryony 'Bri' Stonehouse - Manchester born and bred, Bri has been dating Mel for nearly two years now. She also felt more anger than anything else after they were attacked, but she abhors violence entirely. Instead, Bri uses her smarts and community spirit to build the community support group stronger than ever before. 
Callum 'Cal' Wilkes - Cal came out much later in life, as his life in a biker gang didn't feel like the safest place to be openly gay. In fact, it turned out he was right when he did get outed to his gang and he wound up kicked out and alone. Struggling at first to find his tribe after this rejection, Cal is now a regular of Manchester's leather scene and brings his gruff, take-no-guff attitude to the local queer community. 
Queenie Iwobi - Queenie is a trans woman from a Nigerian family, she moved from her home in London to Manchester for council work years ago. Now, she takes part in the support group as a way of managing the daily micro-aggressions she faces as a proud trans WOC in this world, and to help support others like her. Also not a fan of violence, she joins Bri at the homebase, creating a helpful, safe space for the community and using her skills as a community support worker. 
Albert 'Alby' Prince - a 16 year old trans masc kid, Alby has been sneaking out to the gay scene for a while to find a safe space to be their authentic self, away from their home where they are not out. Alby became a big fan of Bi's shows, and Bi took them under her wing so she could make sure Alby was having a safe experience. Alby prefers he/him or they/them pronouns, but is not yet out to their family.
Page of inks by Katie Fleming
Content Warning
We are aware that the topic of hate crimes, bigotry and assault are sensitive topics, that we as a queer community often face far too often. Sensitive to this, the book will contain content warnings so that readers can be aware going in what to expect. 
We are also aware that it can be annoying to be seen as just the victims all the time. And while there can be a lot of emotions that are discussed after these kind of things, one emotion is often overlooked or swept-under-the-rug: anger. 
Page of inks by Katie Fleming
Sometimes when we see these things happen, or when they happen to us, there can be a strong sense of justified anger, and we look at that through the medium of revenge fantasy grindhouse action and explore what sense of resolution or satisfaction can be found there. 
All the while telling an entertaining, thoughtful action story in a very modern world. We'll have fun, but won't be making fun. 
Who's It For?
Have you ever seen the news and just felt so angry? Then you, for sure. 
But seriously, I think anyone who has felt that kind of strong reaction to things that happen in the world, whether it be a story of injustice they've seen in the news, or an article of a hate-fuelled attack, or worse, have had personal experience with that; I think anyone who relates to that will find something to relate to in Glitter Vipers. 
Queenie Iwobi by Katie Fleming
Anyone who has stood up to or is aware of organised hate, systemic violence and bigotry in this world can maybe find something in Glitter Vipers that speaks to them. We've all felt angry: this is about our right to that rage, and finding an outlet for it.
We all get told that we should not let that anger rise, that we don't have the right to our anger or how lashing out is wrong, but see the same things happen again and again. Glitter Vipers will explore that anger, it's justification and how it too can have a role in recovery, for good or ill.
Generally suitable for teens aged 16 years of age or older, the book has some light use of course language, violence, and as mentioned, sensitive topics around bigotry, hate crimes and assault. If you are buying for someone else, please do bare that in mind. 
Cover by James Gifford
Who's Making It?
One thing that we wanted to achieve with this book was the keep the whole creative team as queer identifying people. It's an LGBTQIA+ focused story, so it only felt right to have it be made by LGBTQIA+ people. 
The team is as follows:-
Joe Glass - Writer
 Joe Glass - Joe is the writer and co-creator of popular LGBTQ+ superhero adventure series, The Pride, now a successful ComiXology Originals series. He's also the writer of Acceptable Losses, a mature, political thriller with a dark edge. Most recently, he's worked with RuPaul's Drag Race star Manila Luzon on a countdown Instagram comic for her single, Robbed! Joe lives in South Wales with his family, and a petulant cat named Oliver. You can find his website here. 
Katie Fleming - Art
 Katie Fleming - Katie Fleming is a queer artist from Dublin, Ireland.  She began creating comics with her Partner with their LGBTQ+ comic '100 Times' and '100 More Times'.  since then she's worked on numerous anthologies and comics, such as 'Heart of Steal', 'The Black Rubric' and the webcomic, 'Ship Wrecked'. Glitter Vipers is her first graphic novel and she's super excited. When she's not making comics she's spending her time as a Werewolf. Her work can be found here. 
 Kelly Fitzpatrick - Kelly Fitzpatrick is known for her work on books such as: Bitch Planet, Supergirl: Being Super, Wonder Woman: Tempest Tossed, Shade the Changing Girl, DC: Bombshells, Archie, and Josie and the Pussycats. Nominated for the esteemed Hugo awards, she is also a past nominee for Autostraddle, Ghastly & Prism awards and has worked on titles nominated for the GLAAD and the Harvey awards. Her client list is available on her website and includes such prestigious publishers as DC Comics, Archie Comics & Dark Horse Comics. 
Lucas Gattoni - Letters
 Lucas Gattoni - Lucas Gattoni is a seasoned graphic designer and typesetter now pursuing his dream job of comic book lettering. He has lettered GLAAD nominated Liebestrasse for ComiXology Originals, Twin Worlds for Action Lab, Eskimo Kisses for Scout Comics and is currently lettering the Spanish version of Sonic The Hedgehog for IDW. He lives in his home country of Argentina with his husband and their three unnamed goldfish (oops, make that two now). His website is here.
Ted Brandt - Editor
 Ted Brandt - Ted Brandt is best known as an inker, working with his partner Ro on the Eisner- and GLAAD-nominated CROWDED from Image Comics. He likes long walks on the beach, and eating too much pizza. Ted is using his editorial hat on Glitter Vipers to help make the book the best it can be. 
James Gifford - Cover Artist
 James Gifford - James Gifford is a cis gay illustrator and storyboard artist who lives in London. He's a wayward pirate, plundering whatever illustration jobs he runs ashore on, never resting in one spot for long. A lone creative, a side-spitting gunslinger. The moment you think you have him pinned, he slips through your fingers like smoke. He's earned coin from Cartoon Network and Marvel comics and is currently creating content for Dungeons and Dragons in his spare time. You'll chip your teeth on his tough exterior, but deep down his heart is gold. His website is here. 
Spire Eaton - Spire is a graphic designer, artist, animator and comic creator based in Florida. He designed the Glitter Vipers logo for the book. That fabulousness is all down to him! You can check out his work here.
How Far Along Is It?
At time of launching the campaign, the book is entirely written, final inks are done for about roughly 20% of the book, with a further dozen pages ahead prepped too, and colours and cover work is starting in conjunction as the rest of the pages are drawn.
Alby Prince by Katie Fleming
We estimate that by the end of the campaign the book will be half way or more complete, and have allowed a roomy space of months between campaign end and delivery in an effort to ensure prompt delivery of the finished product. 
By following and/or backing the campaign, we will keep you updated with new pages and art as they happen, so you'll be the first to see more as it comes!
 How is the Money Spent?
A Breakdown of How the Goal Amount is Split
The majority of the goal amount is to pay for the art production of Glitter Vipers: this includes the drawing/inking, the colours and the design elements of putting the book together. 
The next biggest elements are the printing costs (currently based on a modest-to-large print run) and the shipping costs of sending copies out to those who back for physical reward tiers. Costs of shipping have been worked out based on impending Royal Mail price changes taking effect on July 1st 2020. Due to COVID-19 and changes in legislation for USPS in America, international shipping will be rising significantly, but we are baring this in mind in the planned goal amount and postage prices. 
The smallest element is to go on extra rewards elements, like the stickers. 
As such, the greatest overall chunk of the the goal amount we are asking for is to cover the production cost and to make sure our art team get a good, speedy payment for their hard work. 
Sample colours by Kelly Fitzpatrick
What Can I Get?
Well, naturally we are looking to provide both digital and print options of the book as reward tiers. In this day and age, there's no excuse to not offer both options to backers, so both will be readily available. 
There is also a tier to get multiple copies of the book, at a discounted price! This is primarily for comic stores that would like to support and stock the book, but also libraries and heck, if a group of friends all want to support but are on a budget, or you think you know a group of friends or family who'd all be interested in a copy, you can back at that level to get multiple copies at discount. This level is limited.  
There are options to get signed copies of the book, signed by writer Joe Glass, but again these are limited due to the time and energy taken in signing a lot of books can take.
We also have Glitter Vipers stickers available, so you can grab reward tiers with those included. 
Sample of the Embroidered Patch
Or, why not grab an embroidered Glitter Vipers patch! This is a very limited reward tier, so once it's gone, it's gone. Get it while you can! 
Plus, there's just the positive energy of knowing you've supported a great, queer focused comic project by queer creators, and that's worth everything, right! 
Finally, we have been sure to include the price of postage so when you back, you'll know exactly how much it will be in total. We've based the postage prices on the updated Royal Mail pricing coming into effect on July 1st, 2020, based on the planned sizing of the book and estimated weight.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sometimes life gets in the way, and unforeseen obstacles pop up causing a delay in getting the products shipped in time. In this campaign, we have estimated a lot of time for completion and printing, so all things being equal there shouldn't be a delay to the books going out, but as ever, it is an estimate. 

Likewise, as far as postage goes, we have sourced good, strong, tough packaging that should withstand any handling from delivery services. Similarly, we have taken into account the new postal rates for sending to the United States from the UK, and have priced accordingly. This does mean International postage costs are higher, but with the changes in USPS and increases in general post costs due to COVID-19, it is worked out to be as fair and cheap as possible, while still maintaining a relatively speedy and well-handled delivery. 

The biggest challenge is the goal amount: while it can seem large, the goal is what it is to allow for making sure the team are all paid fairly for the books production, the printing of a good sized print run and shipping. The biggest help to overcome this challenge is to share and spread the word of the campaign, so for all of you deciding to support, we hope you can help us in spreading the word too.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

So Glitter Vipers is fast-approaching completion, so I imagine digital editions will be very soon. We'll be sending to the printers around the same time, and I'm going to try and tie-in some time off from the day job (I'm a key worker, so I am working during the lockdown restrictions here in Wales) so I can focus on packing and shipping the physical rewards as quickly as possible. campaign.story:
What is it?
While other great queer themed conventions and fairs exist in NYC, the NYC Queer Comic Fair is the first fair in NYC geared entirely towards queer sequential art (comics, graphic novels, illustrated stories, photo-comics, or any other interesting take on the medium of still-visual storytelling and/or illustration). The event is excited for its 4th year and is organized by WabiSabiZinez and Pat Rielly. NYCQCF is proudly hosted by BGSQD.
Doable Guys and Ship Jumper Comic
What have people have said?
Danial Stalter attended last year for the first time and said, "I have grown to love small conventions with low table prices. When they cater to niche markets and communities that I’m a part of, that’s even better." And, "[NYCQCF is] a great opportunity to meet a bunch of other queer creators in a way that I don’t always get to when tabling."
In 2017 Hornet reported on the fair, highlighting eleven of the show's participants.
Also in 2017, the creator of the NYCQCF popped up on Comic Book Bears podcast to discuss the fair and its participants with the hosts. 
Artist James Dillenbeck liked the show so much he did the cover art for the Kickstarter this year!
John Jenson cavorting with creator of Kyle's Bed and Breakfast
When and where is it?
The event will be hosted by The Bureau of General Services Queer Division (BGSQD) on Saturday and Sunday, April 11th-12th, from 1-7pm each day.
The Bureau of General Services Queer Division (BGSQD) is located on the second floor of The LGBT Center NYC (208 W 13th St).
Come in costume for a free zine!
How do I participate?
Back this project at the vendor level to participate!
Space is limited to sixteen vendors each day. Tables are shared, with each vendor getting about 2 1/2 ft. by 2 1/2 ft. 100% of funds raised go to space, promotional materials, advertising, and Kickstarter fees. There are no refunds for vendors who cancel after the Kickstarter has ended.
The NYCQCF is dedicated to staying small and only using queer spaces; we believe in keeping costs as low as possible and providing the best possible experience for building community. If you wish to vend but cannot afford the table cost, contact us through this page and hardship accommodations may be reached. If you know artists who would improve the diversity of the show, help build community, or simply need to have their work seen put them in contact.
The NYCQCF does take volunteers. Mostly we need folks to direct traffic, hand out programs, and count heads. Additionally, it would a great help to have folks promoting on their campuses, social groups, and social media; contact us if you would like digital flyers or content to print and distribute. 
Carlo Quispe of Uranus Comics and contributor to World War 3 magazine,
New Addition: A Zine Anthology
This year we are proud to add an anthology zine as part of the fair. All of the funds raised by the zine go directly to promoting the fair, which means promoting the artists who make the fair happen! As a result, we are adding a backer level for the zine; that means, even if you can't be with us physically, you can join the fun with an 5.5x8.5 hand assembled zine. 
In addition to the artists at the fair, the zine will feature artists who couldn't be with us this year. So far, contributors are coming from all over the US, as well as a contributor from Canada and another from Spain! 
NOTE: You too can be in the zine! All are welcome to submit! I'd love to make this a thick mean zine! To submit your queer comics, illustration, poetry, writing, game rules, paintings, musings, photos, send them as a JPG or DOCX to WabiSabiZinez@gmail.com. 
SUBMISSION FORMAT: 5.5x8.5 in size or fits within that size, no more than three pages of content, a three sentence (max) bio, and you instagram handle. NSFW is 100%. 
JOIN THESE CONTRIBUTORS:
But what about...
Please direct any questions through the contact button on this page.

support.title: Official Waitlist and a WSZ Postcard
support.descp:
By request, this is the official waitlist.
By backing at this level you secure your spot on the waitlist once all others vending options are taken. Fill in vendors will be first-come-first-serve. The remaining price for the table will be paid via venmo or cash if cancelation happens after the Kickstarter ends; if a cancelation happens before the end of the Kickstarter you can switch over your pledge.
There are no refunds for this level after the Kickstarter is over, but there will be unending gratitude for your donation to the event. Additionally, as a backer, you will receive updates about the event AND a heads-up on next year's signup.
If that's not enough, we will also send you a WabiSabiZinez postcard!

updates.update_content:
Books are coming in! Please tag photos on Instagram with @nycqueercomicfair and @Wabi_Sabi_Zinez! You can also post photos to the Facebook pages of the same names!
If you have any issues, email wabisabizinez@gmail.com!
Cheers!

Hi friends!
I’m happy to announce that all anthologies have been packaged and are ready to ship (see photo below)! It really is a nice chuck of queer work! 75 creators in all genres: photography, poetry, comics, painting, illustration, playlists, essays, collage — I can’t wait to do a second volume next year!
My goal is to get to the post office in the next two weeks. I’m trying to plot which one to go to and when it will be the least busy. I’ll post another update when they go out.

Hi beautiful backers,
I just wanted to check in and let you know the books came in and I’ve been packing orders but won’t mail them until after the general restrictions in NYC are lifted. Right now that date is June 8th.
The book looks really good! What was planned as a photocopy zine turned into a professionally bound book with soooooooo many artists from all over the world. It isn’t perfect, but it’s an amazing first issue of what I believe will become a yearly anthology of queer content. I think everyone will find something fun, something funny, something beautiful, and a few folks might find something shocking.

Hi Friends,
As part of my other Kickstarter campaign I promised discounted books for backers. I'm extending this offer to both Kickstarts I ran this year. My perviously published books that are not part of any Kickstarters have been discounted down to 4.99-6.99$ (i.e. no profit). 
These books come directly from the printer who is reporting NO DELAYS in shipping. I hope these books bring some cheap and fun distraction during quarantine.

Hi all!
I hope you’re holed up somewhere safe with all the hand sanitizer and toilet paper you need, along with a stack of good books to read as you ride out the apocalypse.
We are in the last 19 hours of the WabiSabiZinez Kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/wabisabizinez/two-queer-poetry-and-art-books-with-a-wabi-sabi-punk-aesthetic Three books and a DIY oracle are available! As are PDFs of some works.

updates.update_content: As I get info I will provide more updates. This is the message from our wonderful and generous hosts...

Hi all!
It happened! The Kickstarter made it thanks to your help — either as a backer or a participant! THANK YOU!
Right now NYC is a little crazy with the virus afoot. In terms of the fair itself, only events through March have been canceled or postponed. I’m waiting, anxiously and hopefully, to hear about April.
OH MY! So many contributors! It just keeps growing!

campaign.story:
The world of SOME STRANGE DISTURBANCES explores contemporary LGBTQ issues using Victorian England as a backdrop. Featuring three characters who are crafty, testy, and human, SOME STRANGE DISTURBANCES situates itself amongst Victorian horror legends like Mary Shelley, Edgar Allen Poe and others. 
From SOME STRANGE DISTURBANCES #1
This series is dear to my heart, as it is incredibly important for members of the LGBTQ community to see themselves as thriving, surviving characters in fictive works, but it is also incredibly important for members of the LGBTQ community to understand the history of oppression we have faced & overcome & continue to struggle against. Straight allies, we'd love to have you along for the ride, too; there's a lot for you here. You can equally enjoy & learn from this series as well.
For those of you new to the series:
The setting of Victorian London opens a lot of avenues for social commentary about the present day. In addition, the story is populated with characters who are indelible:
Prescott Mayfair, a closeted homosexual hiding from his family in America AND from the police in London, where being gay is an arrestable offense. Prescott comes from a line of psychics (usually the women in his family), and he is still not sure he accepts this gift.
Delilah Quinton, a black choral performer now in London as part of a sponsored choral group. Performing nightly, she uses her experiences from travelling across the United States with the Great Negro Mesmerist, Lord DuBois. In Victorian London, race is handled differently: as long as you are of a certain class, skin color is irrelevant. So as a celebrity, Miss Quinton has many privileges not afforded to others of her culture.
The Comtesse, a young woman thought to be possessed by her parents. They hire Prescott to investigate if she is lost to them. But the Comtesse has a deeper story that would be spoiled here.
PLAN OF ACTION
Here are a few reviews of Volume 1, The Rat King of Bedlam:
http://highlowcomics.blogspot.com/2019/06/hurd-mckenney-gervasio-aon-some-strange.html
http://www.roguesportal.com/review-some-strange-disturbances-1/
https://graphicpolicy.com/2019/09/14/review-some-strange-disturbances/?fbclid=IwAR3rQwnWsdv1FAvIXcP5Jf7cGtHdm51X7OCTabMaGsqtHs9NSMEhwhoAutk
From SOME STRANGE DISTURBANCES #1
Volume 2, THE LUNCHROOM UNDER THE ARCH, will be a 100-page, b&w graphic novel written by Craig Hurd-McKenney and illustrated by Gervasio & Carlos Aon, Cover by Tyler Smith Owings, Graphic Design by Keeli McCarthy, and Editorial Assistance by Shon Bacon. NOTE: All funds raised in the campaign will go to pay Gervasio and Carlos for their artwork. You & your pre-orders are vital to this project's growth! UPDATE: If we go over the proposed $6000, all extra funds will go to the artists, up to $10,000 total. Beyond that, funds will go to paying the graphic designer. I will cover any remaining costs, like the cost of the cover artwork, editorial & design fees, printing, and marketing/ shipping/ distribution that we do not make in the campaign. 
From SOME STRANGE DISTURBANCES #1
Kickstarter Supporter Rewards...
Tote Bag
 Lovely canvas tote with the Headless Shakespeare Press logo, designed by Constance Kwinn.
Headless Shakespeare Press Logo Tote
Paper Dolls by Gervasio & Carlos Aon
With this tier, you'll get a paperdoll set of all three main characters!
Prescott Mayfair Paper Doll
The Comtesse Paper Doll
Delilah Quinton Paper Doll
Art Prints
You have four prints to choose from, and they are all wonderful interpretations of the SSD world!
Print 1 is by Dietrich O Smith, artist on "Victor LaValle's Destroyer," a modern "sequel" to Frankenstein.
Art Print by Dietrich Smith (Not Final Version)
 Print 2 is by Katie Skelly, creator of "My Pretty Vampire." Katie's women are smart, sexy and not taking your >bleep<.
Art print by Katie Skelly
 Print 3 is by Richard Case, artist on Grant Morrison's "Doom Patrol," "Doctor Strange, Sorcerer Supreme," and others. Richard creates immersive worlds, filled with unease and horror.
Art Print by Richard Case (Not Final Version)
 Print 4 is by Dame Darcy, creator of "Meat Cake." Darcy's work is incredibly playful, and she has created one of my favorite characters ever in Strega Pez.
Art Print by Dame Darcy
Sample BRONTES Pages by Rick Geary 
 Rick has also drawn "Doom Patrol" and his creator-owned "Victorian Murder" and "XXth Century Murder" series are phenomenal. 
BRONTES Sample 1
BRONTES Sample 2
BRONTES Sample 3
BRONTES Painted Art by Rick Geary
Original Art by Rick Geary
BRONTES Painted Art by Rick Geary
STRETCH GOALS
We reach $7000:  everyone will get thanked in the back of the book because it truly takes every single one of you helping in order to make the project happen. I can't thank you all enough!
I will also include the 4 original art prints in a pin-up section in the book.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my 8th comic project, so I have the project management down to a science. The only possible challenge would be delays in shipping since I am a one person operation. I plan to resolve any such occurrence by calling in help as needed.

I also know that shipping looks a bit daft, but I am using a carrier that offers insurance and tracking. While it is more expensive, it allows for the package to arrive in a secure, pristine condition. No fold-ups, mash-ups or crush-ups for you, dear readers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: International Orders Out! Final Thoughts! COLD WINTER'S EVE!
updates.update_content:
Final project update: all orders are now out in the world. Again, I can't thank you all enough for your support and your patience. I think the wait was worth it. I'm so excited for you to get and read your books. 
Behind the Curtain 1: I had a typo in the script and Delilah's last name will appear with two different spellings in the version you're getting. The file has already been updated with the printer, so it is fixed for future editions.

All domestic orders have shipped -- with the exception of 3 orders I don't have addresses for. 
International orders will be shipped tomorrow. My plan was to ship them today, but I ran into a work issue that needed attention.
Again, thank you all so much for your patience and help with the project.

I'm packaging as I type. But I wanted to let you know that PDFs have all been emailed. 
For those who have other swag to go out in the mail, I'll have all of that out by Tuesday afternoon PST at the latest. For some of you, I'll be reaching out via email because Kickstarter changed their backer files and some of your info is missing. Not everyone...but a handful.

The books have arrived. Here is the reveal video:
https://www.instagram.com/tv/CLXg4KOl_KY/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link
Like I say in the video, I'll be packing this week and shipping this weekend. You all are awesome...sending all my best to you as we try and stay warm during this bizarre time.

Well, I hope everyone is staying safe and warm. I know power is out in many states. I am holding you all in my thoughts as I type this.
In Seattle, we had over a foot of snow. So we've dug ourselves out. Had some rain last night and it seems to have started the melting process. But there is still A LOT of snow.
Books were stuck in Florida due to weather, but are now in Seattle as of this morning. But today is the President's Day Holiday, so no mail service today. I am hoping to have the books tomorrow and then I'll work evenings and into the weekend to get everything out in the mail to you all, street safety pending.

updates.update_userinfo: BOOKS WILL BE HERE ON FRIDAY
updates.update_content:
I am all set up and ready to package as soon as they arrive.
I had some work delays, so PDFs AND packages will all go out at the same time. 
I can't thank you enough for your patience...we are relearning everything thanks to the pandemic.

I heard back from the printer; they should have the books shipped by February 2nd, but will send sooner if they can. I will take a few days to get everything packed once they arrive, and will follow up with you then.
I will start sending PDFs shortly (likely this weekend). FYI the book goes live on Comixology on January 27th.

updates.update_userinfo: BOOK OFF TO PRINTER BY END OF WEEK!
updates.update_content: Thank you, thank you, thank you for your patience! The pandemic has had such an impact, and you all have been amazing in letting us find our way to getting you the best product possible. By the end of this week, I'll have the file off to the printer. Fingers crossed, I'll have the books in about 2 weeks from submission. As usual, I will keep you posted.
So another quick update...the book is in pre-production! That means Keeli is prepping the book to go to press, creating all the files and designing the book. To that, here is a holiday sneak peak:

campaign.story:
Crush: First Love, New Talent is a comics anthology devoted to stories of first love told from a variety of LGBTQAIU perspectives. This book features 24 stories about first dates, sneaky feelings, awkward moments, flights of fancy, and the kind of self-discovery that only queer romance can deliver.  Crush will be co-edited by Tara Madison Avery (We're Still Here, ALPHABET, The Transgender Heroes Coloring Book) and Viktor Kerney (Strangelore, Prism Comics board member), and the book will feature over 200 pages of all-new comics content. Crush will be published by Stacked Deck Press, a publishing house focused on comics and coloring books of queer interest.
cover design and artwork by Hayden Harwood
In order to get out the word about Crush to aficionados of queer comics, Stacked Deck Press will be working with Prism Comics and the City of West Hollywood to promote this very special book. With the help of Prism, we've conducted a talent search for new crop of queer cartoonists, artists, and writers just starting their careers. In particular, we've made a special effort to reach out to creators of emerging identities: asexual, genderqueer, aromantic, polyamorous, and more. The City of West Hollywood will be providing us with a book launch party in the City Council Room at the West Hollywood Public Library as part of their 2019 Pride celebration, where contributors to the book will read their stories from the book.
from "The Calamansi Tree" by Jaime Aguilar
Crush will feature stories from these creators:
Jaime Aguilar
AmyEYE
atelierMuse
Tate Brombal and V. Gagnon
Caroline Cao and Marie Wu
Mylo Choy
Mike Ciriaco and Terry Blas
Caterina Gerbasi and Bea Gomez Casal
Rachel Gorman
Katya Granger
Hayden Harwood
Mei Lian Hoe
Skylar Kardon
E.J. Oakley
Can Richards
Max Spragovsky
Daniel Stalter and Eleanora Kortsarz
Ravi Teixeira
Twolle and Lyn Straine
Stefani Vlusha
Letty Wilson
Cin Woodworth and Hendrick Kneeland
Priscilla Wu and Teloka Berry
Potassium Wisteria

from "I Put a Spell on You" by Tate Brombal and V. Gagnon
The stories include tales about a Virtual Rock Star who has a robotic body built to pursue the woman of their dreams, a hesitant "Third Wheel" being accepted into a polyamorous relationship, an 18th Century "Lady" whose lover rightly accepts him as a lord, and a Master Craftswoman whose Queen desires more from her than just a new means of transportation!
from "Luminous" by Letty Wilson
First love is tricky enough when you're straight, but downright confounding when you're on the LGBTQAIU spectrum. Whether you're an Ace discovering that loving a person doesn't have to include sex, a young man having that first relationship with an Older Gentleman that changes the direction of your life, or an Aromantic Demon finding a surprising exception to his fun-only rule, Crush tells stories that ring true to queer experience.
from "Many Lovers for a First Love" by Hayden Harwood
Budget and stretch goals
Our budget includes funds for printing, manufacturing the backer rewards, shipping, Kickstarter fees, and most importantly creator compensation. This is the first time most of our contributing creators will have their work in print, and we want to make sure that they get used to receiving a paycheck as they launch their careers in comics.
Budget
Printing: $9,500.00
Creator compensation: $5,500.00
Kickstarter and credit card fees: $1,700.00
Shipping and postage: $1,000.00
Rewards cost: $1,000.00
Miscellaneous: $500.00
Total: $19,200.00
Our main and only stretch goal will be increasing creator compensation once we have met our initial goal! 
from "In Bloom" by Cin Woodworth and Hendrick Kneeland
Backer Rewards:
 Digital edition of Crush: First Love, New Talent 
 Print edition of Crush: First Love, New Talent 
 Tote bag featuring an all-new design by a Crush contributor
 Sticker set featuring samples of artwork from the book
 Coloring book from the Stacked Deck Press series of historical LBGTQ coloring books
 Original sketches from Crush contributors
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Why such a quick turnaround time on this project and how do you expect to meet it?

The city of West Hollywood is providing us some logistical and limited financial support to help us meet this deadline, However, the contributors to Crush have already finished their stories, and our printing schedule is already worked out. During this Kickstarter campaign we will be preparing the book for print so that it can be sent to the printer immediately upon funding. This will ensure we meet our goals in a timely manner. 

Will the rewards packages be ready in time for estimated delivery?

In the past complicated rewards packages have greatly extended our fulfillment time. Considering this, we have decided to keep our rewards simple. We have experience with sticker sets and tote bags, and vendors already in place to provide them. Crush contributors are already aware that they may be asked to provide original sketches for the backers. The coloring book reward for the Crush Kickstarter campaign will be for one of our already published titles, meaning we will not have any holdups filling backer rewards as we put together a whole new coloring book.

Will the rewards ship in a timely manner?

In order to ensure prompt shipping, Stacked Deck Press has procured the help of a wholesale shipping service, greatly expediting the shipping process. A simpler rewards package structure will also mean that all of the items for the rewards will be ready upon arrival of the books themselves, further expediting shipping.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: AB5 DURING COVID-19 FOR CALIFORNIA FREELANCERS
updates.update_content: BELOW IS INFO FROM A LAWYER FRIEND OF MINE PERTAINING TO CA'S RECENT AB5 THAT AFFECTS FREELANCERS, LIKE THOSE WHO CONTRIBUTED TO CRUSH. DURING THIS PERIOD OF ECONOMIC UNCERTAINTY, FREELANCE ARTISTS AND WRITERS ARE HIT EVEN HARDER THAN MOST, SO IF YOU HAVENT ALREADY AND ARE IN A POSITION TO DO SO, PLEASE CONSIDER DONATING TO OUR INDIEGOGO: CLICK HERE TO LINK TO OUR INDIEGOGO

Hey everyone!
I just wanted to reach out to make sure everyone is staying safe and healthy. During this quarantine, freelancers like those that contributed to this book, are hit hardest by the sudden changes in our economy. So if you have the resources, and havent done so already, please consider donating to our Crush LGBTQ comic book anthology over at our Indiegogo page xo

updates.update_userinfo: Pictures when words won't suffice! Meet Mylo Choy!
updates.update_content:
A lyrical meditation on silence in the face of love!
Mylo Choy is a Brooklyn-based cartoonist and illustrator, and their story for Crush: First Love, New Talent is "Unspoken". This quiet, visually lyrical story deals with the difficulty that queer people can have expressing love. To see more of their fascinating artwork, back Crush today!
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/crush-first-love-new-talent--3/x/6537938?create_edit=true#/

updates.update_userinfo: Crush Contributor Mike Ciriaco Gets Risky
updates.update_content:
To help promote our Crush anthology Indiegogo campaign, Mike Ciriaco, creator of the queer high school comic book Stonewall Prep, has teamed up with photographer jared Alexander Ross to produce a photo homage to the classic 80' film Risky Business. For the rest of this series, be sure to check out Mike's social media:
Facebook

Max Spragovsky is the creator of the self-published comic Woof Galaxy, and his contribution to Crush: First Love, New Talent is a prequel to that series! The story  is about one of Woof Galaxy's core characters, Vik, and his first infatuation at a boarding school for young warriors! Check out this sample of Max's artistic talent below, then back our Indiegogo today!

updates.update_userinfo: Crush Is Back, and We're Raising Funds on Indiegogo!
updates.update_content: This past summer, City of West Hollywood Government's WeHo Arts awarded a grant to produce Crush: First Love, New Talent a queer comic book anthology, which includes the first chapter of my upcoming gay high school series #StonewallPrep (featuring art by Terry Blas).The book launches at WonderCon 2020, but it still needs additional financing for expenses like printing, as well as compensating the many contributors for their talent and hard work. Please hit up our Indygogo link for more info, and if you have the means, any and all donations are appreciated. And if you have a second, please follow us on social media to help promote local queer talent and indy publishing

updates.update_userinfo: We didn't fund successfully, but Crush: First Love, New Talent lives on!
updates.update_content:
We thank each and every one of you for your generous pledges! 
It's been wild 30 days here on Kickstarter, and before anything else we would like to express our sincerest appreciation to all of you who generously pledged to Crush: First Love, New Talent! Though our project did not successfully fund today, our road does not end here! We will keep you informed about upcoming developments with this project and how you can support our goals of getting this special book to print and compensating its exciting and talented creators! After we take some time to evaluate our options and learn a lesson or two, there will be another campaign. We hope that you will support our future efforts to get the work of these future LGBTQAIU comics superstars to readers!

updates.update_userinfo: Less than 48 hours to go! Help us make our goal!
updates.update_content:
A long way to go and a short time to get there!
We are still well short of our goal as we enter the final 48 hours! For those of you who have pledged, we thank you! If you'd be so kind, please get the word out to friends and comics readers who might be interested in Crush: First Love, New Talent!

updates.update_userinfo: Love remains as gender is in flux! Meet Potassium!
updates.update_content:
Love beyond gender and to the stars! 
French trans cartoonist Potassium shares a tale of love that transcends gender in "StarKids"! Check out this preview then back our campaign today! Only 3 days left!

campaign.story:
Experience Raven's first appearance and never before seen special features! 
The award winning PRINCELESS series reprints THE PIRATE PRINCESS story that introduces Raven in a special deluxe hardcover that's 168 pages long! Princess Adrienne, whose on a quest to save her sisters, alongside the blacksmith Bedelia, find another princess locked away in a tower and decide to save her. But Princess Raven has plenty of secrets and Adrienne finds herself pitted against her deadliest opponent yet!
Raven would go on to star in her own critically acclaimed spin-off title, RAVEN: THE PIRATE PRINCESS. This is the perfect hardcover for PRINCELESS and RAVEN fans alike. A great starting point for newcomers who want to see empowering princesses who turn tropes upside down. 
PRINCELESS is a five time Glyph Comics Awards winner and three time Eisner nominee written by Jeremy Whitley. Jeremy has written several other fan-favorite comic book series, including Marvel's The Unstoppable Wasp, Dynamite Entertainment's Rainbow Brite and IDW Publishing's My Little Pony, just to name a few. The Pirate Princess art team features the creative stylings of Ro Stein and Ted Brandt (art team for Crowded by Image Comics). 
When asked about the deluxe hardcover, Jeremy Whitley commented, "It was so nice to finally give the first Raven story the full hardcover treatment. It really is wild that what we started as a free comic book day, eight pages story giveaway, and grew into this arc that not only introduced the world to Raven, but also to the amazing art team of Ro Stein and Ted Brandt. Now with the hardcover collection, readers can see what that evolution looked like as Raven went from being an idea to a character that would launch her own series." 
This volume of PRINCELESS highlights diversity, strength in self, feminism, LGBTQ+ themes and rewrites classic fairy tale tropes in a way suitable for children of all ages. Check out the rewards below, followed by what fans are saying about PRINCELESS, and preview pages from the book!

Here's what fans had to say about PRINCELESS: 
“…this one takes the crown for being child friendly while still being a comic that adults can get into.” (Flip Geeks)
“Whether you’re buying for yourself or for a child, regardless of your gender, Princeless: Pirate Princess is a solid book and absolutely worth picking up this week.” (Capeless Crusader)
“…works for both new and returning readers.” (Newsrama)
 “This book was wonderful. It has some much to offer both old and new fans.” (Amazon Customer Review)
PRINCELESS BOOK 3: THE PIRATE PRINCESS DELUXE HARDCOVER Preview!

I just got word that the Hardcover is printed and has arrived in port in the US.  We expect it to clear customs and be delivered to us around 12/11. We are trying our best to make sure everyone receives the books before Christmas!

campaign.story:
Welcome back to Velvet Collar, Issue #2, Rough Trade Secrets.
With returning characters Abel, Billy, Page, Daddy and Storm, plus amazing new characters, the series continues to talk about male escorts and sexual politics from the real stories and perspectives of the men themselves. The series pivots into an adventure of espionage and intrigue while always keeping the humanity of the men present and in front.
If you have just found out about Velvet Collar, you can look up info on the series Gay Comic Geek YouTube and T+S Magazine Review 
Issue 2 will be a WHOPPING 44 pages of full-color, original art and story by Byron Power,   Pup Tut and Dave Davenport.  
BUT FIRST...
Thank you to all our original kick-starter backers and new fans for helping make issue #1 a total success! Upon publication of issue 2, backers who pre-ordered issue 2 will get their promised copy of issue 2 in digital or paper at no additional expense.                                      We remember you and we honor you!
With your help, we hope to complete issues #2 and #3!  We appreciate your patience and understanding while health and personal emergencies behind the scenes have been resolved. This was worth the wait!
ABOUT ISSUE 2 AND THE SERIES
Velvet Collar issue 2, Rough Trade Secrets, picks up two years after the events of issue 1. The five main characters are summoned by a mysterious stranger to find out that their problems are far from over. 
 Each character developed in the series comes from real people. Sometimes you will wonder, "Did this actually happen?"
When the plot becomes (almost) impossible to believe, the fears, hopes and dreams of real people are seen and felt through the characters you read about. Most of the experiences and choices of the characters come from real choices that workers have had to make. When their experiences and survival is criminalized and exploited, fantasy is often the safest place to tell the truth. Don't you want to find out?
Since the publication of issue 1, more than fifty real workers from around the world have come in to contribute their thoughts, concerns, jokes and amazing stories to be included in the planned nine issues. Would you be excited if this comic could become a #NetflixSeries? 
The most wonderful comments have been from people who didn't even know that these professionals existed: 
"His Daughter actually said that? OMG!" -Nancy, Helicopter Mom CEO, 60, NYC
"I had no idea that guys who did this work could be so different and be happy." -Kelly, Insurance Leg Broker, 45, Las Vegas.
"This was hot, my friends are really excited to see what's next," -Nathan, Retail Surgeon, 24, Miami.
This comic series has been driven by real people contributing to the work from day one. That means the men in the business and YOU, our backers, friends and allies.
This comic is part of how marginalized voices #Resist. Places to speak openly about LGBTQ+ sexuality, identity, and the overlap with capitalism and politics, are being shut down. Tumblr, Facebook, Instagram and many other places on the internet have been censored, shuttered, or aggressively policed for content threatening to the status quo. How's that working out for everybody? 
 Your help supporting this project and others like it are part of how you make a difference. Art and storytelling from marginalized voices is powerful.  And why not make it fun?
Velvet Collar is the  first comic series to focus on the lives of modern male-identified adult industry workers.  Explicitly, these are experiences of professionals who have voluntarily participated in the industry as legally recognized adults. This is not the same as  those who have entered sex work against their will. The work does not endorse illegal activity. This work talks about what actually happens with both adult industry members and the people they are involved with. 
SPECIAL NEW FEATURES
We have signed up more than 40 reaL professionals to be illustrated as characters in upcoming issues. They tell the stories of the workers they represent. Best of all, you can say hello to them on social media! Great icebreaker, right?
REWARDS AND RISKS
We have all the classic awesome rewards plus a few new ones!
We have collectible stickers that make great gifts, an additional comic from a another project done by our colorist Byron Power, and a special limited edition collectible from Scott Reynolds, who plays the character Daddy in the series.  More coming!
 WHAT WE NEED THE MONEY FOR
MAIN GOAL: $8,000
Because of the success of issue 1, we are able to keep our costs for production the same for issue 2 and offer more to you. We need $5,000 for the art production, $2000 for printing and $1000 for taxes and materials (envelopes, packaging, promotional materials). 
STRETCH GOAL, $10,000+
Issue 3 is planned to be 52 pages. Wow. Almost double the size of issue 1 That's huge. But getting to this stretch goal will allow to put that issue into production and have it ready by as soon as March 2020 (maybe sooner!)
campaign.risks:

Unfortunately 10 percent of shipped books were lost and mishandled in the postal service system. For advanced rewards, tracking and security measures are being increased. Any book that does not arrive will be replaced at no additional charge to you.

updates.update_userinfo: First paper copies are going out!
updates.update_content: Paper copies are starting to head to the post office tomorrow!

The books have arrived!!
Digital Copies start going out tonight!

Thank you for your patience. We have hit many bumps along the way to get this publication to the printers. It seems as if when one error is corrected, two more have popped up. As of today, a correct version for printing is with the printers and under review for the third time. I hope to have these out to you soon and hope to avoid further delays.

Books are on their way to me to distribute to all of you.  
If you are a backer and got a sketch as part of your rewards,  please let me know if you want paper or digital!

Thank you again everyone for supporting the creation of Velvet Collar Issue 2! 
We are in the final editing stages and going to print soon.  Made sure all our backers get a proper thank you in the book, getting stickers printed and arranging with artists to get autographs for printed copies. When we have the books, copies and digitial copies will be going out (about Sept 4-10).

We did it! 
Preparing the final book now after recovering from health issues.
Made the whole Thank you page for you and then the computer crashed. Whole file wiped, so have to start again. D'oh!
We are also delighted to announce that Byron Power will be the lead artist for issue 3. We are happy we will be bringing you issue 3 sooner and will keep working to make the quality even better.

Thank you to everyone helped us get to 68% of our goal. We have just a few days left across the finish line. And everyone I made a mistake. I didn't realize thought having another charity connected with the project would be a problem. I am officially withdrawing the offer of the earlier post. You may donate to the Trevor project separately but it is not connected to this project.   I'm sorry for the confusion please continue to support the art team.

Amazing news! There is a kickstarter donor willing MATCH donations to  the Trevor Project! Now your donations help LGBTQ+ art AND kids in the  community! Go to https://www.thetrevorproject.org and make a donation,  then send a screen shot of your donation in PM.

Thank you everyone! We are at 47 percent of our funding goal and we have 54 percent of our time remaining! 
We have a new kickstarter reward we just added! If you like the performers Seth Knight, you'll love this reward!
Please send your comments and questions asap!

campaign.story:
Physician, Heal Thyself
I am launching this Kickstarter to fund the sixth issue of SHIRTLIFTER, a 64 page collection of 15 short autobiographically themed comics. Two thirds of the comics are from anthologies published over the past ten years; one third is new, unpublished work.
BACKGROUND:
I have been self-publishing SHIRTLIFTER since 2006. SHIRTLIFTER is a venue for me to draw comics that explore various aspects of gay culture, and each issue has had its own identity: SHIRTLIFTER  1 was a short story about an ex-pat couple living in Tokyo; SHIRTLIFTER 2 was a collection of short autobiographical pieces that had been created over a five year period, plus some new work; and SHIRTLIFTER 3 - 5 serialized my graphic novel "Unpacking", documenting the relationship between a gay guy and a straight, married man.
SHIRTLIFTER 6 is a sequel of sorts to the second issue, featuring a number of autobiographical short pieces authored over the past 10 years. I'm sort of an accidental autobiographer; when I started doing comics I really had no intention of doing them, and the majority of pages I have produced over the 17 years I have been drawing comics are straight up fiction. However, when thinking about stories, sometimes the issues I want to bring up are ones in which I have personal experience; in that context, inventing some thinly-veiled fictional avatar to stand in for me seems pointless. There is a power in having the events be real, or as "real" as my biased perspective can possibly make them. Fictionalization is an inescapable part of all memoir, and these comics are no different: people have been combined, dialogue has been invented or distorted by memory, body fat has been trimmed down. The results are emotionally and thematically accurate to the events of my life, if always literally true.
Vacant Lots
Two thirds of this book consists of short pieces that were created and published in anthologies between 2008 and 2018. Some of these anthologies, such as  QU33R  and ALPHABET, were comics focused, while others, such as I LIKE IT LIKE THAT and QUEERS WERE HERE, were prose-oriented but asked me to contribute. Much of this work has been been virtually unseen, and the two stories from prose anthologies are appearing in color for the first time.
One of the Guys
SHIRTLIFTER 6 will also include a 17 page suite of extremely short stories that I have worked on in collaboration with my husband, Todd Brower. This group of short short stories, between 1 - 4 pages in length, are an attempt to show, in a humorous way, the dynamics of our relationship. The back and forth in the comics mirrors the back and forth between us in writing these stories; at this  point I honestly don't know who wrote what; both of us generated ideas and scripts, and then watched as the other revised the other's ideas, changed dialogue, changed ending. It's definitely a product of both of us, which is appropriate, given the subject matter. 
Death Shark
Funiculì! Funiculà!
Todd also wrote two of the other stories in this collection, "Food for Thought" and "Ex Communication" the latter of which was included in the BEST AMERICAN COMICS 2010 anthology. 
Ex Communication
I'm very happy to be able to finally have enough autobiographical material to fill another issue. The next project I will be working on is fiction, so it will be a while before I do any more autobiographical comics. Then again, when I started out I had not intention of doing any, so who knows? I shouldn't make promises I might not keep.
The Shortest Distance
STRETCH GOALS:
The goal for the campaign is the minimum needed to cover the printing costs. If the campaign exceeds the minimum, the following stretch goals will become possible.
$4000 - Improved paper stock
$5000 - Exclusive print to all backers at the $10 level and above
Omisoka
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the second Kickstarter I have run by myself, in addition to assisting with my publisher Northwest Press to collect my Unpacking story into one graphic novel. One thing that I have learned is to keep things simple, and not overpromise too many crazy, time intensive rewards. The issue is almost, but not-quite, finished as this Kickstarter is being launched, and I anticipate having books back from the printer by mid-May. This means backers should have their ebooks, signed copies and prints by the end of May (international orders will take slightly longer). T-shirts will take slightly longer, but no more than a few weeks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
