updates.update_content:
Hey there.
Just giving a quick update: physical books have gone out to about 65% of you; the rest will be going out in the next week, because I have been waiting for shirts from the printer. However, after a few delays, the t-shirts and tanks are ready, so I am ready to start sending out packages to people who pledged for reward tiers that included clothing.

213 of you pledged to make this comic book happen, and I want to thank you so much for your time time and interest and support. Surveys will be going out in the next week or two, so that I can get addresses (and T-shirt information if you pledged for one). Thank you all again, and hope you enjoy the book when you get it!

We passed the 200% funded threshold today. Thank you to all of you. With 5 days left this places the book in very healthy place -- thank you so much.
For those of you that are interested in such things, here is a little time lapse preview of the contents of the book, from the proof I made just before sending it off to the printer (hence all the green ink all over it). You'll all be seeing the real thing in the next month or two.

I just received some more "Unpacking" softcovers, so I am increasing the number of rewards available on the "Everything Everything" level, which I had limited in quantity to 20. 10 more slots are now available, so if anyone had wanted to pledge for this tier and it was unavailable, you now have the opportunity to change, if you'd like.

The campaign passed 5K last night, which means that the second stretch goal I had listed in the campaign will be met! Everyone who pledged to receive a paper copy of the magazine will receive a special print  - more like a bookplate that can fit into the book -- which is only available through this Kickstarter.
Those of you who pledged to for an 8 x 11 archival print will still receive that reward, which will be a different illustration, in addition to the bookplate.

The campaign crossed over the 4K mark yesterday, so that means I will be able to print on a thicker paper stock. Which will be nice - that always helps the comics feel more substantial. Even if the subject matter isn't weighty, the paper will be. :)
Worked on revisions last night -- getting really close to being ready to send it to the printer. A big push this weekend should be able to put me through to the complete stage.

No sooner do I make and post that video, but we cross the threshold to 100% funded. This means that issue six will go forward on schedule. 
There are still 18 days left on the project, so if people continue to support, this means we will definitely be upgrading the paper stock, among other possibilities.
I will begin sending out individual emails, but I would like to take the opportunity to thank to every one of you for your support. I couldn't do this without you.

Ok never post an update from an Ipad, I don't know what happened to the text there, but lets try this again.
No sooner do I make and post that video, but we cross the threshold to 100% funded. This means that issue six will go forward on schedule. 
There are still 18 days left on the project, so if people continue to support, this means we will definitely be upgrading the paper stock, among other possibilities.

project_data.project_name: SHIRTLIFTER #6

campaign.story:
**************STRETCH GOALS ADDED! SEE BELOW FOR MORE DETAILS!************ 
Like most queer people growing up, I have stories from my days "IN THE CLOSET!" While I was born this way, it wasn't always easy to express who I was as a gay man. From a young age, I latched onto comics filled with superheroes, creepy storytellers and strange tropes that told tales of people who were alien and different, characters that people feared and hated. From this place was birthed, THE CLOSET OF SECRETS #1!
THE CLOSET OF SECRETS is a black and white anthology-style comic, filled with three tales of queer horror. It will be standard comic book size, with the book being printed at 6.7” x 10.2" with a color cover. Recommend for ages 13 and over as there are adult themes. 
Join our narrator who goes by only the name "The Janitor”, as he cleans out his huge hallway of closets and dishes about some pretty interesting secrets found along the way. This mysterious figure weaves you through the first of, what I hope is, many issues of this ongoing series with tales titled: 
"Departure with a Kiss" - Two young girls share their first kiss, but will it be the kiss of death for them?
"A Contract with God" - A devout man finds that some things you do or don't do on earth really do matter in the afterlife. 
"Love Afterlife”, a tale about two young boys who find love after meeting a zombie who served in WWII.
Plus, extra content and bonus activity  pages. 
Inspirations for this series are very much old EC comics, Tales from the Crypt, Outer Limits, Twilight Zone, Tales From the Dark Side, Haunted House and many, many more! I remember reading those tales and their portrayal’s of queer characters as stereotypical tropes - like the wife's hair dresser, who the husband kills because he is jealous and thinks they are lovers. I want to take stories like that and make the queer characters the protagonist and not always the victim. However, as it is horror, I can't promise that will always be the case!  
Now for the budgeting. The money raised by this Kickstarter will be broken down in the approximate ways: 
Printing of the THE CLOSET OF SECRETS #1 and other rewards $1230
Kickstarter Fees $200
Shipping and Handling $200
Any money raised over the Kickstarter Goal will be used to attend comic cons and art fairs to promote and sell more copies of THE CLOSET OF SECRETS #1 and ensure that we get a second issue. 
$2500-The ability to order a larger number of books at a higher discount. It will also cover some of the costs associated to tabling at convention so that I can share this book with more people after the Kickstarter ends. If this goal is reached I will add a preview of "Moon Pack" a future CLOSET OF SECRETS story.
$4000-The creation of a website and the ability to attend cons more and larger comic conventions. If this goal is met I will add a "Fan Club" Package to each person who donated above the $10 level and selected to have something shipped to them. 
I've been making comics and zines since 2009. Most of my work has been around my battle with cancer and comics that deal with narratives around medicine. Even in these early works, you can see my love for monsters and horror comics with the use of a "tumor monster" to represent the disease. Through this work, I’ve slowly started creating one-off tales that encompass more bizarre and supernatural themes. In 2015, I produced Astonishing Queer Tales, a group of zines that focused on horror, crime and bizarre stories that focused on the queer community. Some stories were based on facts, like the story of "The Doodler”, a real serial killer who was active in the 1970's and was never captured. Others were more far out stories like "Pocket Monster", about a night out in Brooklyn that that ends badly. These books were the precursor to this larger project that I'm so excited to share with you. 
REWARDS!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter so I'm sure there is something I have forgotten! But that said, I have worked on a lot of projects and feel that I am in a good place with this book. As the comic is in the final editing phase, I don’t foresee any risks. I just need your support to allow me to share this with the world!
With the release of this Kickstarter, the illustrations for the book are all complete and I'm in the final editing phase.
My main concern is shipping as I have heard nightmares about high shipping costs, both domestically and internationally and just not gathering the proper information from backers. But I have plans in place and will tackle each challenge as they come to make sure that backers are as satisfied and as excited about this project as I am.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Happy New Year's Eve to you all! (New Year to some of our friends!)
I just wanted to take a minute to thank you for backing this year and for helping to make this project a success! Since releasing THE CLOSET OF SECRETS I have shared it with a lot more people than just the Kickstarter and its been an amazing feeling! This year saw the release of my ghost themed oracle deck THIS DECK IS HAUNTED that you may or may not have check out.

It's my dream that we can get some, if not all of the Stretch Goals hit so that the deck can come in a fancy tin box with extra cards and a printed book! updates.update_userinfo: THIS DECK IS HAUNTED Launch September 15th!
updates.update_content:
This update is to inform you of a new horror project I'm releasing on Kickstarter in just a few days!
THIS DECK IS HAUNTED takes my love of ghosts and ghost stories and turns their ideas into an oracle deck for everyday use! Inspired by childhood ghost lore, comics and of course horror movies, this deck takes hauntings and haunted objects and relates them to your everyday life.

Being in our last few hours of the Kickstarter for MYSTIC MALE TAROT I just wanted to send out a final message to thank those of you who have backed or shared this project with your friends. It is so close to hitting its goal and that is because so many of my friends backed it or let people know that it was available. I know tarot is not for everyone but feel like a lot of fans of horror are also lovers of the divining arts and other forms of occult. With just 18 hours and $255 left in our goal I wanted to send this out in case there is anyone who might have been holding off on backing. Now is the time! Let's spread a little light into this world that feels so dark right now.

updates.update_content: I hope you are all staying safe and sound and doing everything you can to combat this crazy coronavirus. With all this crazy going on in the world right now I just wanted to share something positive and uplifting. Today not only marks my 41st rotation around the sun but also the launch of the MYSTIC MALE TAROT deck created and illustrated by me! If you were a fan of CLOSET OF SECRETS I think you will enjoy the imagery and message of this male-centric tarot deck.

Thank you so much for making my first Kickstarter Project such a huge success! While it is not a comic it is still something that I think horror fans and fans of the occult will dig. On March 12 I'll be launching the MYSTIC MALE TAROT DECK.

campaign.story:
What is it? 
The NYC Queer Comic Fair the only fair in NYC geared entirely towards queer sequential art (comics, graphic novels, illustrated stories, photo-comics, or any other interesting take on the medium of still-visual narrative storytelling). The event is organized by WabiSabiZinez and Carmine Street Comics and hosted by BGSQD.
When and where is it? 
The event will be hosted by The Bureau of General Services Queer Division (BGSQD) on Saturday and Sunday, April 27th-28th, from 1-7pm each day. 
The Bureau of General Services Queer Division (BGSQD) is located on the second floor of The LGBT Center NYC (208 W 13th St).
How do I participate? 
Back this project at the vendor level to participate!
Tables are shared with each vendor getting about 2 1/2 ft. by 2 1/2 ft. Vendors will pay $40 for two days, with 100% of funds going to space, promotional materials, advertising, and Kickstarter fees.
Space is limited to sixteen vendors each day; however, the fair can run with a minimum of eight. As the event is organized through Kickstarter, if the eight vendor goal or $320 minimum is not met, no one will be charged and the event will not be held.
There are no refunds for vendors who cancel after the Kickstarter has ended. 
 But what about... 
Please direct any questions through the contact button on this page.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Space is limited to 14 vendors each day; however, the fair can run with a minimum of eight. As the event is organized through Kickstarter, if the eight vendor goal or $320 minimum is not met, no one will be charged and the event will not be held.

There are no refunds for vendors who cancel after the Kickstarter has ended.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We fully expect Spectra Beta to be delivered on time. In the last 12 months we've gone above and beyond to keep risks and challenges minimal. We are committed to building a supreme product that will try to exceed your expectations. 

PRODUCT
Since we are launching on 3 platforms – Web, iOS and Android, the amount of required Testing is massive. Testing is part of the software development cycle and helps fix bugs. It increases the time to market and we might be releasing some features with limited testing in order to receive your feedback. So there is a risk of having some bugs in the beta release. 

TECHNOLOGY 
We have de-risked the technology side of the project by utilizing a modular architecture that allows us to scale and improve Spectra parts on the go. In order to achieve the highest levels of security and uptime, we have deployed on the most secured cloud servers in the world. So technology risk is minimized. Mitigating technology risks has allowed us to focus on external risks.

EXTERNAL RISKS
We believe that our biggest challenge comes from the people in power who discriminate based on gender identity and sexual orientation. Many business development doors are closed to us due to strong homophobic forces in society – and we need your support to overcome those challenges. We need LGBT, LGBTQ, LGBTQ+, LGBTQIA, LGBTQIA+ people to unite with us to fight homophobia together.


As for liabilities and legalities, Spectra is incorporated as Spectra Networks Inc. We are excited to have our backers join us on this journey!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Scott Shoemaker's War on Christmas is an all-star holiday theatrical spectacular coming to Re-Bar in Seattle, Washington, December 7th - 23rd, 2018.
We are established, independent producers in Seattle, best known for our long running cabaret show the Ms. Pak-Man Series, and we are thrilled to be bringing you our new holiday show.  Scott Shoemaker's War on Christmas is a festive night of comedy, songs, dance and general insanity that will hopefully become a new holiday tradition for years to come! 
What to expect from the show:
A hilarious variety show that turns into an even more hilarious original story!
The talents of Seattle superstars Ade, Waxie Moon, Mandy Price, and Faggedy Randy!
Irreverent song parodies and original songs!
Outlandish group dance numbers!
Amazingly crafted costumes and sets!
Devilish debauchery!
Hallucinogenic special effects!
An overdose of holiday cheer!
We have a proven track record of creating quality, well written shows with high production values, and we want to maintain that level of quality for this show. For the past five years, we've produced the Ms. Pak-Man series with a commitment to excellence and attention to detail that have made those shows a success, and we are creating The War on Christmas according to those same values. We feel our audiences deserve the amazing spectacle that we know we can create, but we need some additional investment to bring our vision to life. 
What we need the money for:
We are investing at least $10,000 of our own money in addition to the Kickstarter goal we are asking for. Our personal investment will pay for our performers, crew, advertising, venue and all the typical costs that come with a producing a show. The Kickstarter money will be used for costumes, sets, lighting, audio equipment, video production and props that we will hopefully be able to use not only this year, but for years to come. Here are some of the details:
Construction of at least 14 original costumes, many of which are elaborate and will require specialized design.
A beautiful and stylish custom made set.
The production of video elements for the show. 
Construction of special effects and mind blowing props.
Specialized lights that need to be rented and purchased. 
Rental of wireless audio equipment.
The bare minimum we need to create these items and fulfill these needs is $5000.00. Any additional Kickstarter funds we may receive will allow us to more feasibly produce this show again next year and also add elements to the show that are currently out of our budget.
We have carefully planned our budget and we are confident we can create this sensational show to our standards with your help! We would be so grateful for any donation you would be willing to give, and it is our pledge to make it worth your while! Thank you so much!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are risks with any project of this nature, but we are ready to do this show! The only obstacle we face now is funding. The costuming, sets and special effects are necessary for the show to be the quality our audiences deserve, and those elements are expensive. If we don't make our Kickstarter goal, we will probably not be able to put this show on again next year, and we will likely accumulate a significant amount of debt as a result. This show is not designed to be for profit, it is designed to be an INVESTMENT in future, longer runs.

We are going to make the show happen, one way or another! We just need your help to make it the best it can be and to hopefully create a new holiday tradition!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
So what's this all about?
I'm looking to bring out a paperback version of the first volume of LGBTQ+ superhero series The Pride to bring the comic series to even more people, at a fantastic price. 
 What is The Pride?
The Pride is a comic series about a team of all LGBTQ+ superheroes, representing a broad range of the queer community. Both contextually and metatextually focusing on improved representation and diversity for the community in the superhero format, the comic follows the formation of the team, the individual heroes' personal trials and tribulations and their conflict with a world-threatening villain that they may be the only heroes around capable of stopping. 
Join FabMan, Wolf, Twink, Bear, Angel, Frost, Muscle Mary, White Trash and Cub as they come together to face off against prejudice, the media and of course dastardly super-villains. And then follow them through further adventures as they tackle lucky thieves, bullying, revenge-killers and even a giant evil drag queen. 
The Pride brings all sorts of crazy, fun, wild superhero story adventures for anyone to enjoy. 
What else is it about?
It's also an awesome superhero adventure series consisting a long form main adventure and a series of smaller adventures that build on character and the general drama in a colourful, bright and positive way. 
The Pride by Ricardo Bessa
The paperback book will contain The Pride #1-6, The Pride Adventures #1-4 and behind-the-scenes sketches and designs! 280 pages, at an incredible price!
Wait, you have representation?
Yup, representation is vitally important. Feeling like you are being seen and catered for is a hugely powerful feeling, and despite so many of the LGBTQ+ community being fans of superhero comics and films, it's rare to see people just like them in the medium. 
The Pride aims to change that, with queer heroes as text rather than subtext, and the community as the heroes instead of victims. Featuring gay, lesbian, bi, trans, queer, gender-fluid, drag queens and straight characters working together, and creating a world with the scope to continue building and include more; inclusiveness is a key factor in the series. 
So if you've ever felt like it would be nice to see more of yourself in superhero characters and adventures, then The Pride is for you. And it's also pretty accessible to broad range of ages and demographics whether part of the LGBTQ+ community or not...The Pride is really here for everyone. 
The Pride by Kris Anka
Didn't The Pride get collected before?
Yes, The Pride was successfully Kickstartered and collected as a gorgeous hardcover collection in 2016. 
However, this hardcover is now all but sold out, and it's time to restock with a new edition. 
This time, we're going paperback, to create something that takes up slightly less shelf-space and is available at a much cheaper price to make it accessible to even more people.
The Pride Volume One Paperback edition will contain The Pride #1-6, The Pride Adventures #1-4 and all the behind-the-scenes content of sketches, designs and more, so you'll be getting all that amazing content at an incredible price. 
The Pride by Cory Smith
So why Kickstarter?
This campaign is just to raise the funds to cover the print costs for this new edition, so I can keep bringing The Pride to more people who want and need it, in a new, inexpensive and accessible format. 
No new content to be produced, no new merchandise to produce, just a simple fund raise to cover printing costs for a new edition of the first volume of the LGBTQ+ superhero adventure series only. As such, I'll be running it much more streamlined and straight-forward than usual. 
As you'll see there are just a handful of reward options, for a copy of the book digitally or in the new paperback edition; or with the latest issue The Pride Adventures #5 to add with your book, and even a special option to get a batch of five copies, ideal for stores or groups looking to get the series. 
The button badges designs!
There's also options to get the book with bookmarks, buttons and some our fabulous enamel pins!
Bear Pin, designed by Gavin Mitchell
Angel Pin, designed by Gavin Mitchell
Also, for all single copy tiers, there's free UK shipping!
So please consider joining us on this journey to have fun, accessible and inclusive superhero stories that everyone can enjoy. 
The Pride by Jamal Campbell
About the creator
I'm Joe Glass, the writer and creator of The Pride. I wrote the majority of the series, with two shorts written by Mike Garley and PJ Montgomery in Volume One. I've been making The Pride for around eight years now, and have seen the series go from humble beginnings to an international and broad audience of readers the world over. 
With a wide team of incredible creators (a full list can be found below), I put the series together as it was something I wanted to see in comics, both now and when I was a teen coming to terms with my own sexuality and finding solace in comic books. 
Muscle Mary by Kris Anka
I've run several campaigns in the past, including the hardcover edition of the first volume, a special limited edition pin design, and recently the very first new issue of content in the series. All have been successful, and have either already been fully fulfilled or will be shortly. 
My hope is to keep bringing inclusive, diverse comics out that everyone can enjoy, and for those under-represented by the medium to feel they can be part of it too. And all the while, have fun and be positive in my superhero stories. 
Praise for The Pride
The Pride #1 was one of the Top 25 Best Selling ComiXology Submit Titles of 2014. 
"You should support The Pride because it's an important book, but you should REALLY support it because it's a great read. Fun, smart, high-stakes, but above all heartfelt - full of rich, complex characters sure to become some of your new favorite superheroes." - Scott Snyder, Batman, Justice League, Wytches
"I highly recommend this smart, charming, wonderful book to anyone who likes good comics. It's absolutely a pleasure to read and a clear labor of love." - Gail Simone, Batgirl, Domino, Clean Room
Frost by Maxime Garbarini & Hector Barros
"The Pride manages to deliver a lot of enjoyment with a lot of potential to soothe the queer soul." - Comicosity
"THE PRIDE. Old-School and Progressive at the same time. Classic, high-energy superhero action that gives the queer community the heroes they've always deserved." - Steve Orlando (Midnighter, Justice League of America, Crude, Virgil)
FabMan by Maxime Garbarini & Hector Barros
"The Pride is equal doses of action, drama, celebration, transgression, campy humor, legit humor, and a slew of other descriptors that best qualify a team book following a fabulous crew of complicated heroes as they work together to kick butt and look gorgeous." - Sina Grace, Iceman, Nothing Lasts Forever
The Pride #1 art by Gavin Mitchell & Kris Carter
"A series worth reading. All the characters are fleshed out and drawn with charm & care. Amazing storylines that impact many. I hope more amazing team members get introduced & involved, soon! Also: FabMan, Cub, Wolf, and many more on the Pride team are definitely a team that's got your back & I'm glad they've got mine." - Elijah Knight, GeeksOUT
The Pride Adventures #4 cover by Hamish Steele
"The Pride is immediately appealing with its range of characters that play off of superhero and queer community archetypes. What surprised me was how these archetypes developed into the nuanced characters, brutally honest storylines and complex relationships that any superhero comic would be envious of." - Hamish Steele, Deadendia, Pantheon, Eisner winner of the Russ Manning Most Promising Newcomer Award 2018
The Pride Adventures #2 art by Christian Wildgoose & Ben Wilsonham. Letters by Mike Stock.
"The Pride is the kind of book that makes you realize, there was something missing all along and you hadn't known it. Its colorful, energetic nature only serves to underscore its nuanced emotional core." - Vita Ayala, The Wilds, Livewire, Supergirl)
"You don't have to be LGBTQ+ to enjoy these comics. If you liked the mix of superhero action, personal issues, and expansive compassion of classic Claremont X-Men - get the modern version right here!" - James Asmus, Quantum & Woody, Thief of Thieves, Gambit, Bumblebee, Evolution

campaign.story:
The Invincible Bunch is an ensemble series about five very different gay guys who come together regularly in the backroom of their local comic book store to play a tabletop role-playing game. 
Their attempts to work together to navigate the fantasy world created by their Gamesmaster are frequently sidelined by heated debates about superhero movies, video games, pop culture and their sex lives.
Can these mismatched companions learn to get along? What are the chances of rolling three natural twenties in a row? Is it against a Paladin's order to use Tinder? And can we talk about Nightwing's butt?? All of these questions will be answered... and more.
GOALS
The above video is a proof of concept that represents our ambitions for an episode. It was produced by utilizing a lot of hard work and dedication and since it was made with almost no resources, we believe that it showcases the team's ability to use creative decision making and smart application of funds to make a high quality product. The series we would like to make will feature eight 5-minute episodes like this one - only like, 87% more amazing. 
Our goals are simple ones: 1) make something great 2) create a series that features a diverse, inter-generational group of gay men 3) produce an entertaining portrayal of RPG play that is fundamentally connected to character development and 4) integrate animation (the hand drawn kind) in a smart and fun way as a means of making the look and feel of our show distinctive.
CHARACTERS
  BUDGET
Our budget is designed to compensate our cast and crew for their time and talent first, and then focus on the live action and animation production.
50% - Cast/Crew
20% - Production/Administrative Costs
20% - Animation
10% - Post Production

Any additional funds raised would be applied with a focus towards live action and animation production. Because we want stuff to look nice.
CREW
Creator, Writer and Director: C.EDWARDS is a New York-based cartoonist and animator whose work has been seen on Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon, PBS, ABC and CBS. His comic work, which includes Abel Boddy and 12-Inch Roommate, is nationally syndicated and has been featured on Queerty, GeeksOut, Gayletter and Fleshbot. He has also written for various print and web publications, most notably Cartoon Brew. 
Producer: DAN HALPERIN is a video producer for RollingStone.com, a documentary filmmaker, and musician. His film work has premiered at the Boston Film Festival, DOC NYC, and been featured on Hulu, Amazon, and Pivot. His digital work has been featured on Rolling Stone, Paste Magazine, Consequence of Sound, and Al Jazeera. He also produces the webby-honoree podcast 'Rolling Stone Music Now.'
Executive Producer: JERRY PORTWOOD is the Editorial Director of RollingStone.com. Previously he was the executive editor of Out magazine and the Editor in Chief of New York Press. He is also a voting member of the Gay and Lesbian Entertainment Critics Association.
PRESS
 "You discuss your day over drinks, they discuss theirs over dice"
- Dennis Hinzman
 "Web series about gay men don’t often feature Dungeons & Dragons-style role-playing games, but director C. Edwards is hoping to change that with his new project, The Invincible Bunch."
- Adam Salandra
"Often, when we think of how gay people are represented in the media we, think of shows like Looking and Fire Island. We think of abs, Speedos, parties, and drama. Director C. Edwards is hoping to change that with his new project, The Invincible Bunch.
- Zachary Zane

We are certain that by combining the same level of vision and enthusiasm on a larger scale, that we can create something really special for everyone.

updates.update_content:
So... as you all know, we didn't make our goal. Which makes us sad. It's like, we needed to roll an 18 and only hit a 15 with a +2 modifier. 

However, we made some great progress - 77%!! Which makes us happy.
We received some lovely notes from backers asking us about re-launching the campaign and our answer is yes, we are still 1000% committed to this project and are figuring out our next steps.

updates.update_userinfo: 12 Hours to Go! We NEED YOUR HELP!
updates.update_content: We are so close we can almost taste it, but we still have a bit to go before we reach the finish line. In the past 30 days, we have received such amazing positive press from so many outlets: Out, Attitude in the UK, NewNowNext, Backstage, and Pride.com and many more. The gamer and gay geek communities have come out in FORCE. It's pretty clear: We all want LGBTQ stories out there representing all different walks of life! And THE INVINCIBLE BUNCH represents a diverse assortment of men of all sizes, shapes, colors and ages. Let's make it happen!

We made amazing progress today with new backers with large contributions, but also existing backers increasing their pledges. It makes me so happy to see people excited about "The Invincible Bunch" and hope that in the last several hours, we continue to find such enthusiasm. As always, we appreciate you spreading the word about our project and thank you for all of your support.
-claude

As we rapidly slide towards our goal, one of the things we've been focusing on is finding new ways to get people's attention. 
While sites have been good to us, and our social media has always shown promise. Our access to the wider gaymer world has mostly been at the mercy of group moderators; we've been bounced from a few RPG gaymer groups for being too self-promotional, which I totally understand - we just really want to get this project in front of eyeballs!

We have a lot to do in these last 69 hours, but I assure you we are working feverishly to make to do whatever we can to make our goal. Big thanks to everyone who joined us/upped their pledge during our matching backer week.

In the last few weeks, we've gotten some great feedback and inquiries on the project, campaign and everything we've posted on social media. A redditor even posted this in a gaymer sub: "It was legit funny and showed a lot of care in the details -- like it was made by actual nerds who've been in this sort of situation." Which I consider the highest of high praise.

We have received consistent reaffirmation that "The Invincible Bunch" should be made and look forward to seeing our progress over the next few days. We certainly appreciate any spreading of the word any of our backers can provide. And if you have any questions about rewards in a higher tier that would make you consider upping your pledge don't be afraid to ask.

One more day of "$$ Matching Week" - that's what I'm calling this 7-day period that one of our fantastic backers has agreed to match every dollar raised within. Thanks to many of you, so far, we've picked up an additional $1120.00!

updates.update_userinfo: Exciting News at our Halfway Point!!
updates.update_content:
We are officially at the halfway point of our campaign and have exciting news to share!
But first, we want to thank everyone who has supported this project so far.
Our news is that a funder has offered to match all contributions made in the next seven days!

This includes not only new pledges, but also pledge increases from any current backers between Wednesday November 1st and Wednesday November 8th!

It's good to take little breaks from the crowdfunding rush to continue pre-production on the project. One of the things I wanted to work more on on the pilot video was the storyboard sequence in the beginning, unfortunately there just wasn't any time left to create something more fleshed out.

The Invincible Bunch campaign has hit 20% in less than a week! And I want to thank everyone for that. Everyone who's supported this project so far, everyone who's shared this project with someone else. Everyone who has liked us on or . And all of the media outlets that I have pushed us in front of more eyeballs.

campaign.story:
Cooking with Drag Queens Has Been Saved!
Let's hang out: we're doing a live video chat with as many folks as possible at 10pm central time. Click on the link below to join in on the fun:
https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/gkvitn4pfbhnnaoy6yynjiitb4e    

With your help we created together three years of amazing episodes with artists who went on to become huge names. You also inspired millions to express themselves creatively, and to cook. We have a lot of exciting artists scheduled for next year already, and are excited to give you a taste of what’s to come! It's deeply humbling and inspiring to get so much love and support from everyone. It means the world to us that you believe in the show and want to see it continue and grow. Thank you.
If you can't cook for yourself, how the hell are you going to cook for somebody else? Can I get a bon appétit? 
  Marc Felion, Fox E. Kim and Fausto Fernós make some caramel popcorn wigs. Photo: Jeff Knutson.
Why a cooking show with drag queens?
Cooking and drag have so much in common - whether you're getting dolled up or rolling the dough out, you take different elements and put it all together to come up with a fabulous new creation.
We believe food doesn’t just nourish the body, it feeds the soul. When you make a meal with someone you also share your heart and mind with them and that’s the bond we are trying to create between the drag queen and the audience. Won’t you have a seat at our table?
A drag queen is anyone who transforms themselves into a beautiful creature of their own imagination.  Here at Feast of Fun, we're all about telling the stories of amazing artists, sexual and gender pioneers who draw with all the crayons in the box. We believe deeply that LGBT folks have our own unique culture, and we want to present exciting drinks, meals and desserts that use all the spices in the rack.
Drag is fierce and delicious! Think of Cooking with Drag Queens as RuPaul meets Martha Stewart. 
Hi I'm Fausto Fernos and I'm Marc Felion. For the past 13 years we've interviewed the world's most beloved drag queens on our award winning podcast Feast of Fun. As a way to showcase the amazing talent coming through our home we created Cooking with Drag Queens, a traditional cooking show that examines the lives of extraordinary performers. Although the concept of a cooking show with drag queens seems like an unusual mix, it fits together like peanut butter and chocolate.
When we started Cooking with Drag Queens we had no idea that it would be an ongoing series like this but the audience is definitely hungry for more episodes and we can’t let the children go hungry. So, today, we’re happy to announce we are ready to launch Season 3 of Cooking with Drag Queens with exciting new episodes, recipes, challenges and more of what you love: beautiful creatures of their own imagination making scrumptious foods and lovely libations.
Draw with all the crayons in the box, cook with all the spices on the rack.

At Cooking with Drag Queens, not only do we like to use fresh ingredients, we also like to use fresh ideas so this season we have a lot of exciting things happening in the kitchen- including a wider variety of shows and more experimentation with the show format.
In order to put out fabulous new videos, we’ll need the following ingredients:
Video Editors and Direction. 
Professional multi-camera crew. 
Lighting & Sound technicians.
Hard drive storage, video camera and sound equipment.  
Food.
Travel and Accommodation costs.
OUR GOAL: $20,000.
REWARDS: Every person who tips us $3 dollars or more gets to see the new episodes before anyone else, and gets their names in the closing credits. Get your drag name up in lights as producer in the opening title sequence. Visit the set while we’re taping or come on a skype date with us. Check out our digital media rewards, where you can access all the past shows of Cooking with Drag Queens, our podcasts, behind the scenes photos and wallpaper for your phone.
New Reward! A Phone Call with Vivacious
Mother (SNAP) is calling! Spend a hour on the phone with Vivacious from RuPaul's Drag Race Season 6. Get all the hot tea as you kiki on the phone on the party line with Vivacious, Fausto & Marc.
Stretch goal: An explosive drag queen cooking competition.  If we manage to reach our first stretch goal of $23,000, we’ll film a drag queen cooking competition, where two queens battle it out to become the queen of the kitchen. And they will be harshly and unfairly judged by two campy, TV celebrity chefs! 
More money means more episodes with more gals. Give big to support the project and you’ll get great rewards: Cooking with Drag Queens aprons, refrigerator magnets, tote bags, t-shirts and more.
With your support, Cooking with Drag Queens will be a community funded program that will be free to watch online, to anyone around the world.
We’ll introduce so many new and amazing gals to the world. The drag queens deserve it, and so do you.
Please share this video with your friends, blog about it, or send in your own testimonial video in drag. Can I get a bon appétit up in here?
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The answer to all of life’s challenges is always the same - more drag! A smear of lipstick, a squiggly eyebrow and a wig teased to heaven go a long way to make the world a better place.

In addition to more drag, the key ingredients to creating a successful cooking show are testing recipes, interviewing, selecting and scheduling the guests, and delivering the series in a regular and timely manner.

Thankfully, we aren’t doing this project alone- we’ve built an amazing team that is just as passionate about drag and food as we are, from photographers to food stylists to a sexy dish crew that just loves to clean up our messes. 

Since 2005, we’ve had the pleasure of interviewing the world’s top drag queens and introduced fabulous new talent on our award winning podcast, Feast of Fun. We’ve recorded over 2500 podcasts so you know we have the drive and determination to put all the pieces together and carry through on our promise to continue this web series.

This is also our third season of Cooking with Drag Queens so, if you like what you’ve seen so far, support the project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Chicken Kiev is one of those dishes that used to pop up on the menus at some of the finest restaurants in the world but eventually became a mass produced and turned into a convenience food served at school cafeterias or summer camp.
In the 1970s, it seemed like every TV sitcom housewife made Chicken Kiev for dinner to impress her husband’s boss. The dish eventually fell out of fashion, but even today, who can resist a breaded chicken fillet stuffed with herb garlic butter?

campaign.story:
Five talented male professionals are about to get the opportunity to fulfill their dreams on the day their world comes crashing down.
Welcome to Velvet Collar, a brand new comic book series for gay and queer-friendly readers, Velvet Collar is about the secret world of male escorts and sexual politics.
Issue #1! You can Make it Happen!
With your help on Kickstarter, we can make issue #1 a reality!
32 pages of full color, original art and story.
About Issue #1 and the Series
Each story and character in the series are drawn from real stories of male escorts and adult performers. They may not have superpowers, but they have charisma, nerve, determination to give their lives agency.
People who are sex workers rarely get a serious place in comic books. Their roles have traditionally been limited to victims, criminals, or as secondary characters with limited development. Their personalities, life choices and decision making are never fully realized.
While a rare selection of titles have had protagonists that are sex workers, they have been primarily female roles with limited agency. For example, in Chester Brown's famous Paying For It, the author strips away any individual identifying features, personalities and human essence from the women he meets in his encounters. Velvet Collar puts the color and life back into the people. 
Velvet Collar would be the first comic series to focus not only on the lives of modern adult industry workers, but specifically on male-identified individuals. Explicitly, these are experiences of professionals who have voluntarily participated in the industry as legally recognized adults. This is not the same as those who have entered sex work against their will (human trafficking victims and involuntary participation.) The work does not endorse illegal activity. This work talks about what actually happens with both adult industry members and the people they are involved with.
In consulting male escorts for this project, one professional had this to say:
"Most of us treat what we do as a job, like any other. We try to pay our bills and our taxes, and we plan for the future. We have people we take care of and little luxuries we want to enjoy."
"I want your comic to become reality because I want people to know what our lives are like, and to have fun with it. Plus, the drawings are really fun."
Ultimately, this series is about the relationships that male adult industry performers have with their audience, with their loved ones, and with themselves.
With art done in bold, vibrant colors and a dialogue with a natural rhythm, these stories come to life. We want to push the  genres of political observation, queer male erotica, political observations and action adventure.
Diverse Lives Brought to Life in Full Color
  Real Stories that have to be lived to be Believed
About the Art and the Writing
The author, Bryan Knight, was inspired by the real stories of modern male sex workers in America. His style has been influenced by descriptive prose masters such as Ray Bradbury and humorist observers like John Kennedy Toole and Mark Twain. This issue and series will be his first published comic project.
The artist, Dave Davenport, who has authored and illustrated individual titles and for series such as Hard to Swallow, and recently Damaged, has come to this project with confidence and enthusiasm. With bold watercolors, exciting line weights and panel layouts, and an excellent sense of visual and emotional pacing, he knows how to make art that will make you go 'wow.'
REWARDS
We are offering a bunch of amazing rewards around Velvet Collar, in digital and print formats.
Pledge Rewards!
GOALS
We are seeking $8,000 as our minimum target to produce the first issue, including $5,000 for the artwork, $2,000 for the publication costs (including printing and shipping) about $750 for Kickstarter fees.
Stretch goals
If this project really excites you, we can go for $10,000.
This would go a long way to producing Issue 2!
We will add 2-4 extra pages to issue 1
And it would cover promotional copies and more
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The first issue is more than two-thirds complete.
Once we reach our goal, we will be able to commence printing and distribution.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you for helping issue 1 and 2 come to life. We are now ready to start moving into Issue 3.
For everyone who pre-ordered a copy of issue 2 with their last backing, your books are being prepared and will be on their way soon. 
If you missed the kickstarter, don't worry! Issue 1 and 2 will be available (plus some new short stories) at www.velvetcollarcomics.com

HI!
Issue 2 is currently in development.
Unfortunately, Dave Davenport had to step down to take care of sudden and necessary personal business. We wish him the best and hope he will continue to have success.
We are currently looking for new comic book artists to complete issue 2 and 3.

Okay. So I sent most of the comic books from the first run via US Postal Service First Class Mail. Of the 200 mailed books out initially, more than 20 have reported not to have received their copies.
I apologize to everyone who has not gotten their copies yet. This is expensive for me as a publisher and I am investigating more reliable mailing options.

Hi! I've been getting some feedback that some of your books and pdfs are not reaching you. I have gotten some books returned as well.
If you have not gotten your book by now, PLEASE CONTACT ME, so I can get you your copy. Mail DOES get lost AND you may have forgotten to put your apartment number in your postal address!

all the rewards for the excited fan backers have been sent out!
Hero rewards are still being prepared, hope to have them out by this weekend.

The paper and digital copies for the Curious Readers and Fans have been emailed.
Digital copies for Excited Fans, Heros and Movie Stars are going out in the morning.
Paper copies for Excited Fans, Heros and Movie Stars are going out starting February 18 after Dave and I complete autographing the books and completing the bust images.

And they look amazing!
The paperbacks for the Curious Reader and Fan backers will be going out first on Wednesday.
The Digital Special Edition for Fan Backers and upwards will start going out Wednesday as well. We were adding the 8 pages of art and the commentary. I'll be emailing as I'm in SF this week.
Everyone who qualified for digital copies in any tier will start receiving copies as of today. Your special edition tiers and other rewards will come to you as I receive physical materials

For the Curious Reader Backers
All who selected Digital Copies have now been sent digital copies.
There are still about 15 of you who have not answered the surveys, so I can't send you a copy until you do!

Digital Copies start going out today!D
Digitial Special Editions with the 8 pages of additional art are being prepared.
Paper copies arrive Monday and will be sent out first to the SF area and then from there.

campaign.story:
*NOTE* You can ADD ON to any reward that doesn't have this already:
8PAGECOMICS DIGITAL SUBSCRIPTION + $8
Launching December (a $16 value). Be part of the first wave! Creator owned, familiar names plus new talent! Just increase your reward by $8. You will get a confirmation in your survey.
Before I started writing POISON IVY, RED SONJA, WONDER WOMAN and other characters for publishers like DC and Marvel, there was GIRLS NIGHT OUT, three issues of multi-genre short stories I self-published.  This is a project to remaster and collect them in trade paperback format, with a minimum of 100 (one hundred!) beautiful color pages. 
Stories include:
by Craig Yeung, colors Juri H-C
GIRLS NIGHT OUT with Craig Yeung (Runaways, Green Arrow), colors Juri H-C.  The relationship between two women - Jackie, an employee of a nursing home and Rosie, a resident with dementia. 
CAPTAIN, MY CAPTAIN with Eisner award winning artist Janet Lee (Return of the Dapper Men) A mutiny in space goes awry.
SAVING ABBY with Cabbral My very first story ever! In a future where the world is vegan by necessity, New York City is a dangerous slum, and taxi drivers are also mercenaries...
art by Sean Von Gorman
BIG CITY with Sean Von Gorman (Toe Tag Riot, Pawn Shop) A story in tweets, with new pages!
pencils by Larry Hama, inks by Craig Yeung, colors by Trish Mulvihill
THE DATE with Larry Hama (GI Joe, Wolverine) colors by Eisner award winning Trish Mulvihill (100 Bullets, Batman, Wonder Woman) - A young man frantically rushes to meet his date.
Written for a wide audience so there's no language, nudity, or gore. You won't find these stories anywhere else. 
THIS IS A LIMITED EDITION RUN (no more than 500- each copy will be numbered and signed) so don't miss out!
This interview with Comics Beat gives a good overview of the content and process of Girls Night Out from my last kickstarter http://www.comicsbeat.com/amy-chu-kickstarts-a-third-volume-of-girls-night-out-interview/
 And here are some of the rewards:
ULTIMATE RED SONJA PACK: BLOODY RED SONJA POP!
"You’ve never read a Sonja tale like this! Chu has crafted a saga for the ages. I cannot get enough of this Red Sonja. Overall grade: A+" - SciFiPulse
  LOUIE CHIN THORS SKETCH COVER!
Rad sketch cover by my friend Louie. Check out his other work here-
  I LOVE COFFEE GIFT PACK! 
$65 bundle includes the book, my favorite coffee, plus swag!:
Death Wish Coffeeee!!
  ULTIMATE KISS FAN GIFT PACK
All ten (10) issues of my KISS run with the limited double signed Sean Von Gorman variant #1, a set of the NYCC limited edition Goni Montes collectible cards, and the GIRLS NIGHT OUT GOLD EDITION book + PDF! 
"Amy is doing stuff no KISS comic has done before and it’s amazing because of that." "fun and entertaining" "accessible by everyone, Kiss fan or not" - Outright Geekery 
"Happily impressed" - Geeks of Doom
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Like most creatives in the comics business I'm a freelancer, and lucky to have enough work to be employed full time. However that can change at any moment, which may have the effect of either speeding up or slowing down this project. If either of these situations occur, you'll all get an update. Timely fulfillment is one of the biggest challenges of any kickstarter, but this ain't my first rodeo. I've successfully run many projects in the past, so even in this chaotic world, you will get your book if it kills me! Most of the book is already done- it's just a question of how nitpicky I want to get in the editing and relettering process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hello! And sorry for the delay in reaching out to you.  I'm writing to you from a very unglamorous hotel room in Pittsburgh where I'm a guest at the decidedly unglamorous 3 Rivers Comic Con. I mean this as a compliment- too many cons these days are $100 affairs all about celebrities, pop culture and nothing to do with comics. One of them is the incredibly nice Bill Messner-Loebs, who I just commissioned to do a Dejah Thoris sketch cover. You can read about his story here: http://www.fox2detroit.com/news/local-news/one-armed-comic-book-artist-worked-on-wonder-woman-now-homeless-in-michigan

campaign.story:
Socially-Conscious White Ladies Coloring and Activity Book pokes fun at the current trend of "hashtag activism." The book features portraits of sexy White Ladies giving empty lip service to some of today's major social issues. 
Limited Fun Pack with book, poster and a white crayon
Similar in style and tone to my previous work The 2016 Republican Presidential Candidates Coloring and Activity Book, Socially-Conscious White Ladies also includes satirical drawings of supposedly "progressive" white female celebrities, plus funny and informative activities (like you'd find in a children's activity book). And yes, some of the art will have a bit of nudity and mild sexuality. This is a coloring book for Grown-Ups.
Two satirical coloring books
Why I'm Doing This
I created these books because adult coloring books are an accessible, non-threatening way to poke fun at American culture. America is a wonderfully diverse country with a wide variety of identities and communities. Although we may have disagreements over the direction of the country, I very much believe in the USA's ability to be a force for positive change for all its citizens and throughout in the world.
Sample pages from Socially-Conscious White Ladies
I also believe that positive change starts from within and the first step on that path is honesty about the problems we face. These coloring books are intended to point out what I see as problems that need to be addressed. I'm not telling anyone what to do. I'm simply offering my perspective and opinions on where we are as country and I'm doing it with a healthy dose of humor. 
The Plan
My goal is to print and ship Socially-Conscious White Ladies by the end of November 2017.
Socially-Conscious White Ladies Coloring and Activity Book
8.5"x11", 44 pages
Color cover with B&W interior
Paperback
I'm aiming to raise at least $4,000. This will cover:  
$2,000 to print and ship Socially-Conscious White Ladies Coloring and Activity Book from the printer
$500 to ship books and rewards to backers 
$300 to print and ship the I Wish This Lady Would Shut Up poster from the printer
$100 to ship original artwork to backers 
$50 to purchase a lot of white crayons 
$500 for fees and other charges 
$550 for printing additional books and posters, and for unforeseen costs
Some of the original art available to backers
Thank You :D
Thank you for supporting Socially-Conscious White Ladies Coloring and Activity Book! I hope you have bunches of fun reading and coloring it. Don't forget to bring your pink "pussy hat" you bought on Etsy!
<3
Sonya Saturday
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've been slowly working on Socially-Conscious White Ladies for the last year. As of this writing I've completed roughly 50% of the total artwork.

This will be a busy summer for me. I'm attending several conventions, moving to a new apartment and drawing short stories for multiple publishers. However I'm confident that I can complete, print and ship Socially-Conscious White Ladies by the end of November 2017.

I've been publishing my own work for nearly 20 years. I do all the artwork, graphics and book design myself. I know what I'm doing :D
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Well folks this campaign is about over. There's less than an hour to go and we're still over $1000 short of making the goal. I wanna thank all of you who backed the project and shared it with your friends. So thank you thank you so much!!! 
One way or another this book is still going to exist. However without money from this campaign I can't afford to print the book on my own. So who knows what's going to happen with it!

Hey y'all! We're getting close to the end here and we've still got a couple thousand dollars to go. I know it's doable! If each of you share the campaign with your networks we can reach critical mass and get this book made! I hate to say it, but if we don't reach the $4,000 goal then the book won't happen on time and you won't get your copies.

Hey here's eleven free SOCIALLY-CONSCIOUS WHITE LADIES pages for your coloring pleasure! Free free to print them out and give them to your friends. We're only four days away from the end of the campaign and we've got less than $2500 left to go. We can do this!
<3
Sonya

Hey folks! Here's the thing: There's seven days left in the Socially-Conscious White Ladies campaign and as of this writing we're only 36% of the way there. I'd thought $4k was a modest goal but it's looking like it might not happen in time. I've been plugging the book here at the San Diego Comic-Con and that's done a lot to increase pledges...but we're still far away.
So! If you want the Socially-Conscious White Ladies Coloring and Activity Book to happen on time (aiming to ship in November) then I have a request: Please please please let your friends/family/significant others/teachers/doctors/neighbors/pets know about it! Share it on your Facebooks, Twitters, Tumblrs, Fetlifes, Adult Friend Finders and/or Grindrs! And remind them that there's only One Week Left!

campaign.story:
As part of the Kickstarter Gold project, we're bringing back your favourite writer and artists from The Secret Loves of Geek Girls to bring you more true stories of love, sex, and dating from the worlds of fandom! This project is a book of new stories by creators from the first anthology, entitled The Secret Loves of Geek Girls: Redux.
The Secret Loves of Geek Girls was a collection of comics, prose, and illustrations all on the themes of dating as a geek. The collection was full of stories from comic creators, sci-fi writers, videogame designers, cosplayers, and fans! The stories were a diverse range on different topics from first dates to discovering your sexuality and they've touched the hearts of people the world over. And this redux project will be the same! 
Cover art by Jenn Woodall (not final cover)
Being Part of Kickstarter Gold
Kickstarter has meant the world to my projects, helping me bring back lost treasures of Canadian 1940s comic history (Nelvana of the Northern Lights, Brok Windsor), 1980s independent comics (Fashion In Action), and new collections (The Secret Loves of Geek Girls, A Minyen Yidn) showcasing unique themes and stories by talented creators.
It's more than fair to say I wouldn't be in publishing or have a career if it wasn't for this platform! I certainly wouldn't be a Kickstarter Thought Leader. Thank you to every person who has helped to support me so far, and those who are joining me for the first time!
To celebrate the good that Kickstarter has done, for me and so many other creators I've worked with, I'm bringing back a follow-up to my most successful project to date: The Secret Loves of Geek Girls, and I'm grateful for Kickstarter for this opportunity to join their Kickstarter Gold program.
After premiering as a breakaway success last year on Kickstarter, The Secret Loves of Geek Girls was later picked up by Dark Horse Comics. It is now sold in bookstores and comic shops worldwide, and has received overwhelming love from readers everywhere!
A selection of creators from the first volume at our launch party in Toronto in 2015!
  We can't thank Margaret Atwood enough for her support and cheerleading of the project!
  We did convention panels and signings almost everywhere in 2016! (here at SDCC)
  Even all the way to England! (w/Katie West, Hope Nicholson, & Cara Ellison)
The Project
The Secret Loves of Geek Girls: Redux is a project with the same mandate as the original: Geek Girls sharing true stories about love, sex, and dating. Where the original project was limited to 5 pages each for the stories, we're going even smaller with this one: Most creators are contributing 1 page stories, with some up to 4 pages long. Most of the stories have already been completed, and we have experienced book publisher Sam Beiko designing the book. So, overall we hope that this will be a nice, quick, exciting project to fund and to be a part of!
The book itself will be a 6x9 softcover, perfect bound book, black and white. To keep the budget low for this follow-up and to reduce the amount of initial print run we need to be successful, we are doing the book as a print-on-demand, and it will be roughly 40 pages.
All the Kickstarter patrons will receive their names in the book
PS. Thanks to Diana Khong for the help with the Kickstarter intro video, and Chris Stone on the redesigned logo originally by Rachel Deering! 
The Returning Cast
Each of the creators was featured in the first book, and our returning cast list is:
Cover Art by: Jenn Woodall 
Art by: Deena Pagliarello, Leslie Doyle, Gillian G
New comics by: Trina Robbins & Megan Kearney, Janet Hetherington, Meags Fitzgerald, Megan Kearney, ALB, Jazmyn & Jessica Paoli, Jen Vaughn
Illustrated stories by: Katie West & Jamie McKelvie, Erin Cossar, Cherelle Higgins, Jen Aprahamian
Prose stories by: J.M. Frey, Stephanie Cooke, Megan Lavey-Heaton, Loretta Jean, Adrienne Kress, Hope Nicholson, Tini Howard, Natalie Zina Walschots 
Reprinted comics by: Margaret Atwood, Annie Mok, Sarah Searle
Sample Stories!
Margaret Atwood, creator of The Handmaid's Tale, returns to this collection with some archival comic strips from her past. This book will feature the first appearance of her 1970s superheroine Survivalwoman, along with some of the follow up strips and commentary by Margaret.
Comic by Margaret Atwood
Deena Pagliarello contributes a pinup of two cosplayers falling in love at a convention.
Pinup by Deena Pagliarello
Megan Kearney (contributing artist for Disney Princesses), contributes a story of an irresistible attraction found in the dark depths of the internet.
Comic by Megan Kearney
A comic by Janet Hetherington about comic convention sales.
Comic by Janet Hetherington
A pinup by Gillian G showcasing the common habitat of the average 1990s fangirl. 
Pinup by Gillian G.
Annie Mok ruminates on love, lust, and videogames in a diary comic.
Comic by Annie Mok
A pinup by Leslie Doyle
Art by Leslie Doyle
  ALB tells the conclusion of the story started in the first The Secret Loves of Geek Girls.
Comic by ALB
Erin Cossar shares her favourite memories of the late 1990s internet.
Comic by Erin Cossar
Hope Nicholson (Spectacular Sisterhood of Superwomen) contributes a story on the anxiety and attraction of flirting at conventions.
Megan Lavey-Heaton (co-creator of Namesake) writes a powerful essay on women owning themselves and their loves.
J.M. Frey (The Untold Tale) tells a story of when a fangirl's fantasies become real...
Adrienne Kress (The Explorers: The Door in the Alley) tells a story of learning to fail at flirting.
Cherelle Higgins tells about being inspired by The Bionic Woman to deal with bullies.
Tini Howard (The Skeptics) discusses the connection between writing fanfiction, her love life, and career. 
Natalie Zina Walschots discusses the role of kink outside of the bedroom.
Stephanie Cooke (Rogue's Portal) contributes a story of teenage crushes and Livejournal friendships.
Katie West (Split) writes on falling out and into love, expressed through collecting an Anne Rice book. w/an illustration by Jamie McKelvie (The Wicked + The Divine)

Trina Robbins (Last Girl Standing) collaborates with Megan Kearney to show you that true love (or at least infatuation!) lasts forever

A comic by Sarah Searle about love and trust.
Comic by Sarah Searle
A comic by Jen Aprahamian about keeping the important things in your life.

A comic by Jessica and Jazmyn Paoli about sisters connecting through common fandom crushes. 
Comic by Jessica & Jazmyn Paoli
Budget:
All of the artists are receiving a flat fee, as well as the cover artist and designer. All of the artists and writers will be paid a full split of the net profits of the Kickstarter in addition to being able to buy books at print cost for convention travel/online sales. This budget is estimated at an estimated 182 copies (or what is needed to break even)
Stretch Goals:
There are no stretch goals for this project, but all of the net profit of the Kickstarter will be divided equally among the creators of the zine!
EDITED:
OK! There is one stretch goal: If we reach over 500 funders for the book itself, we will upgrade from a print-on-demand to a full print run!

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping update (if you've received your book, just unsubscribe!)
updates.update_content:
Quick shipping update!
Canadian books, book trios, and international books have all been shipped out. Many have been received and enjoyed! Copies of Split have also been shipped out.
US books are being shipped out this week hopefully, they are the most complex so have been left to last. Book duos have a bit of a delay as we are having some stock problems with getting the original The Secret Loves of Geek Girls (it unexpectedly went out of print!) We are trying to locate retailers who can sell its copies so we can fulfill everyone's orders without waiting for the next print run. It looks good to having this resolved soon.
The books have now arrived from the printer and they look wonderful! They'll be shipped out over the next few weeks and I look forward to seeing all of you receive them!

Gothic Tales of Haunted Love
Hello! If you haven't noticed, we've launched our BIG 2017 Kickstarter (this Redux was unexpected, being invited to participate through Kickstarter Gold, and wow, what a nice surprise it was!). 
This new Kickstarter is called Gothic Tales of Haunted Love and features 200 pages of full-colour horror/romance comics across all cultures, love interests, and eras! I hope you check it out, it includes creators from including  ALB, Sarah W. Searle, Katie West, Megan Kearney, Leslie Doyle, Jen Vaughn, Cherelle Higgins, and myself, plus many more creators new to Bedside Press!

campaign.story:
When you're queer, no one ever sits you down and says "This is our story." Sure, you hear snippets. Friends tell friends what they know, terrible movies provide some context, but you don't often get to share the experience of learning history together.
Geeks OUT wants to change that. We want to create a fun, inclusive, community-oriented way to invite friends, family, and anyone else to learn our story together.
Illustrations by Allison Kolarik: Greg Louganis, Nina Simone, Alison Bechdel, Audre Lorde
  Learning queer history doesn’t just help us remember we come from. It helps us think about where we want to go, and how to get there. As we enter uncertain times, creating a ritual that connects us, and teaches queer history feels more important than ever.
To make this happen, we're going to publish Serving Pride: The Handbook for Your Queer History Dinner Party.
In the model of the Passover Haggadah, Serving Pride will guide a group of dinner guests through a ritual meal where history is retold through readings, songs, games, recipes, and artwork.
Harvey Milk, Sally Ride, George Takei
  Serving Pride will tell tales of groups like the Daughters of Bilitis, who subverted gender norms and dared to create a proud queer community where before there had only been the closet.
We’ll yell chants from Stonewall, and sing songs about queers who rattled the establishment, fighting for the rights of the oppressed.
We’ll remember the drag ball culture of Harlem in the 1920s and queer trendsetters in the arts who redefined American music, literature, and fashion.
Larry Kramer, Keith Haring, Freddie Mercury
It will be will be fully illustrated by some of today's most amazing queer artists, and will contain original songs and recipes to make the evening as delicious and fun as it will be informative.
Some of the creators already signed on to contribute to Serving Pride include:
Allie Kolarik (Comic Book Afterlife)
C. Edwards (Abel Boddy)
Fyodor Pavlov (Bash Back)
Rogan Josh (modHero)
Tana Ford (Silk)
Will Varner (Buzzfeed Comics)
with more to be announced soon!
We want to make this book affordable for every queer who wants one, so in addition to printing a full-color version of the book, we’ll also be publishing a free printable PDF of the book, so you can be completely DIY about it if you like.
We want everyone to be able to get a copy of the book in time to enjoy it during Pride season 2017, starting in June.
Sylvia Rivera, Ellen Degeneres, Divine
 So what do we do need to do this? $9,500.
$4,500 to cover printing and shipping costs 
$2,000 for artwork 
$1,500 to hire a researcher 
$1000 to hire a copy editor
$500 for the Kickstarter fees
Obviously, no dinner party can cover the entire American Queer experience, but we'll be building a bibliography of our sources, so it'll be easy to look up more information about the parts of the dinner that interest you most.
We hope the Serving Pride dinner party will become a colorful new tradition in every queer household, where we can all raise a glass to those who have fought for our freedoms, knowing that their work may not be finished, but their legacies continue to inspire us.
Please help fund Serving Pride!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Time is the biggest factor here, with book printing costs being what they are, getting a completed, color filled book in time for June 2017 is going to be hard.

We've got the right team in place and have good contacts for book publishing, so while it will be tight, we believe we can overcome this easily.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Survey's Sent! Books Delivered in May!
updates.update_content:
Hi folx! It's been a hot minute since our last update. The book is nearly completely almost 100% totally very finished. We want Serving Pride to be as good as it can be, so rushing it to the finish line wasn't an option for us, and a few aspects are just taking longer than anticipated. Thank you for being patient and bearing with us as we wrap up the book.
The holiday season is not the best time to try and print, ship, or promote a new independent book, and we want Serving Pride's debut to be as strong as possible. That's why we are planning the release for early 2018, marking a full year from our Kickstarter launch. The timeline isn't what we'd originally planned, but the nature of the project necessitated some some flexibility, and in the end, the extra time was important to the quality of the finished product. We hate to make you wait any longer, but we don't think you'll be disappointed once the book is in your hands!

campaign.story:
FULLY FUNDED!!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!
Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to keep in touch about what's next!
UPDATE 11/17:
LAST FEW HOURS!  RSVP for our telethon. Oh and grab your HAIL MARY! 
UPDATE 11/16:
RSVP now for our telethon!  Also -- we have a stretch goal for after we meet our goal.  Please keep contributing even after we reach our $40k goal!
 UPDATE 11/15:
In celebration of reaching $35K, we wanted to share something with the world. This is a conversation between Neil Gaiman (The Sandman) and Stephen Bissette (Swamp Thing) in which they discuss Mike Diana's case, the nature of censorship, and the Hairspray video that wasn't. Enjoy, and please tell your friends about our campaign so we can reach our goal -- so close!
UPDATE 11/4:
Buzz is building! Outrage and disbelief are mounting as we get the word out about what happened to Mike.
UPDATE 11/3: Several new rewards are now available, including original artwork by Mike Diana and street artist Judith Supine, a limited edition VHS release of the finished movie, and a year subscription to horror streaming platform SHUDDER. Everything has been added to the listings below.  
Collage by Judith Supine
 UPDATE 11/2: To celebrate reaching the halfway point, we are sharing a little gem we dug up from our archives.
Check it out -- the flier that Mike's army of anti-censorship protestors handed out outside his trial.  Click on the photo for larger, downloadable versions.  
Click to Download Larger Files
UPDATE 10/29:
New perks have been added! Two original drawings by Mike Diana, both priced at $50. These are a great deal and they go fast. 
UPDATE 10/28:
NEW EXTENDED VIDEO! Explore Exhibit A. Go deeper into the Mike Diana comics obscenity trial, and join in our efforts to finish telling the story of the price he paid for his art.
  IMPORTANT NOTE: You may notice some images censored on this page. Nothing will be blacked out in our film.
Does Freedom of Speech mean anything when authorities see only obscenity? Does an artist’s vision matter when community standards conspire to suppress it? In a small town in Florida back in 1994, Mike Diana learned that the answer was a resounding no. Freedom of Speech doesn’t mean anything when your art is declared obscene. And one man’s art could be another man’s obscenity.
Diana’s crime? Publishing a hand-made comic zine called Boiled Angel full of graphic, outrageous, often hilarious confrontational art, full of sex and violence, meant to shock and disturb. But it was a zine only sold to adults by mail. With a print run of only 300 copies, Diana’s zine was NEVER available in comic racks or in stores. And only one copy – count ‘em, one! – was ever sold to a customer in Diana’s hometown. And that one customer was an undercover cop!
   Authorities in Florida were so appalled by Diana’s art that they first thought he was a serial killer! After determining that he wasn’t, they nevertheless decided to put him on trial for three counts of obscenity. Then, amazingly, the prosecution brought in a psychologist who testified that Mike’s comics could actually CREATE serial killers!
With an enraged community up in arms, Diana was found guilty. Though he only served four days in jail rather than the three years the prosecution asked for, he was put on probation for three years with a laundry list of regulations that included forbidding him to draw anything that MIGHT be considered obscene, even for his own pleasure in the privacy of his own home! And authorities were allowed to conduct warrantless searches to see that this was enforced.
Boiled Angel "Ate" - Front and Back (By Mike Diana)
  "It’s shocking that these things happen but I wanna make people more aware these things were going on around them, like priests molesting children." - Mike Diana, Seconds #38
Of course, that all happened in 1994 but it’s worth reminding people how fast one can lose their First Amendment rights.
It might seem like obscenity charges are a thing of the past but as the recent past has repeatedly shown us, Freedom of Speech is something that must be continually fought and won. And, unfortunately, history has a way of repeating itself.
THE TRIAL OF MIKE DIANA is not only an urgent reminder of how authorities can dictate what adults may create, see, and read, but it’s also a multi-faceted celebration of one of the most unique artists of the last 30 years.
“Because if you don't stand up for the stuff you don't like, when they come for the stuff you do like, you've already lost.” - Neil Gaiman
By Mike Diana
  THE TRIAL OF MIKE DIANA has already begun production with the full participation of Mike Diana and unprecedented access to his personal archives, but we need your help to make it a reality. We feel strongly about telling this story honestly, without shying away from the controversial nature of the case or the extremity of the artwork itself. This is why we are making this as a completely independent film, with no outside interests to control the message.
We're most of the way through shooting, but some of our key remaining interviews will require some travel. We will be using funds raised from this campaign to cover basic travel expenses.
For a film about an artist, we will need to make sure that art is represented onscreen in a uniquely cinematic way, using a combination of techniques including original animation by Mike Diana himself. The post-production process will be a tremendous undertaking, but one that will shape the film into a finished product worthy of it's incredible subject. The editing process, as well as a final sound mix, color correction pass, and the composition of an original score will account for the bulk of how funds will be used.
Lastly, a full legal review will also be necessary, as you can probably imagine given the nature of the project. This is costly, but ultimately a requirement for a film that deals so heavily with the court system itself.
  If fully funded, we aim to complete principal photography by the end of the year. The editing process will be happening concurrently with the remaining shoots, and we plan to have a version of the film ready to show at festivals in early 2017.
We want to get Mike Diana's story out there in a big way, so we'll be bringing the film to the widest audiences possible. Following a festival run, we'll be seeking distribution to bring the film to audiences in theaters, as well as home video, VOD and SVOD.
By Mike Diana
  Cult filmmaking legend Frank Henenlotter is directing the film. Henenlotter's films such as BASKET CASE, BRAIN DAMAGE, and FRANKENHOOKER have secured his legacy as one of the masters of the "horror comedy". In recent years he has also created several feature documentaries about the fringes of filmmaking he dearly loves with THAT'S SEXPLOITATION! and HERSCHELL GORDON LEWIS: THE GODFATHER OF GORE. He has also helped to preserve exploitation film history through his involvement with the distributor Something Weird Video.
Producer Anthony Sneed will be familiar to fans of Henenlotter's work, having had starring roles in the director's films BAD BIOLOGY and the upcoming CHASING BANKSY, which Sneed co-wrote. He founded 85 North Productions. He is a performer at the Upright Citizens Brigade and Magnet theaters, and has also exhibited work as an artist in both the fine art and street art arenas.
Producer Mike Hunchback is the author of "Pulp Macabre: The Art of Lee Brown Coye's Darkest Era", as well as a longtime staple of the DIY punk scene. He currently plays rhythm guitar in Screeching Weasel and co-owns Co-Op 87 Records in Brooklyn, NY.
Associate Producer Caitlin McGurk is the Associate Curator for Outreach as well as an Assistant Professor at the Ohio State University Billy Ireland Cartoon Library and Museum, the largest collection of comic and cartoon art in the world. You can see more about the library at cartoons.osu.edu.
    We can't get this story out there without you. In exchange for your financial support, we put together a sinfully delightful assortment of rewards large and small, designed to fit any budget. 
                                         This is a story that affects us all, and there are lots of ways to help that you may not even be aware of.
1. Make a contribution. Every pledge, no matter how big or small, truly helps!
2. Spread the word! Post to your favorite site that discusses anything from indie comics to legal justice. Forward to a friend. Alert your favorite publication or newsletter. Tweet about it.
3. Keep us on your radar! Follow us on Twitter or Instagram, and Like us on Facebook.
You have our sincere thanks for any and all help you can provide!
By Mike Diana, published in World War 3
Love our campaign graphics? We do too! Everything here (with the exception of Mike Diana's artwork) has been created by the very talented Steve Dressler. Visit his site to learn more about him. Thank you, Steve!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of our biggest challenges may be that Mike's art isn't for everyone. That's a big part of the story, in our minds. Grappling with this line between trash and treasure will require we show and talk about art that may make some folks uncomfortable. But we know this is also a topic that will inspire and excite many, artistically, intellectually, or both.

We're a seasoned group of filmmakers and we're far enough into the production process that we know nothing can keep us from telling this extraordinary story. We hope you'll join us in telling it free of external pressures, the way the story needs to be told.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
