updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!

Anthony Sneed (producer, DP) here. I just wanted to give you all a well overdue update as to when you’ll be receiving the movie you guys paid for with your hard earned money.
Where the film is at now, is we’ve just signed up with a law firm out in LA and they are taking it around to distributors and places they think we’ll have the best shot at getting Boiled Angels distribution.

Greetings backers! The moment has finally arrived. BOILED ANGELS: THE TRIAL OF MIKE DIANA is having it's world premiere at the end of this month in NYC as part of the inaugural edition of What The Fest!? at the IFC Center. The screening takes place Saturday March 31st at 4:00 PM. Tickets are already on sale here: http://www.whatthefestnyc.com/film/the-trial-of-mike-diana/
The whole filmmaking team will be in attendance for a Q&A, including Mike Diana, director Frank Henenlotter, and producers Anthony Sneed & Mike Hunchback. We'll see you there!

project_data.project_name: The Trial of Mike Diana

campaign.story:
Kitty Strikes a Hollywood Pose!
Kitty Ravencraft, the beautiful magical witch and star of her own comic book, returns! This time Kitty is on top of the World! Her new comic book series is a huge success and she's once again the talk of the comic shops! Naturally, Kitty's publisher wants to capitalize on her new-found popularity with a big budget blockbuster Kitty movie! To make this happen, Kitty goes off to Hollywood, but once again she finds herself in danger! Someone is out to kill Kitty and this time even the reader won't know who's doing it or why! A lot of Kitty's old crowd from Die Kitty Die like Little Satan, Maxi Millions, and of course everyone's favorite kid corpse, Dippy the Dead Kid will be back. Some will be on Kitty's side and some of course are out to get her! Plus we'll see lots of new faces joining Kitty's cast. She'll face new menaces like the unstoppable Hexecutioner and she'll be aided by new allies like the cult-favorite family of freaks, the Carneys! Die Kitty Die: Hollywood Or Bust will be Kitty's biggest... scariest... and funniest adventure yet! It will be magical. Hopefully she'll survive!
Dan's cover for DIE KITTY DIE: HOLLYWOOD or BUST ! #1
  Fernando's cover for DIE KITTY DIE : HOLLYWOOD OR BUST #1
  The Carneys are our special guest stars ! How did they find their way into Kitty's world......?
  ....it turns out Kitty and Linda/Louise go way back! Who knew?
Right from the beginning, we knew there were more stories to tell about Kitty and her comic book world. After the phenomenal response to our first incredible Kickstarter and the very passionate support we received from our very kind fans, we're back to put together a project that is not only as good as and worthy of our first book but that surpasses it with more action, more adventure, more humor, and more surprises. In the first book, Kitty took on the comic book world and she's not done with them yet. Plus now she's also leaving her mark on Hollywood and the entertainment industry. You know there will be lots of fun and satire along the way! We always have a lot of fun working on Kitty's stories. We hope we can count on our very loyal and generous fans to make this the best ride yet!
Meet Dan and Fernando, your friendly creators!
We hope to follow the basic model of our first book with a four issue storyline that we will initially release as individual PDF issues. As before, each individual issue will feature twenty pages of original story and art plus fashion pages, funny ad pages, pin-ups, variant covers and other added material. We will be handling the bulk of the writing and drawing ourselves but much of this additional material may be completed by some of our talented friends and colleagues in the comic industry. Later, these issues will be collected into one softcover trade paperback and as per our last campaign, our goal is to collect enough funding to be able to make the softcover trade into a hardcover with a dust jacket.
We're Astrocomix!
Once again, we are planning on a number of stretch goals to make this project better and better.  We are hoping to add bonus material such as an additional exclusive story by the popular, talented Gisele Lagace and fashion pages by the awesome J Bone. In addition to these fun objectives, we've gotten really ambitious this time! If other goals are met, we hope to do two additional Kitty special issues such as a Kitty Summer Special and a Kitty Holiday Special. These would be really great additions to this round of Kitty Kickstartering but we can only get there with everyone's help!
Gisele Lagace is on board to do another Kitty story!
  Wanna see more fashion pages by the awesome J. Bone? Of course you do!
  One of our stretch goals will be to fund a KITTY SUMMER SPECIAL!! Let's do it!
  Fernando's Summer Special cover... if we're lucky enough to fund it!!
  Dan's cover to the DIE KITTY DIE CHRISTMAS SPECIAL!
  Fernando's cover for the DIE KITTY DIE CHRISTMAS SPECIAL!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since our incredibly successful Kickstarter campaign last year, Die Kitty Die has enjoyed a lot of good luck. The reception to our first Die Kitty Die book has been almost universally positive and Kitty has been picked up by Chapterhouse Comics to be published in single issues and distributed to retailers world wide! 

We'd like to point out to everyone that despite this great good fortune, producing Kitty still falls to us. This is what brings us to Kickstarter. We can't do it alone. As you might imagine producing four complete issues of original story and art takes a lot of manpower and resources. We have our impressively talented team of inkers, letterers, colorists and others that we must hire and pay. We also have other costs such as printing, shipping and many other miscellaneous expenses that we need to cover ourselves. We can't do this without the very generous help of our very kind and loyal fans and supporters. We were deeply appreciative and touched by the phenomenal amount of support we were shown throughout our first campaign and even afterwards. Making an independent creator-owned and driven project like Die Kitty Die has been our dream since long before either of us ever got into this business. We couldn't make that dream happen without your help.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Queer Japan Project is a multimedia documentary providing portraits of a diverse group of individuals from across the spectrum of gender and sexuality in Japan.
Artists, activists, community leaders, and everyday people will share an intimate look into the everyday triumphs and struggles of being a sexual minority in modern Japan. Through in-depth interviews and slice-of-life vignettes, Queer Japan will celebrate queer expression in Japan in many of its dazzling, prismatic varieties.
Vivienne Sato (ヴィヴィアン佐藤)
So far, director Graham Kolbeins and co-writer Anne Ishii (who are also collaborators at MASSIVE GOODS) have shot one week of interviews in Tokyo with artists like gay manga master Gengoroh Tagame, drag queen and renaissance woman Vivienne Sato, and controversial manko [pussy] artist Rokudenashiko. We also sat down with groundbreaking HIV activist, writer, and magazine editor Hiroshi Hasegawa, visual artist Nogi Sumiko, dancer Atsushi Matsuda of the renowned butoh group DAIRAKUDAKAN, and bar owner Masaki C. Matsumoto. 
Atsushi Matsuda (松田篤史) and the Butoh group DAIRAKUDAKAN
Nogi Sumiko (ノギ スミコ)
Now, we’re raising funds for a five month shoot (from April to August 2016) in locations across Japan. We’ll follow up with our existing subjects while expanding the scope of The Queer Japan Project to tell even more stories of LGBTQ+ (and beyond) people in Japan. The project will manifest over multiple media including online videos, gallery exhibitions, and a book of photography with extended interviews. The main component of the project is the feature-length documentary Queer Japan, which will be submitted to 2017 film festivals in Japan, the United States, and around the world.
Thanks to a Creative Artists Exchange Fellowship awarded by the Japan-U.S. Friendship Commission, director Graham Kolbeins will be able to stay in Japan for five months on a cultural visa, working on this project. With housing and basic living expenses covered by the JUSFC grant, funding raised by Kickstarter will go directly to:
Travel expenses: it's important for us to tell the stories of queer people all across Japan, in places like Osaka, Kobe, Sapporo, and Hokkaido, as well as small towns where queer communities are hard to come by. 
Equipment: Memory cards, hard drives, cinema lenses, monopods, stabilizers, microphones, and hardware for editing in 4K.
Crew: Cinematographer, editors, sound department, on-set interpreters, translators, and on-set photographers.
Original score: new music for the documentary composed by Will Wiesenfeld (Baths, Geotic).
Print publications: As mentioned in the Kickstarter rewards, we'll be producing a black and white zine and a color photo book in addition to the feature length documentary.  
HIV activist and writer Hiroshi Hasegawa (長谷川 博史) with renowned manga artist and historian Gengoroh Tagame (田亀源五郎). Longtime friends and co-founders of G-men magazine.

Rokudenashiko (ろくでなし子)
 日本語の映画の説明 
「クィア・ジャパン」は、アーティストや活動家、演者、コミュニティーの指導者、そして一般人を紹介するドキュメンタリーです。 インタビューや実生活の一片の描写を通して様々な当事者が自分の独特なストーリーを知ることができます。  
こちらのブログでは 「クィア・ジャパン」の影響や、この映画に出会う人たちやイベントなどをご紹介します。このドキュメンタリーで取り上げられている多くの物語は、LGBTコミュニティーでポジティブな変化をもたらした人たちを注目しながら、ゲイ、レズビアン、バイセクシャル、トランスジェンダーなどのセクシャル・マイノリティー の当事者に立ちはだかる難事を取り上げるものです。  
「クィア・ジャパン」の製作は、グレアム・コルベインズが獲得した、日米友好基金（JUSFC）による「日米芸術家交換プログラム」のフェローシップにより可能になりました。
Co-writer Anne Ishii and director Graham Kolbeins working on their Eisner-nominated anthology, "Massive: Gay Erotic Manga and the Men Who Make It"
Check our Kickstarter updates for more video content, and follow us on Tumblr, Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter @QueerJapan. Use #QueerJapan and #クイアジャパン to help spread the word!
Some of the rewards available from Gengoroh Tagame, Rokudenashiko, and MASSIVE GOODS
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
For The Queer Japan Project the succeed, we need full-time crew members in editing, sound, cinematography, and production coordination. Translation, transcription, and on-set interpreting will also be crucial to the film's production. To expand the project beyond Tokyo, we'll need a transportation budget to shoot in locations around the country, from Kyoto to Sapporo to Okinawa. Additionally, we'll be using the production budget to secure equipment including lenses, microphones, memory cards, and hardware to edit the film in 4K resolution. 

Aside from the feature-length documentary, this project will include art exhibitions, a series of web videos, photography, and printed publications. The interviews we've already conducted are so rich and detailed that it's evident we'll need to publish extended interviews online and in print. A full color Queer Japan photo book will include excerpts from these interviews and information that won't fit into the film's running time. The book will also include on-set photography by a variety of talented photographers from Japan and the U.S. 

Beyond the financial challenges of putting together this multimedia documentary project, logistically, we'll need to build a robust network of queer people and allies within Japan to secure subjects and crew members for the documentary.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Queer Japan Theatrical Trailer!
Hey backers, we are beyond excited to share the brand new North American theatrical trailer for Queer Japan! The trailer debuted just this morning on The Advocate, in advance of our Theatrical-at-Home and VOD release on December 11th.

Hey Backers, 
I hope you're all doing well and staying safe in the global pandemic. Due to the shutdown of theaters, I'm sorry to say the film's theatrical release has been delayed. Queer Japan's distributor in North America, Altered Innocence, is still committed to a theatrical release, and we're hoping that will be possible in early 2021.

Hi everyone, and Happy New Year! 
We're excited to continue rolling out the festival release of Queer Japan over the next few months, starting with our first festival date of 2020: Sydney's Mardi Gras Film Festival on February 15th! We've got film festivals in the UK and elsewhere coming up, so stay tuned to our social media pages @QueerJapan for specifics as more dates are announced.

Watch the teaser for Queer Japan, and come see it on the big screen at Rainbow Reel Tokyo on Monday, July 15th and Outfest Los Angeles on Sunday, July 21st! More information on Queer Japan’s festival screening schedule at QueerJapanMovie.com 
『クィア・ジャパン』予告編が公開！7月15日レインボー・リール東京での世界初公開に続き、7月21日にはロサンゼルスのOutfestで全米初公開！さらに映画祭での公開が続きます。

QueerJapanMovie.com 🗾🌈✨ The official website is now live! 公式サイトが新しくなりました！
After three years of hard work, Queer Japan is nearly complete! We have screened the film for cast and crew in Tokyo and began submitting to film festivals. As we fine tune the final cut, we look forward to premiering the completed movie in 2019.

updates.update_userinfo: Film Festivals!! Outfest and Rainbow Reel Tokyo
updates.update_content: 日本語版は下にスクロールしてください

Hey Queer Japan backers!
I hope you've all had a good summer (or winter, if you're in the southern hemisphere). We've been making steady progress on post-production, and we're ramping up our editing efforts as the year comes to a close. Thanks to our post-production crowdfunding (still ongoing at GoFundMe.com/QueerJapan), we're now able and looking to hire an Assistant Editor, ideally someone based in Sourthern California and familiar with Japanese, to help us complete a one-hour working cut. From there, we'll be pitching the project to various organizations to secure the remaining completion funds. If all goes smoothly, expect a 2018 release for !

Dear Queer Japan backers,

We’re excited to announce a new crowdfunding campaign for Queer Japan’s post-production!   

Thanks to your contributions last year, we were able to spend 5 months shooting in locations across Japan, capturing over 100 interviews with some really amazing individuals. Editing that mountain of footage has been a daunting process, progressing little by little. We were encouraged by a successful preview screening of 20 minutes of new footage at the Japan Society Gallery in NYC last weekend.

campaign.story:
Kwanza Osajyefo, Tim Smith 3, Jamal Igle, Khary Randolph and Sarah Litt have teamed up to produce the graphic novel, BLACK.
After miraculously surviving being gunned down by police, a young man learns that he is part of the biggest lie in history. Now he must decide whether it's safer to keep it a secret or if the truth will set him free.
$45,000: UPGRADE U 
All pledges $25 and up will now include a 8.5” x 11” mini-poster of Jamal’s illustration of Juncture and Kareem. Pledges $50 and above will receive an additional 11” x 17” large-format poster of Khary’s cover.
Additionally, all $25 rewards will include a custom BLACK branded bookmark, and $50 rewards and up will receive three bookmarks, representing each faction within the story.
$55,000: THE BEAUTIFUL STRUGGLE 
Fight scenes in comics can be brief and have a lot of dialogue that wouldn’t be possible in a real fight. It’s been part of Kwanza’s dream to do an epic, cinematic fight scene with minimal dialogue and loads of action.
This goal would add 20 extra pages to the climactic battle at the end of BLACK. Expect all-out action that will give the characters more room to show off their skills and abilities.
PLUS we’ll include a hint at what’s to come after the conclusion of BLACK.
$65,000: BIRTH OF A NATION 
How long have Blacks had superpowers and how has it been kept secret from the world at large? Kwanza Osajyefo and Tim Smith 3 will reveal insights from the lost pages of the Mann family diary dating back as far as the 15th century to present day.
The story will be a limited series published via LINE Webtoons and on BLACK’s social media channels after the graphic novel is released.
$100,000: TOUCH THE SKY
For our final stretch goal we’re aiming at $100,000 to make the book physically bigger – 6.6 x 0.2 x 10.2 inches to be precise. Doing so means adding to weight, printing, and shipping costs but we’d love for people to read BLACK at the same size as most other graphic novels.
CHARACTERS
BLACK is a 120-page story that is comprised of six chapters. If we reach our funding goal, we'll begin work to release issues monthly on digital platforms starting mid-2016.
In advance of the printed book backers will receive issues as DRM-free PDFs in addition to the entire digital volume (with extras!).We're also offering other rewards including prints and special art; please scroll through and pick something you like.
REWARD HIGHLIGHTS
After Reward 2 most subsequent rewards include a limited edition of BLACK. This special version will only be available to Kickstarter pledges of $25 and up. 
Pledges above $50 will receive extra swag with their book, and $100 will get you a copy signed by the whole creative team and your name on the thank you page in the back of the book.
Almost all of the funding amount will go towards illustration, production, and delivery of rewards to our supporters.
THE CREATIVE TEAM
Creator/Author
Creator and writer of BLACK, Kwanza Osajyefo is a former digital editor at Marvel and DC Comics – best known for launching DC's Zuda imprint, which published series like the award-winning Bayou, High Moon, Night Owls, as well as Supertron, Celadore, Black Cherry Bombshells, Bottle of Awesome, and I Rule the Night.
Co-Creator/Designer
Co-creator and designer of BLACK, Tim Smith 3 (A.K.A TS3), has been working in the comic industry for over 15 years. He created and self-published Red After the Party, and has worked on hit titles for some of the biggest publishers in the industry! To see more of TS3’s work, check out: JUNEMOON.NET.
Interior Illustrator
Recipient of the 2011 Inkpot Award for Outstanding Achievement in Comic Art, Jamal Igle is the writer/artist/Creator of Molly Danger for Action Lab Entertainment. He’s pencilled everything from indie faves to Marvel, DC hits, and now BLACK. He is VP of Marketing and Publicity for Action Lab Entertainment.
Cover Illustrator
Since graduating from School of Visual Arts with a BFA in Cartooning and Illustration, Khary’s been involved in TV, marketing, and comics. The cover artist for BLACK, he’s worked on everything from TMNT to The Boondocks and Hellboy, as well as designs for Brooklyn Brewery – most recently he’s worked on Robin Wars for DC. He's currently developing a new title for Marvel.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk to BLACK is not reaching its funding goal. We've assembled a dedicated team of comics veterans who can deliver this project. We've also hired a fulfillment company to handle delivery of all rewards. 

Almost all funds will go to compensating these professionals for their time.

Another risk is the continued lack of diversity in the comics profession and in content. Our core principle is to tell an entertaining story – but the material and creative team also represent an effort for Black creators to own our narrative and have agency in the industry.

We thank you in advance for your support. #goBLACK
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone

Camilla Zhang, the Comics Outreach Lead at Kickstarter is looking to hear from you!
Kickstarter Comics is nearing an exciting milestone and they want to celebrate the incredible backer community with a social media campaign highlighting the projects that have meant the most to them.

Want to tell them how much Black and White has meant to you? Email by August 30th with a short quote, a selfie with the book(s), and your social media handle! You can talk about how it's impacted your life or if it brought a smile to your face. No story is too big or too small.

If you don't want to show your whole face, you can use the book to cover most of your mug or take a photo of the project with an animal companion. The possibilities are many, and everyone is encouraged to incorporate their personality!

Thanks for reading. Looking forward to seeing your stories soon!

By Kwanza Osajyefo
“What if only black people had superpowers?”

updates.update_userinfo: GETTING THE BAND BACK TOGETHER...ON AND OFF THE PAGE
updates.update_content: Almost four years ago, Kwanza Osajyefo and Tim Smith 3 came to my apartment and pitched me a simple, but brilliant, concept. “What if Only Black People had superpowers?,” a simple, obvious concept that I was surprised  no one had ever pitched before, as far as I knew. At that moment I knew I had to be involved with the project. That simple pitch became the first part of what we’ve dubbed “The Black Superpowers Universe:” six issues, 140 pages leading to three spinoffs and a lot of attention.

updates.update_userinfo: Kwanza Osajyefo on why WHITE has to exist.... and a sneak peek of the first 5 pages! io9 exclusive!
updates.update_content:
Kwanza Osajyefo wrote an article for io9 explaining the thinking behind WHITE and how it relates to BLACK. We're also giving you an exclusive sneak peek at the first 5 pages. Check it out here and share with your friends! 
BLACK Writer Kwanza Osajyefo on the Series' New Sequel, and the Need for Diverse Comics Heroes

updates.update_userinfo: AND WE BACK, AND WE BACK
updates.update_content:
Whaddup, y’all!
We’ve just launched our Kickstarter for WHITE, the second part of the trilogy that started with our critically acclaimed graphic novel, BLACK.
It’s hard to believe that three years ago we took a chance that people might back the concept: “what if only black people had superpowers.” It was an idea partially borne out of not seeing black people in positions with agency and how that results in a lack of representation in comics.

We’ve received an update from our distribution partner that books are going out this week!
Sorry for the delay.
Printing, shipping, and packing all of the copies slammed our small operation, but we’re determined and glad that limited editions of BLACK are finally rolling out.

campaign.story:
GET A SAMPLE BY CLICKING HERE!
Help us get to 1,000,000% FUNDED! 
That's our goal. 1,000,000% overfunded. We can get there, and we're going to have fun doing it. I'm going to be doing embarrassing, fun stuff all month to get us there. 
***JUST FYI, it says PDF in the rewards, but we are going to send the .mobi and .epub files as well!***
***THIS BOOK IS 100% DONE. WE ARE LOOKING FOR PRINTING AND PROOFREADING FUNDS ONLY. We have successfully run and shipped two publishing Kickstarters in the past, so we know what we are doing. You WILL get this book.***
Paperback Cover for MFDKH
MY FATHER DIDN'T KILL HIMSELF is a fully edited and ready for print 300 page young adult mystery novel told through blog posts between Delilah and her best friend Alex as they come to terms with an intimate death and how it changes their relationship.  
Published by Wannabe Press, this is our third Kickstarter and we've successfully delivered the previous two, so you're assured to get this book. 
What's this book about anyway?
Delilah is a teenager who adores her father, so when he commits suicide it's devastating to her. He was the perfect dad in her eyes, and her family had the perfect life.
When her father's life insurance policy won't pay out on a suicide, she sets out to prove he was actually murdered so she doesn't lose her childhood home. 
Set in 2007, My Father Didn't Kill Himself is told all through blog posts between Delilah and her best friend Alex as they battle through the emotional turmoil of the death somebody they love...and the realization they might not be the perfect person. 
But before you think the book is wholly depressing, don't worry. I don't roll like that. In fact, my thing is kind of taking wholly depressing loglines and stories, then injecting humor and warmth into them. I'm like John Green meets Kurt Vonnegut, or at least that's who I aspire to be one day...they both have amazing hair. 
So who the heck am I? 
My name is Russell Nohelty. I am the publisher of Wannabe Press and the creator/writer of tons of awesome projects, mostly in the comic book space...until now.
I've successfully funded Katrina Hates the Dead and Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter through Kickstarter, delivered them, and now I want to move into publishing traditional novels. 
Really? What qualifies you, some sort of comic picture guy, to write a novel? 
Besides the fact that I love it and am passionate about it, right? Well let me tell you about comics. 
Comics are incredibly complex. They need great writing and great art to bring everything together. It's not just amazing art in great comics, but there's also incredible story. 
As for the prose itself, I've been writing for over a decade in the movie/tv/web series space. If you look up Connections and Russell Nohelty on Youtube, you'll even see one of my first projects as a writer and director. You'll also see very clearly why I don't direct any more.
Finally, I've already WRITTEN a novel! Gumshoes: The Case of Madison's Father was a middle grade fiction book we released in 2014. Originally published through Oaklight Publishing, we re-released the book ourselves with our own editors. 
Additionally, I've got two other completed manuscripts, fully edited, ready to go once we get through this Kickstarter. 
Ugh! Alright. So you've got Koalifications as a writer, but how do I know I'm going to get this book in my hands, huh? 
That's a great question.  
Most writers aren't publishers. They don't have any idea how to get a book from the page through editing and finally into your hands. 
Not us. Wannabe Press already has a distribution channel through Ingram, and we're already stocked in dozens of book stores around the country. 
So not only can I write a great story, but we as a team can deliver a book as we've proven in the past. I can tell you that for sure because we've already been doing it for years! 
Wait, You've got a publishing company. Why are you on Kickstarter then, millionaire? 
Um...because as an indie publisher we don't make money. At least not enough to scale our business and get recognition in the way we want. We're very well respected with those that know us, but that doesn't mean we make that cheddar. 
There's a reason we're called Wannabe Press. 
Thank you so much for considring contributing. If you got this far I know you care about crowdfunding, like this project, and think pledging is a good idea. So please, even if it's only $1 it helps so much.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We try to take all the risks and challenging out of your mind before we launch a product. However, we can't take out all the risk. I know you will receive this project. The biggest thing I can't answer, though, is when the book will get into your hands. 

I can't promise a date. Though I will say it SHOULD be in your hands by June/July timeframe.

Here's why I won't promise anything: 

It takes two weeks for Kickstarter to disburse funds, then another two weeks for the survey to be completed. That's a month right there.

Then it takes about another 6-8 weeks for me to work with the printer, get test copies, add all of the additional rewards into the book, and order a full run of the book. That's two more months.

Once the book gets to me it takes 2-4 weeks for me to ship everything out and get it into your hands. There's another month. 

All in all, that's four months. I would also like to do 1-2 more passes with my editor just to make sure everything is perfect. That could be another month or two.

I hope I can work faster than that, but all in all it COULD take up to 6 months. That's because I want to make sure everything is perfect. 

If I didn't add people into the book or make special thanks sections we could be done quicker. 

However, that's one of the great joys of Kickstarter, to get written into the book and have your name listed in the credits forever. I don't want to take that away from you, the fans.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Cthulhu is Hard to Spell: The Terrible Twos contains thirty-eight all-ages appropriate stories from 73 creators about the gods and monsters of the Lovecraft universe. Yes, there is horror, but there are also silly stories, funny stories, sci-fi stories, whimsical stories, and slice of life stories as well. The focus is on the gods and monsters themselves, with plenty of psychological and cosmic horror thrown into the mix, too.

campaign.story:
Comics from every color of the rainbow!
ALPHABET is a comics anthology with LGBTQAI contributors drawn from previous winners of and outstanding applicants to the Prism Comics Queer Press Grant. It will also showcase the work of industry veterans who have been pioneers in queer comics and talented newcomers whose fresh voices document emerging identities and perspectives in our community.
What is the Queer Press Grant?
The Prism Comics Queer Press Grant was founded in 2005 to support up and coming LGBTQAI cartoonists. Prism Comics is the only organization in North America which provides a grant to emerging comics talent. Past winners include Steve MacIsaac (Shirtlifter), Ed Luce (Wuvable Oaf), Blue Delliquanti (O Human Star), and Christine Smith (The Princess). To learn more about the QPG visit prismcomics.org.

Who's responsible for all this?

How much do we need to make ALPHABET a reality?
The budget for ALPHABET, the backer rewards, and other necessities for our project:
Who's contributing?
Our diverse group of creators includes Ahri Almeida, Elizabeth Beier, Christianne Benedict, Bex, Jennifer Camper, Vi Cao, Tyler Cohen, Howard Cruse, Dave Davenport, Dylan Edwards, Tana Ford, Melanie Gillman, Diego Gomez, Soizick Jaffre, Emeric Kennard, Robert Kirby, Hanna-Pirita Lehkonen, Ed Luce, Steve MacIsaac, Hazel Newlevant, Hanna Oliver, Eric Orner, David Quantic, Carlo Quispe, Sonya Saturday, Mike Sullivan, Dax Tran-Caffee, Josh Trujillo, Kelsey Wroten, and many more!

What's in it for me?
Glad you asked! Here's a list of our backer rewards...
A digital copy of ALPHABET!
A hardcover copy of ALPHABET!
 Hand-drawn sketchcards from ALPHABET contributors!
 An exclusive adult coloring book featuring real life LGBTQIA heroes!
 NEW! The QUILTBAG tote bag!
Original art from ALPHABET!
 And an exclusive ALPHABET t-shirt!
Check out our rewards packages for further details!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The vast majority of our contributors have turned in their stories as of this writing, and the design and graphics work for ALPHABET is finished but for a few touches. Our printer is ready to go as soon as they receive our final draft, and we're already establishing relationships with distributors. Stacked Deck Press and Prism Comics are gearing up for a long convention season of sales and promotion. However, there are still plenty of things for us to do before everything is ready for you, the generous reader and backer of our project, and your reading pleasure. 

Once the campaign funds we still have to collect and assemble the material for the exclusive real life queer heroes coloring book and choose our final design for the ALPHABET t-shirt. Preparing the rewards, the final editing of the book, and the printing and transportation of all materials will take some time. Our goal is to have ALPHABET debut at WonderCon in Los Angeles over Easter Weekend 2016. We will fulfill all the backer rewards in April 2016.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WELCOME! AND A QUICK "DIE KITTY DIE!" INTRO                   
Kitty Ravencraft, a beautiful and magical young witch, is the star of her own popular comic book. When her greedy, publicity-starved publisher wants to increase interest in her comic book, he does what many comic book publishers do nowadays... he sets out to kill his main character, Kitty! Even worse, he decides to REALLY spike sales by killing the REAL Kitty in REAL life! The question is though... how do you kill a witch? "DIE, KITTY! DIE!" is a funny, exciting, and often sexy story about a girl caught in both the supernatural world of witches, and the super-crazy world of comics!

DAN PARENT and FERNANDO RUIZ. WHO ARE THESE GUYS?
Creators Dan Parent and Fernando Ruiz pose with some of their artwork for "Die Kitty Die!"
Some of you may not know us but we've been in the comic business for over twenty years. We've produced many popular, high-selling comics for other publishers, e.g. Archie Meets Kiss, Archie Vs Predator, Felix the Cat, etc. Over the years, we've often talked about the possibility of doing something together that is creator owned, and the timing for this has finally arrived. "Die Kitty Die!" will be a collaborative effort where we'll share writing and art duties. This will be our first joint effort under own new label, Astrocomix (it just sounds better than Parent & Ruiz comics, you know?) We hope this venture will prove popular enough that we can produce more books and possibly launch more projects! You can read more about us individually at our own web-sites: danparent.com and fernandoruizeverybody.com  And for more Kitty info there's diekittydie.com and her Facebook page here
WHAT ARE WE TRYING TO FUND HERE?
Fernando's cover for Die Kitty Die #1
Dan's cover for DIE KITTY DIE #1 !
Gisele and Shouri's gorgeous pin-up which will be a print too!
With this campaign, we are looking to fund the printing of the first "Die, Kitty Die!" collected trade. We say collected as our plan is to first release this trade as four 24+ page digital issues that will be delivered to backers on a monthly basis until the printed trade is ready to ship. Each issue will include 20 page of story, funny ad pages, fashion pages, pin-ups, AND variant covers produced by our very talented and accomplished friends in the comics business. We feel this route will satisfy both print and digital fans.

We have set a lean, realistically-attainable goal of US$25, 000. This will help us pay for a print run of one thousand copies of the first trade, help us pay the printing of the art cards and posters we are offering, pay our collaborators/contributors, AND of course, cover the shipping cost for about half the print run. Speaking of collaborators inks will be handled by artists extraordinaire  J. Bone and Rich Koslowski. Colors will be handled by Dan and amazing color artist Shouri. Other contributors will include webcomics pioneer and creator of Menage à 3, Gisèle Lagacé, the fantastic Phil Jimenez, and pop culture artist phenomenon Glen Hanson! And the incredible Darwyn Cooke will be doing the cover to the trade!
The color version of J. Bone's pin up is spectacular!
Phil Jiminez draws a captivating Kitty!

  another look at Gisèle's work...we cant wait to see covers and stories from her!
Shouri's amazing work !
Glen Hanson is going to bring his super style to the world of Kitty!
Darwyn Cooke is doing the cover to the trade! Need we say more?

Here's some sample art from the first trade:
Kitty and her geek squad
how it all began over 50 years ago...
home sweet home....
Kitty's changed with the times...not that it will save her...

Along the way, you'll meet the nutty characters who inhabit Kitty's world. You'll meet her friends Rudy and Mara and her comic book co-stars like the funny phantom, Dippy the Dead-Kid and the fiery fiend, L'il Satan!) Plus, a whole slew of off the wall characters from the entire history of "Kitty Comics". Some good. Some bad. Some VERY bad.
Dippy and Friends!
Kitty's hangout!
If our supporters are especially generous with us, and we exceed our goal, we will reward everyone by growing our project to include more story pages in our collected trade. Gisèle Lagacé & J. Bone already agreed to provide additional material if this happens. Exceeding our goal could also lead to a limited hardcover edition, and more goodies!

Before getting into the rewards, we would like to thank you for your time, and send a shout-out to all the fans we've met at conventions and other venues. Many of you have become cherished friends, and very loyal supporters. We hope you'll follow us on this very personal and dear venture. Kitty is our own creation, and it makes this campaign a very personal and important undertaking for us. Your support means everything to us. Also! Big thanks to Justin M. Salvato for putting our video together. You did a great job, Justin, and helped these two cartoonists get their message across!  

STRETCH GOALS
ADD ONS!
 ADD- ON INSTRUCTIONS: 
THE REWARDS!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are comic book veterans with collectively over forty-plus years of experience in producing and publishing comic books. We have worked for numerous publishers and we have both published our own independent ventures. In order to keep our financial goals as low and as attainable as possible, we are not paying ourselves for own own efforts in this project. We will be producing "Die, Kitty! Die" as we maintain our output for other comic book publishers and clients. Our goal is to produce the Kitty series throughout the Spring of 2016 and have the collected trade volume by the Summer convention season later that same year. We are both battle-weary veterans who are no strangers to tight deadlines and a high workload. We are confident in our time table and are looking forward to sharing Kitty's stories with our friends and fans throughout 2016!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
UPDATE: Watch future episodes of Cooking with Drag Queens before anyone else does, by simply making a donation to this campaign. 
If everyone who saw this pledged just $1, we would have been funded already. 
----------------------------------------
Cooking with Drag Queens is a hit! With over one million views since it officially launched, this original reality web series is taking the world by storm. Season One was an all-you-can eat buffet of tantalizing drag queens and food, but people are hungry for more so now is the time to pop Season Two into the oven and get it funded for an early spring 2016 delivery.
Coming soon: the Season One Finale of Cooking with Drag Queens, featuring Katya Zamolodchikova.
Some of you are saying “I know what a cooking show is, but what’s a drag queen?” A drag queen is anyone who can transform themselves into a beautiful creature of their own creation! And boy do we have some beauties lined up for you!
Season Two of Cooking with Drag Queens will feature the freshest of talent our “dragnet” can catch. We are talking with some amazing entertainers that'll surely whet your appetite as we follow them with our cameras and then bring them into the kitchen to set it on fire.
But it’s only going to happen if we get funded.
Fausto Fernós, Alaska 5000 and Marc Felion at the Battle of the Seasons.
Our friend Alaska 5000 says that “when you tip a drag queen a dollar, you’re sharing a moment with that queen,” well, when you help fund Cooking with Drag Queens, you’re sharing a “drag inspired moment with the world.”
So it’s time to turn up the heat and make this world sizzle.
But before we get started on a second season we’ll need the following ingredients:
Professional multi-camera crew. 
Lighting & Sound technicians. 
Video editors and direction.
Food to prepare.
Travel and Accommodation costs.
You’ll get to know your favorite drag queens better as we explore their world and then bring them into the kitchen to set it on fire.
Or turn the kitchen into a rainbow explosion of fruity delights. Lucy Stoole, our presenter queen from the Season 2 Kickstarter with Marc Felion and Fausto Fernós.
While creating the first season, we discovered exciting new talent that we’d love to showcase for season two. What’s really exciting is some legendary queens have expressed interest in whipping something up in the kitchen and sharing some old family recipes handed down from their drag mothers. Yes godnessa!
The drag queens, as always, will be the inspiration for the recipes we create and we’ll continue to add a tasty twist to the classics, combining flavors and cultures in exciting new ways. We think you’ll love what we have in store for you!
If you’d like to see more programming with drag queens, this is your way to share it with the world.
Our goal is $25,000 to produce Season Two with at least 10 drag queens, but if we go over our target, we’ll add even more episodes with more gals. Give big to support the project and you’ll get great rewards: Cooking with Drag Queens aprons, tote bags, t-shirts and more at our big gay bake sale with homemade goods- fresh form our oven and into your mouth.
With your support, Cooking with Drag Queens will be a community funded, broadcast quality program. Every show will be free to watch online, to anyone around the world.
We’ll introduce so many new and amazing gals to the world. The drag queens deserve it, and so do you.
Please share this video with your friends, blog about it, or send in your own testimonial video in drag.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The answer to all of life’s challenges is always the same - more drag! A smear of lipstick and a wig teased all the way to heaven go a long way.

But, in addition to that, there are key ingredients to creating a successful cooking show: testing recipes; interviewing, selecting and scheduling the guests; and delivering the series in a regular and timely manner.

We lost or director/editor last year but we were lucky enough to find a brilliant new one who has signed on for season two.

Thankfully, we aren’t doing this project alone- we’ve built an amazing team that is just as passionate about drag and food as we are, from photographers to food stylists to a sexy dish crew that just loves to clean up our messes. Oh dish crew!

Since 2005, we’ve had the pleasure of interviewing the world’s top drag queens and introduced fabulous new talent on our award winning podcast, Feast of Fun. We’ve recorded over 2200 podcast so you know we have the drive and determination to put all the pieces together and carry through on our promise to continue this web series.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi there! Thank you for your past support of Cooking with Drag Queens. We put so much of our heart and soul into the show so we’re thrilled when somebody shares our enthusiasm for this unique series.
Right now we're at a crossroads. YouTube has decimated all ad revenue for LGBT content. Some have watched their income from the site drop by 90% in just the past few months. Because of this, we need you help to continue Cooking with Drag Queens, and help it grow into something bigger, yummer, tastier.

campaign.story:
Let's talk about the importance of queer space, and preserving it. 
I'm new to this whole making videos business. Please pardon the meandering. Thanks! 
______
ONE WEEK LEFT! 
Superstar Artist Sean Murphy did this INCREDIBLE illustration for the cover of Duck! Third Time is the Charm!  
Sean Murphy COVER of Duck! Third Time is the Charm
Ah it's so awesome! 
It's also the first time the world is seeing our transman extraordinaire (behind the wheel)! 
Everyone who backs at the $16 tier and above will automatically get both Duck! and Duck! Second Chances downloads when the campaign closes! 
____
SKOTTIE YOUNG --Marvel artist extraordinaire (and indy comic making POWERHOUSE!) just did a sketch of my lesbian leading ladies! (Colors by me): 
LOOK AT THIS BEAUTY!! (*tana dies*)
Skottie for the WIN!!!
Ride that inspirational wave over to the green DONATE button --------->
(If any of you need me, I'll be in the corner freaking out how about how awesome this is)
Representation Matters! And the great, progressive creators of our time (of which Skottie Young is certainly one!) know this! Follow their example. Follow his example. Support art and artists. Support positive reflections of lesbians in this world! 
YAY! 
------------------------ 
WEEK TWO: ACHIEVED! 
We are at the halfway mark of our campaign and I've got some surprises and exciting updates on deck. But first, check out this *NEW* page! Long Live Gay Comics! 
LONG LIVE INDY COMICS!! 
Duck! You need to go GET that girl!
Just wait 'til you see that bathroom
ONE WEEK: DONE! 
And we are 1/3rd of the way to the finish! 
WOOHOO!
To celebrate here is another page in all its purple glory. 
Please remember to share this project with your friends --Why? --because representation matters! Even if that representation sometimes includes your friends puking off a balcony into a swimming pool. Hey, sometimes that happens! 
#judgmentfreezone
---
Duck! Third Time is the Charm is a graphic novel that follows the misbegotten adventures of a group of lesbian friends over one Memorial Day weekend in Provincetown, Massachusetts. 
The book will be 100(ish) pages, full color, and offset printed (not some lackluster digital print job). It's already written, so while you are reading this Kickstarter and deciding what to donate, I'm already at work on the interior pages.
MILESTONE: ACHIEVED! For the first time in my life y'all, -- I SOLD OUT!!-- of the Holiday Reward Tier of my very first Kickstarter Campaign (WAHOO!) 
MILESTONE: Check!
And today we also passed another Milestone: This book is 20% funded! (HIP HIP HOORAY!) Just a meager little 80% to go. And none of it would have happened without YOUR generosity and support. 
I am delighted to announce that i have teamed up with my West Coast publisher, NORTHWEST PRESS to offer a complete digital bundle of all the Duck! books! Downloadable versions of the first two books will be available to backers immediately once we successfully close this Kickstarter. A download code for Duck! Third Time is the Charm will be emailed out once production on the story wraps.
And speaking of production!
Here is a sneak peek at Duck! Third Time is the Charm:
It's a work in progress but I am loving it.
Ah, Friendship
No chewing
In the final version there'll be a nice golden light filtering through the trees. Ptown is really quite a lovely place. 
What a thrill to get to draw comics and make stories that matter. Stories that I have wanted to see in this world for my whole life. Only now, with your help, we get to be making them together! #winning. 
Just fantastic. 
ONWARD! 
Digital Copies of all 3 Duck! Books.
The new Reward Tier is chock full of downloads! Click to your heart's content! 
Here follows the basics: 
Digital download (PDF) of "Duck! Third Time is the Charm"
Just the book! Nice and simple.
The physical book and the virtual version. Think of this as "simple plus"
For those who love my John Hancock. And doodles.
The signed book, a black & white sketch on the inside cover, what's not to love?
The Book, a Head Sketch of your choice on the inside cover, the PDF and a Canvas Art Print (image to be announced soon!) Get 'em before they're gone!
RETAILER INCENTIVE! Thanks SO MUCH for carrying comics with queer content, you guys! #winning
For those of you who want your ART faster! This tier will give you full color art in time for the holidays.
 Check out the rewards bracket on the right to see all of the goodies I have to offer. There's a Skype sesh with me and we can talk about whatever you like. I am well-versed in the fields of art, poetry, literature, comics (queer and otherwise) and any number of other topics that tickle your fancy.
I've also included a couple of cameo options for you big spenders out there. Have you ever wanted to see yourself surrounded by a community of like-minded women? Well, now you can, literally!
Open to all people! No restrictions on age, gender, identity or anything.
Provincetown is a busy place, all sorts of people live and work there. If you want to see yourself in the pages of my world, I will find just the right spot for you.  (Very limited number of spots. Once they go, they're gone!) 
Finally, here are some excerpts and artwork from "Duck!" and (the sold-out) "Duck! Second Chances"
In case you are wondering how she got that name
Excerpt from "Duck! An Original Graphic Novel" (2010)
Excerpt from "Duck! An Original Graphic Novel" (2010)
Excerpt from "Duck! Second Chances" (2014)
Excerpt from "Duck! Second Chances" (2014)
Ah, friendship.
Thanks for reading this far.
I hope you will help me make this big gay book a reality.
Long live comics! 
~Tana

Risks and challenges
The book is already written, so, that's good news. More good news is that, while this is my first Kickstarter, it is not the first time I have ever made a graphic novel from scratch. I'm old hat at delivering artwork and working on a deadline.

I have prepared reasonable time lines both for the art creation and for the book production/goal fulfillment. I've tried to anticipate the challenges that I will face but no system is perfect and unforeseen delays might arise -- worry not, friends! This book will reach you!

campaign.story:
UPDATE: We hit our goal!
We've hit our initial goal, but the party doesn't end here! Scroll down for our stretch goals!
Insurance is the industry of information. If the insurance company knows you smoke cigarettes, they'll charge you more for life insurance. But all sorts of crazy things get insured these days. Governments carry insurance policies for risk management on terrorist attacks. Hedge funds trade derivatives off derivatives off everything.
The Pros approach volatile, unpredictable situations with a mandate to "fix" them, any way they want. But with that freedom comes responsibility. Why not use this morally dubious job to try and do some good?
Their first mission: defuse a potentially lethal standoff between federal agents and a gun worshiping cult. Can they do it without anybody dying? Can they even survive the job themselves?
Check out our FREE 8-page preview, here.
While we're at it, check out this free preview of issue 2, too.
The Pros issue 1 cover
About This Project
All the art for issue 1 is finished, now we just need a way to share it with you! By backing this Kickstarter, you will help raise the money to print and ship it straight down your lovely throats.
This first issue is 22 pages, full color, PLUS a backmatter essay by Iraq Veteran and activist Scott Olsen.
Wait. Insurance...spies?
Insurance is the industry of information. And industry is taking over government functions one by one. Like Blackwater founder Erik Prince, who said, "We are trying to do for the national security apparatus what FedEx did for the Postal Service."
Why wouldn't some audacious businessperson decide to "disrupt" the bloated, inefficient, unpopular NSA? Why wouldn't that person be H.A. Klamath, Company Insurance's overseer of The Pros?
Or maybe it's all a little bit goofy.
Read The Pros if you want a comic about big data and privatization, about guns as both symbol for freedom and a weapon for murder, about veterans, gender, drones, technology, and the future. Except a little bit goofy.
Who are The Pros?
Issue 1 follows Nass, an Afghanistan War veteran turned peace activist who's disillusioned with both worlds.
Next up is Caitlyn: serious, hardworking, and extremely loyal. Most of us don't put up with bullshit; Caitlyn takes this to an art form.
cle is the team's hacker—posthuman, agender, and able to create anything out of anything else.
Sasha has 7 PhD's for the same reason he has big muscles: just to show off.
And finally Buzzy, the team's pet drone. An experimental model from Company Aeronautics, Buzzy is fully autonomous and uncomfortably cute.
About the Creators
Steve Stormoen, Writer (USA)
Making The Pros has been such a significant part of my life for such a long time, and I can't wait to share it with you.
I'm Steve, and I'm a writer and community organizer from Santa Barbara and Lompoc, CA. I've worked in the past with the Chelsea Manning Support Network, the Lompoc Theatre Project, Alliance for Community Trainers, and many more, and my writing has appeared in the New York Times, San Francisco Chronicle, Huffington Post, and several print and online journals. In 2012 I ran a successful Kickstarter with a couple friends to publish three books. This is my first comic book.
Jelena Đorđević, Artist (Serbia)
The special quality of The Pros is the balance of serious and fun, which made me learn new, gratifying stuff, like how to match dark lines and bright colors.
I'm Jelena, I'm an unemployed psychologist and a self-employed comic artist from Nis, Serbia. I've published a book of illustrations Ulysses Reload in Serbia and many short comics and illustrations in various anthologies with friends all over the world (Arcadia, Memory, Broken Pieces, TV Gods, Outre).
E.T. Dollman, Letters (Italy)
Greg Benninger, Cover and Graphic Design
About the Rewards
At $2, 3, or 4, you'll get the digital comic. It used to be $4 only, but we just keep hitting stretch goals and unlocking the lower price points. Pay whichever amount you prefer. Hopefully, we'll get to offer this even cheaper (see stretch goals, below).
At $8 we'll send you a physical copy of the comic, along with a couple buttons. One is the logo of The Pros. The other is an image from the comic that Jelena drew and I quickly became obsessed with. It's, hm, quite graphic.
For $15, we'll send you a physical comic AND a copy to your favorite comic book shop, anywhere in the US.
$25 lands you a physical comic and the buttons, plus a DIGITAL PRINT of original artwork by Jelena and customized Company Insurance DOG TAGS. So cool!
For $50, you get the comic, the buttons, the digital print, and the dog tags, plus a hand-printed block print by artist and printmaker Angelina La Pointe, and special Sneak Preview access to art from issue 2 as it becomes available! Heck yes.
Our $75 reward includes everything from the $25 reward, plus I'll take the time to do a deep reading of a comics script or short story you wrote and give feedback and advice. I backed the Kickstarter for Rocket Girl at a similar level a while back and Brandon was a huge help to this project. I'd love the opportunity to pay it forward.
At $100, you get your face in the comic! Jelena's already working on issue 2, so you won't appear until issue 3. That should be fine, though, because between now and then you get to enjoy all the rewards at the $50 tier!
For $150, you get your face AND your name in the comic. It's like the last one, except your character will be named.
For $200, you will get a piece of ORIGINAL ART by Jelena, hand-drawn on A4 bristol board. Choose from some pinups inspired by the comic, or add another $50 for an original commission.
And, the grand prize. For $201, I will get really drunk and talk about comic books on camera. Read the description on the right if you must know more.
SHIPPING TO THE U.S. AND SERBIA IS FREE. FOR SHIPPING TO CANADA, MEXICO, AND EU COUNTRIES, PLEASE ADD $5. FOR SHIPPING ANYWHERE ELSE, PLEASE ADD $10.
Stretch Goals!
The stretch goals fall into two categories. Roughly, more money means we up the print quality and make the digital version more accessible. More backers means we give you all more free content. We'd love to do all of these!
One note about the prequel story reward, which we unlock at 100 backers. This will be a prose short (not a comic) that I will write and post for free on my website when we ship out the rest of the rewards in April. It'll follow Sasha on a different Pros mission with a different team. Additionally, I'll print out a physical copy on nice paper with a hand-sewn binding and send a copy to every backer who's pledged $15 or more.

Hey folks, as you probably know, issue #2 of The Pros has been up on Kickstarter all month. We've had a hell of a campaign—we're currently sitting at $3008 and 105 backers! But all good things must come to an end, and in just a little over 6 hours, our campaign for issue #2 will come to a close.

updates.update_content:
Hi there, backers of The Pros issue #1, how are you? When we last spoke, I was letting you all know that I'd moved our communications to Mailchimp. Unfortunately, some email providers hate all mailing lists, and there's a decent chance that for at least a few of you, your spam folders are eating up all my tasty little email droppings.
So this is me standing outside your e-window, in the rain, holding a stereo above my head. It's playing our song, reminding you of the good times we shared. Remember ? Remember issue #1? That feeling between us was real, and it was powerful.

Hi, this is Steve from The Pros comic with a quick administrative note. From now on, I'll be using my newsletter service (Mailchimp) to talk my gentle crazy talk to you all instead of handling it through Kickstarter. I've subscribed you all to it so don't worry about missing any emails. I'll send the first one out to tomorrow so you can be sure you made the switch.
With the next Kickstarter for Issue #2 coming so soon, I wanted to consolidate with our general mailing list from cons and such. As a result, these little updates will end for real soon. I'll send one last update once the next Kickstarter launches to pick up any stragglers though, ok?

There's a heckload of news to share today, so get ready.
Agenda item #1: The Pros issue 1 is now for sale!

campaign.story:
PLAY

FUNDED!! THANK YOU to all who have helped us take this huge step toward realizing such an ambitious goal.
New Stretch Goals!
17,000 - We will designate a VIP space for backers who have given over $100. This includes artists who have reserved tables! We’ll try to arrange a special meet & greet there with some of our honored guests.
19,000 - We will document the con with high-quality video, for those who can't be there in person.
20,000 - We will offer a special on-site discount on the POWER anthology: All copies sold at Flame Con will be $5 off the cover price!
Please keep fueling our Kickstarter, and spread the word! Flame Con is going to be a blast!
=============================
Since 2010, Geeks OUT has organized events throughout the country so queer geeks can meet, mingle, and geek out (it's our name for a reason). Now, we need your help for our biggest event ever.
In 2015, we're going to change the geek community in NYC and the greater Northeast by hosting a new comic convention - one made especially for queer fans! 
What's Flame Con About? 
Community 
The LGBTQ community is separated into different groups that all too often don’t mix or learn from each other’s experiences: gays, lesbians, and bisexuals, cisgender and trans people, aces and bears… But comic cons are all about mixing! People of every size, gender identity and expression, age, color and type come to comic conventions to get geeky, expressing what makes each of us different, special, and awesome. A queer comic con is a great way to bring us all together under one roof. We'll learn about ourselves as a community, and explore topics that haven't already been paneled to death at other cons. We want to end the con having brought queer people from different parts of the rainbow closer. 
Geeking Out
Cons are about meeting people face to face. You get to revel in each others' creativity and open spirit. you connect. You realize that you're not alone in what you love. Or who you love - really, there are a lot of similarities between being a geek and being queer. Weird, niche interests don't have to be isolating, and meeting others who are into what you're into makes your passions that much more fun! Come out! You'll find that you're part of something that doesn't just begin and end with the con! 
Showcasing Cool Queer Stuff
We love pop culture, and there's a lot happening now in comics, TV and movies that seems to be catering to non-straight tastes. From Orphan Black to Dragon Age to Arrow to Gone Home, there are queer characters and call-outs...subplots and inclusive themes. Sweaty workouts. Girls kissing. Gay gaming options. The entire world of fanfic... Still, enjoyable stories and ideas that are explicitly queer are rare, and often controversial. We've been enjoying queer winks and nods since the dawn of literature. We want to enjoy stories that don't rely on subtext and innuendo to create believable, honest portrayals of LGBTQ experiences. So, let's have a con that just puts it out there! You won't have to scan the floor for a rainbow flag just to find a queer-friendly artist. You won't have to sift through tables and tables of comics just to find a story with two boys or two girls kissing. Think of it: All the amazing queer art you always hope you can find at a big con, ALL IN ONE PLACE!
Geeks OUT president Joey Stern with Cthulhu and Lewd Alfred Douglas at NYCC 2011
  Here are some of the awesome things we’re planning to feature at Flame Con!

Creators! 
We hope to feature dozens of artists and vendors, catering to all kinds of queer tastes and interests.  Come see creators you've always wanted to meet, and meet creators you may have never heard of, but will remember forever! 
Noelle Stevenson (Lumberjanes, Nimona) and Allison Kolarik (Comic Book Afterlife) at our 2014 NYCC signing table.
If you or someone you know is a creator who might be interested in exhibiting at Flame Con, check out our “Artist Table” incentive. You can reserve a table at Flame Con right now, at a low early-bird price!

Big Names!
Flame Con is more about building community than big (and usually expensive) names, but we hope to give you a chance to shake hands with a couple of our favorite celebs. Feel free to let us know if there's anyone in particular you'd like to see, and stay tuned for more updates!

Panels!
We want to have discussions you won't hear at a mainstream con, between thoughtful, creative, and hilarious people. What would you like to hear about? What do you want us to explore? Bi erasure? Homophobia and transphobia? Body image issues? Creative processes? Let us know! Flame Con will be a place to engage fans in new conversations, and put forth ideas that will influence pop culture and the LGBT community long after the con wraps up.

An Art Show!
For the past three years, Geeks OUT has held celebrity-themed art shows, each featuring dozens of artists paying tribute to geeky icons important to the LGBTQ community:
Geeks OUT's last three art shows!
This year, we'd like to include a tribute show WITHIN Flame Con! Artists exhibiting at Flame Con will be encouraged to participate, and creators unable to make it to Flame Con can still be a part of the event by contributing to the art show!  
Anthology!
Geeks OUT is just getting started on our first ever comics anthology, featuring work from queer and queer-friendly creators around the world. The theme is POWER, and we're super excited to show it to you. We'll be releasing the anthology at Flame Con! Fans at the con will get first dibs on it, and can line right up to get it signed by the creators it features -  several of whom will probably be tabling at Flame Con! 
The Geeks OUT Anthology Comic is in the works!
Cosplay Parade
At the end of the day, we'll host an after-party at a bar within walking distance of the con! Cosplayers can take to the streets and lead the way! This will be a great opportunity to meet more fans and continue mingling with the cool people you met at the con.
Rowr! Start working on your costumes NOW!
Incentives!
$50 - The Blue Flame limited-edition tee shirt, only available for our $50 Kickstarter backers!
$30/$100 - Pick 1 of 4 amazing mashup prints by Rey Arzeno of Rage Gear Studios! Get all 4 for $100!
$250 - Custom Rage Gear Character Mashup by Rey Arzeno! Want to see two of your favorite characters combined into one? Rey Arzeno of Rage Gear Studios will make that happen for you! One custom digital illustration and an 11x17 print.
$30/$100 - Pick one of four limited-edition Comic Book Afterlife prints, by Allison Kolarik! Get all 4 for $100!
$250 - Comic Book Afterlife Custom Zombie! Turn yourself or someone you love into a pop-art zombie! One custom digital piece and an 11x17 printed copy by Allison Kolarik.
$30/$100 -Pick one of four limited-edition modHero prints by Rogan Josh or get all 4 for $100! Approximately 11x14.
$250 - Imagine yourself, a friend, or your favorite character as a piece of minimalist pop art! One custom digital piece and a 11x14 print.
Custom Chad Sell (Drag Race) Portrait - Time to get fierce! Imagine yourself, a friend, or anyone else you can think of as a fabulous drag queen! Includes a print, approximately 11x14.
$200 - Have brunch with Flame Con! He's totally real and wants to have eggs bennie with you!
$200 - Happy Hour with comics superstar Phil Jimenez! Talk shop, hear insider tales, or just enjoy an evening getting to know this LGBT comics trailblazer. (Price includes three drinks and snacks for you and Phil at a Manhattan establishment, TBA).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Starting and running a comic convention is expensive and complicated, even more so in NYC, where space is very hard to come by.

Although this is new territory, Geeks OUT has years of experience putting together successful events (http://geeksout.org/events/past) and we feel that with our experienced managing board and dedicated army of volunteers, we are up to the challenge.

We expect to use the 15,000 we raise on Kickstarter roughly as follows:
$1500 - Kickstarter and financial service fees
$2000 - Incentive fulfillment 
$5000 - Venue Rental
$3500 - Promotion and advertising
$3000 - Guests and con incidentals (security, insurance, etc.)

It is our hope that Flame Con will inspire corporate sponsorship. Geeks OUT is a small non-profit, and the steep costs of the con, many of which may arise unexpectedly, will probably be our biggest challenge. Financial sponsors will allow us to focus more energy and creativity on the big ideas that we think will make Flame Con spectacular!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Serving Pride: The Queer History Dinner Party Handbook

If you do not have tickets, please message us through Kickstarter!
(shirts and stickers go out next week!)

Flame Con is up and at 'em and we want to thank you for helping us out!  
So, this week and next here are some special discounts for just wanting to help us out!
Remember, only Backers that selected tickets (or paid extra to add them to their rewards) get tickets! So even if you're at a higher level, like shirts, you still need to buy a Flame Con ticket.

updates.update_userinfo: Flame Con has a Date and a Home!
updates.update_content:
Dear Kickstarter backers, 
Geeks OUT is super-excited to announce that Flame Con, NYC's first queer comic con, will be taking place on Saturday, June 13th at the famous Grand Prospect Hall in Brooklyn!! Mark your calendars! In 2015, NYC Pride month will get its geek on! 
If you pre-purchased tickets via the Kickstarter, we will be sending you information on how to redeem them soon. That also goes for artists and vendors who pre-purchased tables. You will get an update with more information in a couple days.

We are so stoked!! 
The Flame Con Kickstarter closed yesterday, having blown far past its initial goal. After setting out out to raise $15,000 we ended up with $19,616! We are incredibly grateful to all who donated and to those who helped us get here.

We've almost made it to our 15K goal!! Thank you, thank you, thank you, to all who have contributed so far! We're incredibly grateful for your generosity, and can't wait to make Flame Con a reality. With nearly two weeks left to go on the Kickstarter, it seems like it's time for us to announce some stretch goals!
17,000 - We will designate a VIP space for backers who have given over $100. This includes artists who have reserved tables! We’ll try to arrange a special meet & greet there with some of our honored guests.

updates.update_userinfo: What Would A Queer Comic Con Mean To You?
updates.update_content:
Hey, Geeks! 
What does community mean to you? Inclusion? Diversity? A safe space? Something all around you? Something that you're still seeking?
There’s a wide range of responses to this question amongst queer geeks. Our newest video, filmed last month at NYCC, shows how comic cons can serve the needs of a community in many different ways, and how queer geeks could benefit from one. It's why we want to make FLAME CON a reality!

Exciting news, geeks! We have some great new incentives for you!
Phil Jimenez has offered a bonus happy hour! For $250 you get three drinks, snacks, and an evening with one of the comics industry's biggest names! You'll also get a free copy of FAIREST Vol. 1 for him to sign! 
Chad Sell, famous for his amazing portraits of Drag Race queens, has offered two custom portraits! Time to fierce it up and have yourself made a queen! Just $250 each!

campaign.story:
Dirty Sexy Comics is an upcoming documentary that takes a look at gay erotic comics, the many talents behind them and their impact on gay culture/lives. 
I've loved gay erotic comics since first seeing a copy of Gay Heart Throbs at my local comics shop. I was too young to buy it then, but I never forgot it. As I got older I discovered the Meatmen collections in gay bookstores. As a life-long comics fan, I was in Heaven! Even then, I wondered who the people were that created these stories. The books were a thrill for me, but required so much work for the writers and creators. I knew they were people very passionate and committed to their craft and to their sexuality. And they were gay and proud! It doesn't get much gayer than this fearless depiction of our raw sexuality. I loved it! I bought every Meatmen and every other gay erotic comic I could find. In the pre-internet days this was challenging and exciting. As a young gay person, these stories and pictures shaped how I saw myself. I didn't have to be a scared suburban homosexual. I could be a proud gay man, claiming my sexuality without apology. The men who created these stories had this kind of impact because they were good. They were REALLY good at what they did! They know how to turn their audience on. They knew how to be gay. And they freaking knew how to WRITE and DRAW! 
Who were these men? I wanted to know. What were they like? Were they wonderfully weird? Did they have day jobs? Did they ever have to pay a price for creating these stories? It wasn't until years later that I got some answers. But until then I thought about these creators, many who only listed their first name as their credit. 
The stories I read in these erotic comics weren't just a quick thrill to me. I thought about them. I revisited them. I re-lived them when I closed my eyes at night. They were as complex, beautiful and wonderful as any of the mainstream comics or "graphic novels" on my shelf. I felt so privileged that these men told me their stories. Now I want to tell theirs.
Dirty Sexy Comics will tell an important story about people who have been marginalized and an artform that's been ignored. The history of gay erotic comics is the history of the gay rights movement. It's a story of people who risked everything to express themselves. It's a story of who we are and what we desire. It's a story of rebellion, of artists refusing to conform and doing it with style and beauty.
In Dirty Sexy Comics, I'll take a look at gay erotic comics, past and present. I'll trace the roots of the medium and find the giants of the industry —the ones who are no longer with us and the ones who keep it alive and thriving. Many of these artists worked when they could have been discovered and lost their jobs and more. Their work let gay people know we weren't alone. And that there's nothing wrong with us.
This is a film about the rebellious part of the gay rights movement movement. Gay men were drawing sexy comics before Stonewall and we haven't stopped. We don't need to conform. We should understand our sexuality, not deny it. It should be celebrated! Gay people can be whoever we really are— and we have the right to put that down on paper or pixels.
Comics are getting more attention everywhere—from Hollywood to academia. Erotic gay comics deserve to have their story told too. Help me do that.
Art by Patrick Fillion
Why should I be the one to do this film?
I've made hundreds movies, some mainstream and promotional, some erotic. I know how to make a film and I have the follow-through to finish it. Not everyone on Kickstarter can say that. I've done hundreds of quality interviews with all sorts of people for video, print and the Internet. I'm no stranger to life behind the camera and I love it.
I'm passionate about comics, art and erotica. And I've got the drive to dig in and make this happen.
What will I do with the money?
I’ll find the men who created these comics in the early days through to today and record their stories. I'll shoot great interviews with all the key people and experts in the field. I'll be travelling all over to shoot and I can't do it alone. I'll need equipment, travel and crew. In post production I'll need editing, music, color correction, audio and output/applications for festivals.
What happens if the project is over funded? 
What I'm asking for is the minimum I need to make this movie. Any more funds will be put into doing more interviews and creating animation and using voice talent to bring the comics to life! The comics are at the core of this story and I want to audience to really experience them like never before.
You'll receive great incentives for your contribution! Check out the list. You can get:
The DIRTY SEXY COMICS digital movie The DIRTY SEXY COMICS companion book DIRTY SEXY COMICS t-shirts with exclusive art by Patrick Fillion! Deluxe The DIRTY SEXY COMICS DVDs with lots of extras A beautiful hardcover graphic novel, Fearful Hunter by award winning artist and writer Jon Macy from Northwest Press Digital comics from Class Comics Custom commissions from some of the hottest erotic artists working in the field You can even be a producer on the movie with your name in the credits and real input into the filmmaking process Get a short comic story based on your idea or fantasy drawn be a professional erotic artist and published in my book! You'll be part of history! But whatever level you contribute you have my deepest thanks and you'll be a part of getting this amazing story told!
Check out these messages from these very talented creators:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every projects has risks, but a documentary this project needs someone who will push through the challenges. I have a lot of people I want to interview and I won't stop until I get them. I have a history to piece together that's fragmented and has often hidden. I will dig for answers, connection and tell a story about an artform that has been ignored for too long.
Budgets, travel and dealing with people all present challenges. I welcome them with patience, persistence and a sense of adventure.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dirty Sexy Comics is very much alive. And I am so grateful to all of you.
My Kickstarter campaign didn't fund. I was pretty disappointed about that. For a minute, I was worried I was crazy to want to do this project. Then I get an email from a guy named Lee at Adam Male Blog. He told me that his company helps sponsor worthy, sex-positive projects for the community. This all sounded too good to be true. Do companies really do things like that? I did some research and found out that Adam Male, and it's parent company Adam & Eve, are very committed to giving back and they have been from that start. They're the real deal. I gave them some more information about me and the project. I waited a few weeks. Then I got an email letting me know that the owners of the company loved the project and they were going to help get it made. The offered me a considerable sponsorship offer. Wow. All of a sudden things got real!

Sorry for another ding in your inbox, but I'm getting some really kind messages and I want to respond.
Thanks for the kind messages. They're very encouraging. I've had such a blast working on this and I've interacted with brilliant people. Dubetube and Gay League posted article about the campaign right away. We were a Kickstarter staff pick. I got to do a panel on erotic comics at Bent Con with Brad Rader, Jon Macy, Patrick Fillion, Dave Davenport and ! Patrick did an original drawing for the campaign! (I still can't believe that actually happened. I light up every time I see it!) Dale Lazarov interviewed me for my favorite comics news site, . The project was in the last week. HuffPo! Dale also with the Dirty Sexy Comics theme and the results are spectacular! And that's just a partial list of the great things that have happened over the past four weeks.
I feel like I should be giving a concession speech right now!

As I write this, there's less than SIX hours until this Kickstarter campaign ends.
Things could go well if just one crazy-rich person makes a single contribution. So... if you know any crazy-rich people (or twenty-eight thousand people with a dollar) things could be good!
Seriously though, doing this campaign has been an amazing ride. So many people have done so much to help. The gay erotic arts community has been hugely supportive. I am for all the support. You guys are amazing!
This seems like a great day to thank everyone who supported this project. I appreciated each of you so much!

updates.update_userinfo: Jacob Mott on Loving Erotic Comics
updates.update_content: While at Bent Con, I did an interview with comics talent Jacob Mott ("Mako Finn," "Adventures of Lawsuit and T-Boy") for the documentary. We chatted for about an hour and he told some great stories and gave me some insights into the life of an erotic comics professional. I could see the documentary coming together and it is looking good! I cut together some clips of Jacob talking about erotic comics and why they're important to him. What you see here is roughly what the documentary would be like.
