campaign.story:
Hey, Everyone!
I’m here to talk about BENT-CON, an annual pop-culture convention happening this November in Burbank, CA.
BENT-CON also celebrates and recognizes often-overlooked independent and niche work that deserves a wider audience.
It’s sort of an “A to Z” in creativity, networking, opportunity and fandom -- a place where everyone takes center-stage and showcases whatever they’re up to creatively, expressing and sharing with an ever-growing audience. I personally like to think of BENT-CON as an annual celebration that is a welcoming and safe place for anyone—fan or professional—who believes everyone has a right to see themselves reflected in the things they love.
BENT-CON was founded with community in mind. In 2010 we held the very first BENT-CON in a donated space in Los Angeles’ Silverlake area, as an experiment to see if works that were unabashedly queer-positive could stand together and bring in an audience. And they did!
The success of that one-day show is when BENT-CON was truly born. From nearly 500 attendees then to nearly 3500 attendees at our 2013 convention—BENT-CON has shown steady growth year after year, thanks to the ever-evolving community that has grown to love and embrace it. This November, BENT-CON will be celebrating it’s 5th year, and we want to make it our biggest and best yet.
Since BENT-CON is all about diversity and inclusivity, we decided to reach out through crowd funding to preserve the intention and heart of BENT-CON:
For the community, by the community.
Our Bent-Con Poker Chip Necklace!
So we need your help!
We’ve set our initial goal at $15,000, which is intended to bring more attention to the annual celebration as a whole and, with your pledges, BENT-CON hopes to cover the total convention’s costs for this year and even some extras that we’ve indicated in the stretch-goals portion below.  
You'll notice that most of our rewards are very limited!  Some are even one of a kind! 
And because BENT-CON is also a federally recognized tax-exempt corporation, your contribution (less the value of your backer reward), is tax deductible. So Everyone Wins!
We need your enthusiasm, interest and curiosity. With your help, we hope to not only meet our starting goal, but also lay a solid foundation for the future of the celebration, so BENT-CON can be fully financed for years to come.
We’re eager for you to experience first hand what’s possible when the community comes together to build and nurture environments that reflect the beautiful diversity of the real world, beyond what we’re often served by mainstream pop-culture.
We want BENT-CON to send a clear message to social culture and mass entertainment: 
Collectable Flex Sticker Sheet at our $16 level!
Minus Zero Productions! On our $20 and $30 levels!
No matter what your tastes, you’ll find something exciting and new at BENT-CON! Whether it’s action and adventure, stories for young readers, comedy, erotica, or heartfelt drama, BENT-CON has it. BENT-CON is more than just a yearly convention—it’s also a destination, with a great crowd of people to mix, mingle, and celebrate with. Let’s make it a destination we can be even more proud of. Let’s celebrate our differences – safely, happily, and without judgment. Let’s show the world that BENT-CON truly is a celebration for EVERYONE!
David Holly Level at $20!
All of our wonderful rewards are donated by our partners, guests, exhibitors, or panelists.  Our Bent-Con logo, which graces many of our stretch goal rewards, is original artwork by our own President and Founder, Sean Z. Maker!  Our partners have done a wonderful job in offering varied and exciting rewards!  We hope you can find a level that thrills you to pledge at as much as creating those levels thrilled us! 
The cabana massage level will take place during our famous Atlantean Pool Party on Saturday.The convention weekend level is for our 2015 convention!  Imagine having your hotel and badges already in place for next year!
Stretch Goals!
When you pledge to the level you wish, simply increase your reward AMOUNT to cover any and all add-ons.If you have questions on HOW to add on to your pledge, please visit the Kickstarter FAQs at and you’ll find a wonderful video on how to do just that!
Badges:
Because many of you already have your badges or need them only for specific days, we have left most of our rewards as is rather than increase their value to cover badges you may not need or want.Therefore, we are offering our badges HERE, on Kickstarter, as an Add-On.
For a three-day adult badge, add $55
For a Friday or Saturday adult one day badge, add $35
For a Sunday adult badge, add $20
For a three-day youth badge, add $25
For a Friday or Saturday youth one day badge, add $15
For a Sunday youth badge, add $10
Steven Garcia at our $25 level!

Joe Phillips at both the $30 and $50 levels!

Martin Olson Encyclopedia of Hell at our $55 level! Martin Olson can also be found at the $105 level!
VIP seats to The Dinner Party Show at our $75 level!
Marc Debauch at three levels! $75, $115, and $500 levels!

Class Comics at our $95 and $185 levels and Patrick Fillion art at the $250 level! !

http://bent-con.org/kickstarter-sample-page-all-ages-samples/

Joe Phillips' Art
Joe Phillips’ project is here!  Joe's Kickstarter
Because Bent-Con is a non-profit organization, it is unable to back projects as an entity.  However, we, the Bent-Con staff, can and do!  Here are just some of the projects we’ve supported:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The convention will happen without a doubt ... unless a zombie apocalypse or alien invasion occurs, Bent-Con 2014 will take place as scheduled. With four previous years under our belts, we're confident that this year will be our best year yet.

That being said, there are always unforeseen events that could impact the individual rewards. We are proud of our working relationship with our wonderful donors. Any obstacles that arise would surely cause no more than a delay in fulfillment, if that.

updates.update_content:
So close and so many thanks due out to all of you for your belief in our project and support. Rest assured, the con will go on and it will be AWESOME!  See you in three weeks!!!
For those of you who donated our wonderful rewards, you are amazing.  For those of you who pledged, equally so.  In this economy to throw your hard-earned cash behind a project, we know you must truly believe in it.  For those of you who spent time and effort working on this project, whether you are Bent-Con staff, a volunteer in the trenches, friends who just promoted the hell out of the project, someone who provided graphics, contributed to the video or videos, or just sent out good vibes, you are muchly appreciated.

Whoot!
Thanks to all our wonderful backers and to those of you who have shared, tweeted, emailed our project to your friends!
While the clock is ticking quickly and the time for us to be funded is winding down with lightning speed it seems, we have reached the half-way mark and are still hoping to make this year's Bent-Con more amazing than ever before!
PLAY

We're thrilled to announce a new reward level, courtesy of Charles "Zan" Christensen of Northwest Press: he will be providing a big box of NWP books, including their latest, award-winning collections and new single-issue series, at the $200 reward level.
Zan's a self-identified Bent-Con fanatic, and recently penned us an embarrassingly sweet love letter on his Northwest Press blog. We're so happy to have him as a supporter and think he does a great job of describing the wonderful experience we try to create at our show.
PLAY

campaign.story:
UPDATE: STRETCH GOALS
At $4,200, I'll add decorative endpapers to the book. It'll be pretty swanky! (And we've reached this goal! Thanks!)
At $4,800, I'll make a special print for backers. Anyone getting a physical copy of the book ($15 pledges and above) will get a 4"x5" print. Anyone getting the e-book will get a digital copy. 
------
This will be the fourth volume, collecting comics from 2012 and 2013. Unlike the previous books, Everyone Is Someone's Fetish will be a full-color, offset-printed book.
I'm excited about putting out a really nice quality book. I've always wanted to do it, and through this Kickstarter, I'll finally be able to.
I'm even re-coloring all of the 2012 comics so they match the quality of the newer comics.
What's it about?
Finn and Charlie Are Hitched is a weekly slice-of-life comic about a gay couple, Finn and Charlie, who are married, and their friends. There's Candy, who has just become reacquainted with the daughter she gave up for adoption 22 years ago, Krys. There's Corey, a young gay man trying to figure out who he wants to be, and his on-again, off-again indie-rock boyfriend, Ken, who has become Krys's best friend. There's Finn's neurotic brother Gus, and there's Nina and Mike and their two kids, the very manic Katie, and their special-needs toddler, Bennie.
What people are saying
"…a breath of fresh air in the heteronormative world of slice-of-life comics" —T.J. Grabowy writing for Queerty
"Humor isn't hard to find in comics, and keen observations of life and relationships are common enough in art, but rarely are these two qualities combined as enjoyably as they are in Hitched." — Jeffrey Brown, author of Clumsy and Darth Vader and Son
“Tony Breed has managed to take the best elements of the classic family comic strips and re-imagine them as a modern, gay webcomic. The result is a smart, quirky, and hilarious look at both the absurdity and mundanity of a modern family; Finn and Charlie Are Hitched is not to be missed!” —Justin Hall, No Straight Lines and Glamazonia, the Uncanny Super-Tranny!
“Hitched is warm and wonderful in every way—from Finn and Charlie themselves, to the humor and the incandescent art.” —Gordon McAlpin, Multiplex
Acknowledgements
The background music in my video is "Mexico City", by Canasta, who kindly gave me permission to use the song. You can buy it on iTunes, among other places.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The comics are all already drawn and scanned. I need to do prepress on the comics, and I'm coloring all of the 2012 comics, but I don't see any reason that can't be completed in time. In addition, I'll need to create the cover artwork; again, this is doable in the time I've given myself.

Shipping out all of the books that are ordered will be a lot of work, but I've allotted a generous amount of time to get that done. 

We're in good shape to complete this on time.

updates.update_content:
Hi folks! Thank you again for backing Finn and Charlie Are Hitch volume 4: Everyone is Someone's Fetish back in 2014.
If you liked that book, you'll probably like my new book, Literally Everything Is Outside My Comfort Zone. It continues the stories of Finn and Charlie, Ken and Corey, Krys, Candy, Gus and Tina.
The Kickstarter is running now, and it ends this Friday, so you've got 4 days to get in on it:

Hi all!
I thought you might be interested in the reprint of my Finn Running shirt that I'm doing. It's pre-order only, via TeeSpring. Sizes run up to 3XL, and there are tank top and hoodie versions available, too.
TeeSpring is a little like KickStarter, in that there's a time limit on the offer—in this case, you've got about a week left to pre-order.

updates.update_userinfo: All books and rewards have been sent! Reformatted digital editions coming real soon!
updates.update_content:
Hello!
Last week I sent out the last of the 4-book packs. If you are in the US and you bought a 4-book pack, you should have it now. If you are international, it may take a little longer.
I also sent out half of the ink-and-watercolor drawings. I hope to get the rest out next week.

Hi folks!
If you are in Chicago and you'll be at CAKE (the Chicago Alternative Comics Expo) let me know, and I'll make sure your book is waiting for you.
CAKE is this weekend a the Center on Hasted (at Halsted and Waveland), 11am-6pm Saturday and Sunday. It's free and it's fun (if you like indie comics shows, at least). More info at cakechicago.com

The books have arrived, and they are beautiful.
It's going to take me a little while to get the orders in the mail. (There's also a little work to be done yet on the e-book version, which some of you are getting.) But soon! Very soon.
Thank you all again.

updates.update_userinfo: Hello Chicago! Coming to the Chicago Alternative Comics Expo?
updates.update_content:
Hi folks!
Are any of you in Toronto? Are you coming to TCAF (torontocomics.com)?
If so, I can give you your books this weekend, in person, at TCAF. Find me at table 204 on the second floor. Once you get into the second floor room, turn left, and you'll find me on the left.

Hello all!
I've finally finished all production work, and the book is going to the printer. I thought you might like to see the finished front and back covers:

campaign.story:
Periscope Studio is a Portland, Oregon-based collective of comic artists and illustrators. This project will fund the printing of six limited-edition full-color art books, each representing the work of a member of Periscope Studio: Ron Randall (Trekker), Paul Guinan (Boilerplate), David Hahn (Erfworld), Natalie Nourigat (Home Is Where the Internet Is), Erika Moen (Oh Joy, Sex Toy), and Benjamin Dewey (The Tragedy Series).
The covers for the individual art books.
Each book will be full color, 32 pages long, and measure 7.5 x 10", with soft binding and a glossy laminated cover. They will include some of the best work from each of these artists, showcasing a wide variety of pieces from sketches and concept art to fully finished illustration. For the book design we've brought on board Jenn Manley Lee, who has 20 years of professional experience.
There will also be a special edition hardcover book collecting the full contents of the six individual art books! This first-ever edition of Periscope Studio artwork will be a gorgeous collector's piece; 200 pages long with a foil stamped cloth cover and a bookplate signed by all six of the artists. It will be fancy.
As detailed on the righthand sidebar, supporting this project can get you many rewards, including these individual art books or the collected hardcover book, which will be printed and ready for distribution by March 2014. Each of our featured artists also have their own special incentive:
RON RANDALL - A copy of the Trekker Omnibus, a 328-page trade paperback following the adventures of the retrofuturistic bounty hunter Mercy St. Clair, signed and sketched in by the artist. Also comes with one signed 11x17" Trekker print (your choice between two designs), a physical copy of Ron's art book and a PDF of all the art books from Maiden Voyage.
$55 or $80 international - Only 10 available!
ERIKA MOEN - Signed copies of DAR! volumes 1 and 2, which collect the entirety of the NSFW autobiographical comic featuring vignettes about sex, farts, the queer community, the Brits, vibrators and figuring out sexual identity. Package also includes a physical copy of Erika's art book and a PDF of all the art books from Maiden Voyage.
$75 or 105 international - Only 25 available!
NATALIE NOURIGAT - Choose a movie, recent or otherwise, for Natalie to use as the basis for a movie review comic strip for Spoilers! You will be thanked in her hilarious comic of the movie of your choice, and will receive a high res digital copy of the comic, PDFs of all the art books from Maiden Voyage, and a hard copy of Natalie's art book shipped to your door.
$85 or 110 international - Only 5 available!
Also, a higher reward tier for a similar prize; just substitute Natalie's art book with the limited edition hardcover, including a signed bookplate and your name in the dedication, and add an 11x17" archival quality print of your movie review strip!
$175 or 200 international - Only 5 available!
Panels from Natalie's reviews of Star Trek: Into Darkness and Les Miserables.
DAVID HAHN - An original comic page, traditionally penciled and inked and personalized to you by the artist. This page will be random from the three available, which come from the books Bite Club, Lucifer, and Fables. It will be mailed to you along with a copy of David's art book, and you'll also receive a PDF of all the art books from Maiden Voyage.
$150 or 175 international - Only 3 available!
David's available pages, from left to right, are from Bite Club #2, Lucifer #41, and Fables #34.
PAUL GUINAN - A prize pack of Paul's greatest hits, all signed and sketched in! The collection includes hardcover copies of Boilerplate and Frank Reade and paperbacks Heartbreakers, Heartbreakers Meet Boilerplate, Boilerplate Unpublished, and the Last Mission of Boilerplate, as well as a copy of Paul's art book and a PDF of all the art books from Maiden Voyage.
$200 or 250 international - Only 1 available!
BENJAMIN DEWEY - An original commission featuring your likeness (or someone else's) with up to five animals of your choice, from snails to dinosaurs. The piece will measure 11x17 and be beautifully rendered in inkwash, similar to the Tragedy Series strips. Your piece will be sent to you along with a copy of Ben's art book and a PDF of all the art books from Maiden Voyage.
$500 or 525 international - Only 3 available!
This is a few more animals than what we're offering... but you get the idea.
Want more than one reward?
We're offering several add-ons, which Natalie Nourigat describes in these lovely infographics.
To add these to an existing pledge, click the "Manage Your Pledge" button to the right of our video. Enter a new amount in the pledge box, adding the price of your add-on choices to your original amount.
For example, say you've pledged for the Ron Randall special reward tier ($55), and you want to add a signed bookplate ($5) and a limited edition hardcover ($95). Your pledge should be adjusted to $155.
Keep your reward choice the same. You'll be able to choose which add-ons the extra pledge money goes to when the Kickstarter successfully completes!
Are you working on holiday shopping?
Think these art books would make the perfect present for someone who's birthday is... tomorrow? Never fear, Gift Sloth is here! Courtesy of Benjamin Dewey, this amiable mammal is downloadable and printer-friendly, so you can tell your loved one what delights to expect in the near future.
Give the gift of Gift Sloth.
If we are able to exceed our goal, we have some stretch goals to bring you even more exciting rewards! Also, with the success of this project, we'll be laying the foundation to fund art books for all of Periscope Studio's members in the future. You can help us achieve this goal by pledging, as well as by using the share buttons to spread the word on Facebook and Twitter.
Thank you for your support!
A look at some sample spreads from each art book! Layouts are a work-in-progress and subject to change.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With all the content for the books completed, our challenge will be finishing up the book design, getting the files to our printer, and approving the proofs in a timely fashion. We have a distributor lined up to ensure quick and efficient shipping of the products once they're complete.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello folks!
Just a quick update to let you know that we've been getting your messages and that orders are still being shipped out. We're detangling a data error at our fulfillment house and are working to get an ETA for the last of the shipments.
Please send us a message if you have any specific shipping concerns or if you've received your order and there are any problems! Thanks,
Periscope

Hello backers!
Many of you have been asking for an update, and we wanted to make very sure before posting this, but books officially began shipping last week! The warehouse is about 2/3 through fulfillment, and we've already received some messages about folks receiving books. If you're in the U.S., you can expect packages by next week, and for international, please let us know if they don't arrive in the next 2-3 weeks.

Hello backers!
Apologies for the lack of updates, we've been having communication issues with our fulfillment house. They have all the rewards and shipping information but have not confirmed shipping status. We are working to figure out what is happening, and will let you all know as soon as possible! Thank you very much for your patience.

Hello backers!
Apologies for the long silence. We had a miscommunication with our fulfillment company in which we didn't know that the books had arrived safely at the warehouse, so we couldn't tell them to begin shipping! However, the books have been confirmed, and this week we sent off all the rest of the rewards to be packaged with your books. Here are some photos of them getting packed up:
We have recently received a package from our printer, containing advance copies of the Maiden Voyage books! We think they look pretty fantastic.

We're still waiting on a some backer surveys! If you have not filled one out yet, please check the e-mail address linked to your Kickstarter account for the invite to Backerkit. If you've never received one, try your spam folder or contact us.
This is very important! We can't complete production without this information. As it is, we're running a couple weeks behind schedule, with a current estimated ship date of April 14th. The surveys are very simple and quick to complete, so please get back to us ASAP!

For those who pledged at the $5 reward level, you may have noticed that no add-ons showed up on your survey.
This was because our Kickstarter add-ons list was not available to digital reward-only backers; it was priced to be share shipping and packaging costs with a physical reward level. Not including adjusted add-ons for digital backers was an oversight, however, and they are available now!

campaign.story:
Center for Sex and Culture’s Exhibition Catalog of Safer Sex Posters
*Funds raised beyond our original goal will be used to increase the size of the print run.  Thank you!
The Center for Sex and Culture, located in San Francisco, is publishing an art exhibition catalog on our safer sex poster collection in conjunction with an exhibition displaying these posters at our gallery. The 2-month exhibition opens on November 8, 2013.
Buzz Bense, sex activist and graphic designer, donated over 150 unique posters to CSC last year. Bense has collected and produced safer-sex posters aimed at members of the LGBTQ community since the mid-1980s. Circulated at a time when the community was particularly hard-hit by the HIV/AIDS epidemic, these posters comprise a striking aesthetic collection of graphically innovative design that explicitly visualizes homosexuality, diverse LGBTQ communities and safer-sex activism.
SF AIDS Foundation
Because of the cultural and historical significance of the posters, we are inspired to share these images and their story with people in the Bay Area and beyond. It is easy to forget details of recent history, especially when related to sexual history because it is less likely to be preserved. This project aims to preserve and share some of what might easily be lost. The book will contain over 20 color reproductions of posters, an introduction by CSC’s executive director, Dr. Carol Queen, and an essay by the New York based art historian and curator, Alex Fialho, and an interview between Buzz and Alex about the history of the collection. Alex has spent time in San Francisco and New York researching and interviewing the people who created these posters as activists, artists, community organizers, members of health organizations and independent graphics designers.
The collection consists of posters, primarily from San Francisco, but also encompasses other cities throughout the United States. It also includes international representations from Australia, Germany, Denmark, and Canada. This historical archive presents the visual means through which LGBTQ people passed on life saving information about safer-sex practices during the height of a health epidemic that continues to affect us today.
We are confident the exhibition and book will function as both an art historical survey of the importance of this collection of aesthetically beautiful and functionally informative posters as well as an educational endeavor engaging the LGBTQ community and beyond.
Brothers Network, San Francissco
These posters do more than chart the tragedy of an epidemic, of an outsider community reeling from grief, loss, and the decimation of a blooming culture of sexual liberation. The history of these posters is a story of a fight against stigma, hatred and ignorance; of a community stepping up to take care of its own; of finding a way to extinguish fear and build pride and self-esteem; and of devoted efforts of committed activists to communicate a path to health and survival. -Buzz Bense
SF AIDS Foundation
"everybody's doin' it!" National Condom Week
"Keep a Rubber on Hand" San Francisco
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Because CSC is a non-profit run by volunteers dedicated to cultural and educational events about sex, we face particular fundraising challenges. This has been the case for all arts organizations as well as individuals whose creative and intellectual work touches upon issues of sexuality. We believe in the value of what the Center for Sex and Culture has achieved for 17 years as a space for adult sex education, cultural programming and as a resource for scholars and the general public. This is our first book project and we are determined and excited to begin publishing scholarly materials about our extensive collection and archive. We have more books projects in mind that further our essential mission of education and examination of sex and culture. The successful funding of this project will initiate CSC’s publishing program with a safer sex bang!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you all for your generosity and enthusiasm for the Safer Sex Poster Catalog. Because of you our campaign is a success. We are very excited to share our first publication with people near and far.
I will post updates when we have send out the rewards so you will know they are coming (in January). If you have any questions, feel free to contact me any time: sexandculturegallery@gmail.com

Thank you to everyone who's been backing our project. Everyone on the poster gang is grateful to you and so excited to share our posters through the book and exhibition that opens at Center for Sex and Culture on Friday, November 8th. (Save the date, locals!)
We have received some terrific press so far. Check it out:
The Bay Area Reporter http://ebar.com/blogs/sf-based-sex-center-seeks-support-for-safe-sex-poster-catalog/

campaign.story:
Last year we released Glitter Britches into the wild; Shiny, boot-cut leggings to party down in. This year, we thought we’d address your top half. Enter the Incandescent Armor Jacket, the most awesome hoodie this planet, or any other, has ever seen. 6 months in the making, this jacket is ready to be your second skin, protecting you from evil-doers and imbuing you with super-heroic powers of awesome. 
Meet The Designer:
THE DETAILS: 
Made of high-quality holographic spandex—the stretch will mold to your body, the shine will dazzle all you meet. 
 Raglan sleeves and contrast side-panels give both excellent fit and bad-ass detail. 
 Two comfy, inset pockets on the front and one 5” x 5” stash pocket on the inside. Pockets are a necessity.
 Fully lined with soft, black cotton-lycra jersey. Incandescent Armor Jackets are sturdy, heavyweight, and warm.
 Extra-high collar and 3-piece hood for ultimate ninja awesomeness and, oh yeah, head and neck warmth for those late night (or is it early morning?) dance parties. We have you covered.
And, of course, THUMB-HOLES.
Even the zipper is shiny! That's right, we found holographic zippers. Because we're awesome like that.
Look at it shine!
COLORS:
This first run will be available in two colors: Mercury Silver and Oil Slick Black.
FIT: 
Incandescent Armor Jackets are designed to be slim-fit. The women's style nips in at the waist for a flattering, feminine fit; the men's is a classic slim cut, not unlike American Apparel track jackets. We'll be collecting your size and color choices at the close of the project.
Yes, that is us, skipping along, photo-bombing away. This picture showed up on Reddit as "The Most San Francisco Picture Ever"-- does that make this the most San Francisco Hoodie ever? We like to think so.
THE COLOR OPTIONS FOR CUSTOM HOODIES:
Yowza!
ARM WARMER CHOICES:
Feast your eyes...
THE PATCH:
Declare thyself!
Patch is approximately 4" high by 3.5" wide.
WHO ARE WE?
BeastWares is a tiny, Bay Area company run by designer Phoenix Zoellick. We believe that clothes should be well-made, fun to wear, and a personalized experience. When you wear our clothes, you are not wearing something mass-produced by a faceless company, you are wearing a unique, small-run garment designed and produced by just a few people. 
You will never be overlooked in a BeastWares garment—these are clothes made for rock-stars from space who are ready to say to the world “yes, I AM that awesome. Deal with it.”
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We don't forsee many...
We have a stellar track record with customer service because we take this really personally; our last Kickstarter project was a great success and everything went out ahead of schedule. This time, it's true, the goal is upped and so is the production, but we have our manufacturers chosen, vetted and ready to go. Of course, evil wizards could attack. Or the sparkle mines could collapse, leaving our jackets, and the world, dull, joyless husks of their former glory. But we will do our very best to avoid such catstrophes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: A New (purple) Addition... and a present for you!
updates.update_content:
Huzzah! The IA Jackets have begun to arrive!
And they look pretty dang awesome. We took them home, hung them on the rolling rack, and promptly broke the rack. It simply could not handle the weight of the awesomeness.

Hello lovely ladies and gents!
Just your friendly neighborhood shiny purveyor here, to bring you updates!
We have been so busy here. I got the chance to vend and attend at HoopCamp with the inestimable Emma SanCartier last month to sling some shiny. Neither of us had been before but hoo boy was that a knee-slappin', hip-shakin' good time. Except for when I killed the battery on the van in the middle of the redwoods. That was not my finest hour. BUT! It was an amazing experience. I made some new duds just for this event-- as soon as I get some proper pictures I'll put them up in the .

updates.update_userinfo: Things are coming along quite nicely...
updates.update_content: Stickers for all! Stickers for the masses! Stickers to put on your mother, your brother, your goldfish, your glasses!

Hey guys!
We decided to add some stretch goals to the mix! The goal is reached but it would be great to keep the buzz going and this thing growing-- the more we raise the more things we can make for you in the future... the shiny, shiny future...
If you have a moment, please share the project on Facebook, your blog, etc. Submit it to any sites you follow that you think might enjoy it. Kickstarter is about crowd-funding, yes, but even more it's about crowd-sharing. If you like it, pass it on-- everyone wins, and perhaps we here at BeastWares can afford the FANCY ramen this month.

project_data.project_name: INCANDESCENT ARMOR: The Cutting Edge in Hoodies

campaign.story:
WE ARE MAKING THE PLUSHES!
IT IS CONFIRMED, THEY ARE HAPPENING! If you want a Teacup plush, include an EXTRA $25 ($30 international) above your chosen pledge level.
OR if you have pledged at $150 or above YOU ARE GETTING ONE!!
Also, this just in! Want to appear as a character in one of our stretch goal extra comics? Look for the $350 LAST MINUTE REPRIEVE pledge level!
It’s almost too much magic for one book!
Mahou Shounen FIGHT! is a webcomic about Mike Smith, an every day comic book fan who never wanted to be a superhero. Unfortunately for him, an apparition of the season of Summer appears to inform him of his magical, super-powered destiny.
Mike is dragged kicking and screaming into a wacky world of supernatural spirits, mutant creatures and a whole lot of sparkles. Shounen Fight’s varied (and eccentric) cast of characters only add to the whirlwind of his new life. But when a busty cloud lady who lives in the sky sends a scar-faced kitten to tell you that you have to save the world, you can’t really argue.
A Silly Story with a Mission
Our story is a tribute to the Japanese "magical girl" genre, with all the rules and sensibilities of a shoujo manga but a storytelling and visual style more like American comics. Of course, there have been lots of magical girl comics (and we love them!) -- but we wanted to bend the rules (and the gender roles) a little to try something different: Magical BOYS (“Mahou Shounen” that is).
Beyond the blinding color and comical themes, we wrote the comic to fill a gap we noticed back when we were teens (please don't ask how long ago that was!). As queer creators, it’s important to us to tell stories which provide something for young folks to relate to who rarely see themselves in the mainstream media. Representing characters of varying ethnicity, cultural experience, sexuality and gender expression is a mission close to our hearts.
Our comic is rated PG and aimed primarily at teens, but we’ve been delighted to find, as the project has progressed, that adults can enjoy it also-- either because it’s a story they would have liked to see as teens or just because they’re as into fun, silly stories as we are. And though Mahou Shounen FIGHT! is an LGBT-friendly comic, that’s not to say it can’t be consumed and enjoyed by everyone, regardless of identity!
Who are we?
We’re Dusty and JD, a queer couple about to celebrate the 10 year anniversary of sharing our life and creating stories together. We’re artist alley regulars at conventions all over the country and have spent a perhaps startling percentage of our adult lives at comic book conventions. You might have even seen us at a convention near you!
We conceive and write Mahou Shounen FIGHT! together, Dusty thumbnails the pages, and JD does the pencils and inks. Then it’s handed back to Dusty for the color and typesetting. It's a real team effort! :)
The Book!
Our comic has been in production for 3 years and in that time, we’ve completed four and a half chapters. The comic is available online for our audience to read for free (@ MahouShounenFight.com) and we’ve been printing small batches of individual issues, whenever we can afford to do it. This method of printing is expensive and means we don't make any profit from our comics, though has been a great way to get our work out there for people who prefer to read their comics in physical form, instead of on a screen! But now that we’re on our way to being 5 chapters in, we want to put together one big book, using offset printing! This printing method makes great-looking books, at a more affordable price per book, but it requires a larger minimum order than we can afford to pay out of pocket ourselves! This is why we need your help!
The book itself will measure 7x10 inches and collect approximately 200 full color pages. It'll feature tons of stuff you won’t get anywhere else! We’ll be including concept art, walkthroughs of our process and exclusive extra comics and character stories.
We'll be working on finishing up chapter 5 this summer and are looking at a shipping date of April 2014.
A Rainbow of Swag
As though there wasn’t enough glittering goodness in the book, we’ve got plenty of fun backer rewards to go along with it!
Prints
We’ll be creating three new 7x10 inch art prints with exclusive MSF! illustrations for the Kickstarter. These are illustrations that will ONLY be available through the Kickstarter, and we'll keep our backers up to date as we create each illustration so you can see our progress! On top of this, in our stretch goals, there’ll be several more prints to unlock. If we reach those goals, those of you who pledge at a level that includes the three initial prints will get ALL of the prints that are unlocked! 
For the stretch goal prints, as backers, you'll be able to vote for the designs you’d like to be unlocked first! At our $40 pledge level, you get one print of your choice. At $55 and up, you get ALL of them!
Stickers
At the $55 level and above, our backers will receive a sheet of adorable Shounen Fight stickers featuring lots of our characters and little items like Mike’s Mantisman undies, the Sun Guns and Joe’s multitude of sweets.
If we reach $20,000, EVERYONE who orders a book will get the stickers!
Kissing Charms
We’ll also be producing a set of twelve 1.5 inch acrylic charms that can be used as cel phone charms or keychains or even jewelry. The best part of these is that they’re double sided and therefore reversible -- so their kisses can match up with any other charm.
Right now you get your choice of 4 charms at the $100 pledge level but if we hit $30,000 everyone at the $55 level or higher will get their choice of 2 charms!
Your choices will be: Mike, Yuki, Raji, Oliver, Summer, Winter, Spring, Autumn, Anjika, Sonya, Alex and Chloe
Some Help From Our Friends
We’ve been lucky enough to make friends with some incredibly talented people during our travels on the convention circuit, and we are so grateful and honored to say that we have some incredible artists offering us some help to getting this Kickstarter going!
Three of our friends will be creating 11x17 Mahou Shounen FIGHT! posters that will ONLY be available through our Kickstarter!
We are delighted to say that E, artist of Teahouse will be doing a pinup of Raji in all his drag glory. Pilot-Star, artist of Two Keys and Honeydew Syndrome will be creating an illustration of the boys in their school uniforms. And Chira, artist for Sfeer Theory and The Fox Sister will be making one of the team in their battle costumes. Lucky ALL OF US!
You can chose one of these guest posters at the $65 level OR get all three at the $100 tier! If you pledge at any level that includes the “SWAG BAG” rewards, you'll get to choose one of these posters as well!
It's Your Comic, Get What You Want!
As a way to offer our readers a closer look at our characters, in the past we’ve written illustrated short stories (‘Before Winter’ and ‘Burgers’ let us get a little peek at Alex and Yuki together). We’ll have a few of these for the compilation book but if we hit our stretch goals, we’ll pile on a whole lot more literature! We’ll have a list of topics, characters and prompts that you, as a backer, will be able to vote on to determine which stories will be unlocked first.
We’ll also have some extra comics set up much like this, including the stories of how Raji, Oliver and Yuki came to meet their own spirits. If things go REALLY well, we might even look at making a separate, black+white saddle-stitched book to house all this fun stuff.
Original Art from JD + Dusty
On top of the various goodies we've got to go with your books, we're also offering a few rewards aimed for fellow creators and art collectors.
If you're a comic artist, you have the opportunity to get one-on-one feedback and advice from Dusty. An extra, trained eye can be super helpful so Dusty will review your composition, typesetting and color.
Speaking of color, Dusty is also offering to color 3 pages of your comic project at another reward level!
We've got two great reward tiers which include custom digital art made just for you! The first of these is the "FIGHTING SPIRIT" pledge which offers the opportunity to get a portrait of you (or your kid, or your dog or your best friend) and your very own body-snatching Spirit! Just like Mike is stuck with Summer, you too can get saddled with your very own visiter from the spirit world! JD and Dusty will invent and illustrate a unique spirit just for you (or your kid, or your dog, or your best friend)! When it's done, we'll send you a high resolution copy of the art via email, as well as a nice, shiny autographed print in the mail!
The second reward tier that nets you a custom piece of digital art is called "PROMOTED TO LOVE INTEREST"! This tier is especially for those of you who can't get enough of romance, who maybe have a favorite pairing that you don't get enough of in our comic, and those of you who want the chance to dictate to JD and Dusty just who from MSF! you think should get all lovey-dovey <3. Pledge at this level if you want a fun, romantic, unique piece of art of ANY two characters from Mahou Shounen FIGHT! (No incest or adult+kid pairings, please!) Just like the option above, you'll get both a high res copy of the art as well as a signed high quality print in the mail!
If you want to really go all out, JD is also offering several options to get some custom original art! We have reward tiers which feature watercolor or oil paintings in three different sizes. JD will work with you to create an illustration in watercolor of up to two characters (either MSF! character or your own original characters!) or a one of a kind oil portrait of you (or anyone else you can provide photograph reference of)!
And then, there's more!
Our project goal is $9,000 but the higher we go, the better products we can bring you! To keep this magical train moving, we've got goals in place to reward your love. 
We've got markers where we'll make fresh new content for the book. YOU, as a backer, will be able to vote on what the content will be for your extra content. We've got short novels and extra comics in store and you'll choose from a variety of story lines to decide which gets tackled first.
THIS JUST IN!
We've got 7 Days. LET'S MAKE PLUSHES!

Reaching Critical Adorbs
That's right, if we reach the $17,000 point in the next 7 days, we will be able to make PLUSHES of Teacup! These are going to be adorable and snuggly and horrifying and you KNOW you need one.
Aside from a super-cute plush, the toy will include a removable collar. On that will be an acrylic charm nametag -- but if we hit $20,000 we'll upgrade that charm to a METAL nametag! And we'll be trying to make the collar double as a bracelet for you.
 Everyone who pledges $150 or more will get a Teacup plush if we hit $17K. As an add-on, the plush will sell for $20 + $5 shipping ($10 international). 
At the moment, we are sorting out the very last details on how to include an order for Teacup in your pledge. Stay tuned for details!
We have amazing friends who have come to help us add even more stretch goals! For each guest art goal we unlock, a guest artist will contribute a full page illustration to the book. And never fear, digital downloaders, these will also be available in the digital version.
Many thanks to our wonderful friends!!!
UNLOCKED!! $11,000 -- Ben Juwono, storyboard artist and creator of "We're all In This Together" will contribute an illustration [Ben on Tumblr]
Check out his 2013 sketchbook! More printed things, yay!
UNLOCKED!! $13,000 -- Justin L, creator of 'Loki' and 'Pariah Song' will contribute an illustration
UNLOCKED!! $14,000 -- Kori Michele, creator of 'Prince of Cats' will contribute an illustration [Kori on Tumblr]
UNLOCKED!! $16,000 -- Emy Bitner, creator of 'Trying Human' will contribute an illustration [Emy on Tumblr]
Wowzers!
One of the things we are most looking forward to is being able to share our progress on this project with you, our backers. We'll be staying in touch every step of the way so you can see the whole process from start to finish. We’ll keep sharing our ideas and make sure you stay updated as our project progresses. Thank you so much for your interest in our comic and our Kickstarter!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It's always been a challenge for us to keep up the pace that we do, going to so many conventions while also producing a comic. This is why we've planned for the majority of our work to be timed during the winter, when the convention season dies down, giving us more time at home.

The most daunting part of this for us will be shipping all this stuff out. Luckily we've got lots of friends to help us label packages to get your goodies to you AQAP. (As Quick As Possible)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: THE SHIPPING HAS BEEN CONQUERED! Did you get your rewards?
updates.update_content:
Greetings Backers
Well we are through the majority of the shipping -- pretty much everyone that got any other merch + the book should have their products. Most of the signed books went out and then we ran into another issue with our manufacturer and have been having a horrible time getting them to actually send the REST of our books since they only sent us part of our order originally. (It’s such a long, horrible story, seriously. Bad experience. We came so close to suing these people.) The remainder of the books are supposed to be arriving this week so we can finish things off.
Okay folks, the address change system on Kickstarter finished its course so the shipping shall recommence! If you missed the window to change your address, just send me a message with the new one. :)

updates.update_userinfo: Attention: Backers with Posters (also good news!)
updates.update_content:
Greetings again backers. Things are going out! I started doing some of the shipping, then realized I hadn't closed out the address notifications so that people can update their address if they moved since the survey went out. 
Some books have been sent out, though I'm still locked in massively irritating negotiations with our manufacturer over a billing error. I'm hoping that they finally sort things out for us next week so we can get the second wave of books to send out. In the meantime, the other rewards are hitting the mail.

updates.update_userinfo: Not a ton of news but I want to keep you updated
updates.update_content:
Well we really hadn’t been planning to go to more than 3 conventions this year. But chances have kept coming up that have lured us back for a few more. This time we took the last minute opportunity to go to GaymerX this weekend in Santa Clara. 
GaymerX is a gaming convention aimed at a queer audience. This is their fourth year -- we went to years one and two. We’d totally recommend the convention, it is a super positive and fun experience. I think there’s a few tickets left at GaymerX.com So we have another chance to deliver some books! If you’re going to be at GaymerX, please stop by in the dealers hall and find our very colorful booth and get your stuff!

Hello again backers. I’d really hoped we’d be wrapping things up by now because we’d hit a great stride as we made it to SDCC with the books. Unfortunately when I came home from comic con, I was presented with a huge family health crisis. My mother, who was living on the same property as us, had a crash with symptoms somewhat like sudden onset dementia. In a matter of a couple of weeks she lost the ability to walk, unable to control her limbs or keep equilibrium. Her short term memory dissolved, she lost the ability to read and communication became really difficult for her.

project_data.project_name: Mahou Shounen FIGHT! Volume 1: Wake Up

campaign.story:
Stretch Goal: If we can get to $70,000 we will have enough extra to revamp the sound system. One of the things we constantly battle is balancing the sound effects, music, and dialog so that each comes through clearly. If we had a little extra cash to modernize the audio gear it would make for a much more complete upgrade project. We are so close to our main goal, lets put it over the top and make the sound great too.
Here at Central Cinema, we are committed to bringing you quality films ranging from Citizen Kane to Howard The Duck, but as we move into the future of theater projection we need to convert our theater to DCP. DCP stands for Digital Cinema Package. It is the new standard in movie projection and by 2014 all major movie studios will only deliver films in DCP. Right now, two major studios are only doing DCP screenings which means there are tons of great movies that we would love to screen but cannot. Crowd favorites include:
Princess Bride
Say Anything
Alien & Aliens
Dangerous Minds
Adventures In Babysitting
Mannequin 2: On The Move (Jason's favorite)
True Lies
Sister Act & Sister Act 2: Back In The Habit
Cocktail
Point Break
The Last Of The Mohicans
Return To Oz
and hundreds more!
Central Cinema's KICKSTARTER campaign is to raise the funds to convert our theater to DCP, and we need your help to make this a reality. State of the art digital projectors are expensive, and we would have to save up for a long time to afford the equipment we need. The trouble is that we need to do this in the next six months before Hollywood shuts off the supply of non-DCP movies. If you can help us get over the hump with the new projector then we will bust our butts to make the shows that much better for you.
Reward Update: A YEAR OF MOVIES pass is now TWO YEARS OF MOVIES. We felt the passes needed to be balanced better with the punchcard rewards so we extended their time. We are willing to pay the movie fees over time if we can raise the money now for the project. Don't worry if you have already picked up a Year of Movies Pass, it will automatically be upgraded to Two Years of Movies.
the DCP projector we need
A DCP system will also take the picture and sound quality of our shows to the next level. Whether it's a screening of a Technicolor Classic, a Cult Favorite, or one of our own Sing-Along events, the new systems will make everything more gorgeous on the screen. Brighter brights and vibrant colors all smothered in delicious caramel!
the Central Cinema crew
Here at Central Cinema we love movies, and we love watching them with friends while yummy food and great drinks are brought by the wonderful servers. We started Central Cinema to bring more fun to the CD neighborhood. For the past eight years we have used our scrappy ingenuity to build our own DIY movie system for getting the show on the screen. In fact we built the whole place ourselves on the bones of our old art studio. It has been great fun building a totally home-made movie theater, but now it is time to go big and take the Cinema to the next level.
Meter Music School performs at the Central District Holiday Party
Central Cinema continues to support the local community with projects such as the Central District Holiday Party, high school student Mia Roberson's senior project, The Black & Beautiful Film Festival and the Central District Garden Tour. We look forward to continuing special events such as these and screening all the movies that you want to see!
Neighborhood Block Party
What We Need
We have been talking with Miles McRae over at McRae Theater Equipment in Fremont. Miles got us going with our first screen eight years ago as an upgrade from showing movies on the wall. If you want a person who can set you up right, Miles is the guy to talk to. We have our eye on a Barco projector and a DCP digital media storage block. If we are able to raise any extra money we have our eyes on a Datasat(nee DTS) digital audio processor and some other sound system upgrades that will really make the room sing. There will also be a number of cables and support bits to hook everything together. The new projector is significantly larger than what we have so we will need to construct a new support and housing to fit it. We will also need to pay Miles for his time to connect and configure everything into a cohesive system. We have determined that a fundraising effort of $60,000 plus what we are kicking in will buy us the ideal system to fit Central Cinema for all of the different types of events that happen here.
Please help us meet this goal so we can expand our repertoire and continue making our unique brand of entertainment for you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If we do not make our funding goal then we will have to find another way of making the DCP conversion happen. In the current economy the banks are still quite hard to work with and equipment lease deals are approaching usury. An upgrade of this size is too large to put on our line of credit and credit card rates are out of the question. We may be able to work out a loan arrangement eventually but the best option is still to have the fans of the Cinema help us with this Kickstarter. 

Currently there is a backlog of orders for DCP systems as independent theaters everywhere are being pushed to upgrade all at the same time. The sooner we can get an equipment order put in the better shape we will be for getting a timely delivery.

We will need to build a new support and housing since the new projector is much larger and heavier than our current one. Making sure the housing is built to the right size before the projector arrives will have to be carefully coordinated to make sure there are no surprises when we go to put the new gear inside.

The changeover will be a complicated dance as we will try to keep the theater open as much as possible during the installation. We may not be able to have both our old and new systems in operation simultaneously so we may need to close briefly while everything is tuned and tested. Careful planning of how each piece interconnects will keep this as smooth as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hi Everyone, It has been a while since we have checked in. We have had our noses to the grindstone (actually) getting everything together for the installation of the new Projector, on Tuesday! This has turned out to be harder to pull together in a physical sense than it seemed like it should in the planning stage. I have had to dust off my welding skills from a previous life before we opened the Cinema.

updates.update_userinfo: Making Progress 3 steps at a time...
updates.update_content: Hi Everyone, It has been quite the month since the funding phase ended and the project began. By now most of you should have received your rewards. There are still some things straggling as we need to finalize the t-shirts, plaques etc. The fulfillment process was trickier than we imagined keeping everything organized. We had quite the mail room all over our dining room table for a while. If you haven't yet received your reward, not to worry, we will get it in your hands soon.

Hi Everyone, It has been a busy time around here since the kickstarter part ended. The projector and server are on order and are due to arrive from the factory in mid September. A Cinema Digital Audio Processor is ordered and due to arrive in the next 10 days. After looking through the sound system with our installer he determined that moving the speakers and re-aiming them would be the most direct path for improving the sound. This will need us to get a new screen with perforations so that the speakers can be mounted facing through the screen. We are now getting quotes for a perf-screen with specs to match the new projector. It is pretty interesting how the light characteristics have as much to do with the screen as they do with the projector. There are a number of options and it is important to make sure we get the right screen for the best look. It is also interesting that a significant portion of our audio improvements will come from a new screen.

Thank you Everyone for your contributions. We have a meeting with our equipment installer next week to get the order process rolling. We so nearly made our stretch goal for Audio system improvements that we are calling it Close Enough and will be rolling that upgrade in with the projector.
The passes, punchcards, and t-shirts are still in the process of getting printed. We needed to know what kind of quantities we were looking at. If you opted to pick yours up at the theater, we will be letting you know when they are available. Do give us a chance to get it all organized, it won't be long.

Cue the '80s power chords... It's The Final Countdown...
Thank you everyone for chipping in to make this project possible! We are starting to get the pieces lined up to put into place. It is really exciting to be embarking on this major upgrade.
One thing we would love to do is give the sound system an overhaul to go with the shiny new projector. We get comments about how this or that doesn't sound right and we try to chase down the issues. If we were able to modernize what is known as the B-chain it would make tuning the room so much easier. There are also some damping and bass trap projects that have been on the wish list for a while.

updates.update_userinfo: Doubling Up: 1 Year Passes now good for 2 years
updates.update_content: When we were considering the levels for the Year of Unlimited Movies passes we were basing them on the full ticket price. Looking back we now think we should have made them comparable to the punchcard prices. In light of this we have decided to upgrade all of the 1 year passes to 2 years. If you were considering supporting us at the One Year Pass level, now you can get double the movie. For everyone who has already kicked in at the One Year Pass level we will be sending you Two Year Passes instead.

We have had inquiries lately about combining different levels and/or swapping this for that so we have added a couple of new support levels to make things easier.
Now there is the Double Date punchcard pack. Get 2 punchcards good for 11 movies each (22 admissions total) for a pledge of $110. This is the last time punchcards will ever go for this little so you might want to snag a few. You can use as many punches at one time as you like, so you can bring friends along and treat them to a show.

Hi Everyone and Thank You for all of the support! We have had some amazing help with getting this projector project going. Our neighbor Daniel picked up the full price Year-o-movies pass when there were still Early-bird passes available. A sweet shout out across the street to Daniel! Stephanie jumped in with a Year-o-curry-popcorn for twice as much as necessary but it will keep Mark happy. Zach started us off with the very first donation for $25 just cuz, asking for no treats. David put in $100 of pure love. And Patrick is going to have a plaque with his name forever gracing his favorite booth in the the theater. Thanks to All of you that have chipped in!

project_data.project_name: Keep Central Cinema fun with a Digital upgrade

campaign.story:
With big beats and playful narratives, San Francisco's Double Duchess transcends genres and genders through its live experience and high-energy delivery. Krylon Superstar’s mesmerizing voice and performance art genius, coupled with davO’s emceeing and production deftness, delivers a raw and campy electronic sound. Double Duchess' musical influences include Baltimore club, booty breaks, and ballroom  house, all wrapped in a world of couture fashion.
With your help through this Kickstarter campaign, the duo will be able to finish recording, mixing, and mastering their first full-length record. Additional funding will be used to shoot a video for the first single off the new record, and for the duplication of the release on 12 inch vinyl and CD. Without a manager, booking agent, or record label, they have worked hard to get where they are. However, in order to take things to the next level, they need your financial support.
 
“San Francisco queer electro-hop duo Double Duchess deserve the key to the city after creating “Bucket Betch." -SFist
In 2010, Krylon and davO met and instantly began creating music originally inspired by their love for boys, being sassy, and the queer community in their new city of San Francisco. Krylon’s early years of vogueing in NYC, dancing and traveling as a club kid, and his international performance art pieces, are all part of their live  performances and visual presence. davO’s earlier years of fronting a live hip-hop/funk/punk band, mixed with his musical production, songwriting, and DJ experiences, creates the platform that captivates listeners, audiences, and dance floors alike. 
“Its San Francisco’s newest queer hip-hop anthem, and we’re in love.”   -Huffington Post
Together they’ve been heating up the national queer scene since the release of their debut EP ‘Hey Girl!’ in March 2012. After their second video for ‘Bucket Betch’ was released, mountains of local buzz, followed by some national recognition, escalated their touring schedule. In early October they released an EP of remixes, and finished out the year in the studio, creating a more developed, somewhat darker, heavily refined, but still raw, new batch of material. Their newest single and video ‘Deviant’ introduces a glimpse of their new sound and look that will keep the anticipations high for their new release scheduled for fall of 2013. 
“My favorite new find of SXSW (2013) was this kooky booty-hop duo.”               -Austin Chronicle
By contributing, not only will you help make the duo’s dream come true, you will help change the face and future of queer music in our society. Their music encourages everyone to ‘come as you are’ and celebrate life, as they do on stage and off. By working with a long time friend and producer Chris Cosgrove from the band Future People, their sound is becoming more refined and engineered for a wider audience. Help their message and new music reach as many people as possible by funding their creative processes in the studio and beyond.
Thank you for all your love and support!!
Promo and Live photo credit: Robbie Sweeny www.robbiesweenyphotography.com
Kickstarter & 'Bucket Betch' video credit: Ep Li www.eplimade.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A big challenge that could arise for us once the project is funded could be scheduling conflicts with our engineer, which would cause delays in attaining the final product in a reasonable timeframe. The problem when working with a producer who is also involved in working with other touring acts, is that it's often hard to book an adequate amount of time, especially when we aren't paying them a full rate. It also doesn't help that Double Duchess plays lots of shows out of state. However, if we're able to pay our producer/engineers enough, then we can book the time that we need to really get involved and finished the record by the end of fall 2013.

In the event that our producer becomes unavailable, we would just finish the recording session with him, and then find a recommended studio where we will proceed to mix and master the record with other engineers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Doing some recording and re-arranging at my home studio to get ready for our recording sessions down in LA the end of next month!!
Thank You for helping the record come to LIFE!

project_data.project_name: DOUBLE DUCHESS CREATES A FULL-LENGTH RECORD- SO LETS  DANCE!

campaign.story:
Have you ever felt as though your brain doesn’t match your body? That everything you were told you should be…you weren’t? Sure, everyone can relate to some degree. But have you ever felt not of your gender? Follow the incredible and honest journey of a truly remarkable individual managing the beginnings of gender re-assignment. Finding Kim is a glimpse of the authentic soul and self-discovery.
Our Mission:
The message of "Finding Kim" is one that speaks beyond gender. It's about knowing and understanding yourself & who you truly are as an individual. We want to unveil Kim's story in the most organic way possible while staying true to the documentary filmmaking process.  We wish for Kim's voice to resonate with anyone struggling with gender identity or self-acceptance.  We will follow Kim around for the next year filming the most intimate parts of his life, including his top-surgery, struggles and moments of happiness.  We will also be interviewing the individuals closest to Kim.  We wish to discover their thoughts on his process and how this will affect their relationship with Kim. Other segments will include others who have gone through the process of gender reassignment. Ultimately, we want you, the viewer, to walk away with a new outlook on gender. 
Production 
Producing a documentary is a long process that requires a lot of time and energy and money. Not only for the filmmakers, but also for the subject involved.  It can be somewhat of a shock at first, having a camera and (sometimes) complete strangers following you around filming your daily life. Finding Kim will always aim to keep the number of production crew involved at a minimum for the sake of comfort for Kim.
Our Plan:
The support you bring will help in the overall production costs for Finding Kim in 2013. You will help us fully realize post production, design costs, travel for the filmmakers, and overall costs incurred while making a film.  Once the film is complete, our plan is to submit to the large, regional and local film festivals across the world.  We want Kim's voice to be heard!
About the Filmmaker:
Aaron Bear
Aaron Bear grew up in Dayton Ohio by way of San Francisco and Atlanta. From an early age, Aaron has had a love and passion with film, music and photography.  Aaron's influences run the gamut from John Waters to Paul Thomas Anderson to David Lynch. Primarily focusing on highly produced/high concept content, Aaron's stylistic approach to projects aim to have an end result that look both brilliant and beautiful.  He's produced videos for local Northwest artists such as Watch It Sparkle and most recently a video for Portland artist Logan Lynn.  From 8-5, Aaron manages and produces rich media advertising content for a large consumer and news website. Clients include ABC, NBC, Honda, Paramount, Xbox and various other consumer products. Aaron currently resides in Seattle.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Anyone who has ever made a film knows how quickly production costs arise. Making a film is expensive, especially making a great film. There are many challenges involved with producing documentary film. Currently, our biggest challenge is securing the support to begin and continue production. "Finding Kim" will be filmed in Seattle and surrounding areas. Securing travel and other incidental costs that is required to make a great film are also items that your backing will help. Reaching this Kickstarter goal will play a very large role in success of Finding Kim.

We hope with the success and completion of "Finding Kim", we aim to showcase a documentary that resonates with every single viewer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT
Community is important. We believe that there are a great number of Gay, Lesbian, Transgender, Gender Queer, and Bisexual folks out there, of every color and creed, that at the end of the day, love to geek out. Geek about video games, tabletop games, tech, comics - all that fun stuff. And we believe that creating a community for these folks, Gaymers as they are affectionally dubbed, is important to help shape a more tolerant and safer space in gaming. After all, everyone games.
The stereotypes about gamers are many, but the core is the perception that gamers are usually straight white guys in dark rooms furiously mashing at a controller. That’s not the reality. Gamers come in all sizes, genders, races, and sexual identities. Unfortunately stereotypical bias among gamers does exist and it can make a hostile environment for minorities in the gaming community. Hang around an online game long enough and you’ll start hearing homophobic, racial, and misogynistic slurs slung around without a second thought. Gamers, as a whole, have had to make space for themselves in a society that, for a long time, treated them as outsiders. They have come together and created a real community of people, but one that is not always welcoming if you don’t fit into the mold. Just like most gamers, queer geeks and gaymers want that same sense of community and belonging. Therefore we intend to create a space where all gamers and queer geeks can come together in a welcoming and safe space.
This space is GaymerCon.
We are creating a convention where all types of geeks can come together, meet others like them, and have a blast without having to worry about what their peers think of them or being discriminated against.. We will have exhibitor space, cosplay, guest speakers, live music, panel discussions on topics that are directly relevant to our interests, gaming industry professionals who support including queer content in their products, social events, and of course…GAMING!
We will also have events and activities that target other areas of geek and tech culture besides gaming. From tabletop gaming to geek chic, from panels by tech leaders to cosplay and live music- we hope to have something for everyone.
We want to be clear this isn’t just for gay white dudes either. We want all genders, races, and sexual identities including our straight friends and allies to come together and have a gay, geeky good time. We believe very strongly that creating a space like this is not only important for building a strong community, but also showing new generations of gaymers that there are others like them out there, they are not alone, and there is a welcoming place for them, not just at GaymerCon, but as part of the larger gaming community. 
WHAT THE MONEY IS FOR
GaymerCon is going to happen no matter what in the late summer of 2013, but big events like this don’t happen by magic and certainly aren’t cheap. This is where you come in. Without any donations we will create a great space for gaymers to come together, build community, and have fun. WITH your donations however, we can reserve swankier and more centrally located venues, book more geeky bands to play for you, have more consoles and games to play on, have cool prizes for contests, and more. Basically the more you give, the more you get out of the con when you come. If we raise lots and lots of money, it will get the attention of the gaming industry, making them more likely to come to the show too so you can see their awesome stuff, but also let them know there is a market out there for gaymers and maybe they should pay attention to you. All this for what it costs for a day pass to most other conventions....oh and did we mention that almost all pledges come with a free pass to the con? Yup. That’s a thing. Go ahead and go donate. We’ll wait.
Can't come to GaymerCon? We also have sticker packs and Blue/Red GaymerCon Bitroms, for those supporters who want a little more Gaymer in their lives.
Bitroms are entirely original hand-made cartridge necklaces - choose from either Fire Red Conway, Cool Blue Turing, or (at higher levels) you can get the limited Kickstarter-edition Turing & Conway's Adventure.
HOW DO YOU KNOW WE WON’T JUST SPEND THE MONEY ON MOUNTAIN DEW AND CHEETOS
We know we can make Gaymercon a success because we are already experienced in being successful. We have a team of extremely talented, connected, amazing folks on the team including engineers and business folks at top startups here in San Francisco. These include Jack DeVries out of IGN, Zach Weiner from SMBC Comics which is one of the largest comics and websites in the world and Matt Conn from the founding team of BandPage, as well as other visionaries and leaders from the LBGT & fundraising world.
Also: Cheetos and Mountain Dew? Ew.
Please consider contributing and we hope to see you in August 2013.
Wait...you’re still not convinced? Alright. Fine. Time to bring out the big guns. What if I told you that a certain evil computer from a certain video game that starts with a “P” and ends with an “ortal” thought you should? You really going to say no to her?
See you at GaymerCon 2013!
Tweet at us at @GaymerCon or follow us at facebook.com/gaymercon to stay up to date. We won't camp at your spawn point. Promise.
FAQ
Who are you?
We are a bunch of geeks and allies based mostly around the Bay and Seattle areas. Most of us work in the tech or gaming space.

Why isn't there a venue set?
That's one of the main reasons why we're holding this Kickstarter - depending on demand and the amount raised, we'll be able to find a location that fits the expected attendance. The more we raise, the more awesome the space we can get, and hopefully get some awesome panels and bosses of honor, too!

Why is it in San Francisco? Why isn't it in ______?
San Francisco is where the highest concentration of gaming, geekdom, tech, and gay communities all coincide, and for year one, we want to make sure it is in an area where there is already, what we hope, is strong demand.
Who are Conway and Turing?
Conway and Turing are based off of two LGBT geek heroes that we wish to honor as well as help educate the young folks on:  Alan Turing, with whom we would not all the amazing technology and toys that we have to today, and Lynn Conway, engineering pioneer and activist for the transgender community.

I'm under 18 - Can I go?
For at least the first year, GaymerCon will be an 18+ event. Although we understand that helping create a safe space for youth is just as important to our mission, for year one, there are a lot of insurance and liability issues to take into account with minors. If you'd still like to come, please let us know so we can gauge demand!
I'm Straight! Can I come? 
Of course! We want to create a gaming and tech event that focuses on queer issues and themes, not the other way around. Similar to Gay & Lesbian film festivals and cultural events, we welcome all and hope to provide a fun, exciting, vibrant community that is in no way closed off from the rest of the gaming community.
I don't think something is a good idea becuase of [valid reason]/I would like to see [something cool]
We are always down to discuss and help explain our point of view and also listen to, and learn, from others. We are forging new ground with GaymerCon and a helping build a new community - and we want to hear what you think. Please drop us a line on fb or @gaymercon
I would like to troll you because... 
Be nice, please. We're trying to create something that we believe can help make the lives of gay geeks around the world a bit more interesting and more social. We can take the heat, but we'd prefer if you could please keep it civil.
Wait, I'll only sponsor this if I can get in the field reccomendations from my peers set to Japanese chiptune music.
Got it.
NEW! 
STRETCH GOALS!!
35K - GAYMERCONCERT! (UPDATE: WE DID IT!!!) GaymerCon will hold a GaymerConcert on Saturday night, bringing in musicians and bands that appeal greatly to the Gaymer community, for a night of drinking, dancing and socializing! Chiptune slow dance, anyone?
50K - GAYMER BRUNCHFAST FOR THOSE PLEDGING $100+! (UPDATE: WE DID THIS TOO!!!!) Many of you have said that you wish you could have lunch with us on Sunday, but we wanted to make sure that that was special to those who donated at that level. However, we really want to meet with everyone one of you, soooo... if we hit $50K, everyone who has donated $100 or more will be invited to have free breakfast with us the Sunday morning of the con. This will be a bigger group, but we'll still try to make our way around to thank each one of you in person. It will be our honor to do so. If you've already pledged below $100 and want to join...just up it to $100 and you're in.
60K- CELEBRITY BOSS OF HONOR: (UPDATE: SUPER FINAL BOSS MODE UNLOCKED!) GaymerCon will bring in a real awesome celebrity to be an official BOSS OF HONOR. Think of all the gay, lesbian, trans, and allied geek celebrities out there - who would YOU like to see?
100K: GAYMERCONNECT: We want to build an app - web first, then mobile, called GaymerConnect. The idea? That you can easily go in and find other Gaymers to play your favorite games with. Playing Call of Duty? Here are all the Queer Clans. Looking for someone to fight against in Street Fighter 4? Here are 20 awesome geeks to play against.
The best (and most relevant) part: we can coordinate GaymerConnect with GaymerCon itself, setting up an easy and instant way for you to connect online with all the awesome people you meet at the con.

updates.update_userinfo: NEW GAME from the makers of 2064: Read Only Memories!
updates.update_content: Hey fans of of Read Only Memories!

Hello Backers,
Since the split of the GaymerX and MidBoss companies, we realized we needed to determine the fate of the Kickstarter account as well. We have decided that this account will officially become the MidBoss one and any outstanding concerns will be our responsibility (though all previous campaigns be good to go by now). campaign.story:
SEASON THREE IS ON!
Hello fellow Variants! We want to deeply thank everyone that pledged to get us to our goal. You did it guys! The base six episodes are scheduled to shoot once this kickstarter ends on Memorial Day. Check out our update thank you video.
MORE EPISODES!
We have four more scripts completed and ready to add to this season! Watch our update video for info and details on these exciting episodes and find how to get them made!
INCENTIVES STILL AVAILABLE!
There's still time to get signed DVDs, Tees and art prints by pledging. These additional pledges grant us more funds to shoot the remaining four episodes! 
Our next goal is $10,000 in total which gets the Variants to an eight episode season and $12,000 gets a full 10 episode season of the Variants.
Again - thank you all so much for getting us this far! Watch the update video and share with friends. Let's keep going!
The Variants - it's like watching Iron Man and the Dark Knight,if those movies were about a bunch of kooky people who rana comic book store… and funny.  ~Robert Kirkman
Ink and color us impressed.  ~Quick DWF
What's going on?
Hi everyone. This is Richard Neal and Ken Lowery. We’re the executive producers and writers of The Variants, a comic series about life in a comic book shop.
For two seasons, you’ve laughed and watched us as we learn valuable lessons about life behind the counter at your local comic book shop. And today we’re bringing you our plans for season three.
After two seasons running as an all-volunteer production, we'd like your help to move forward to produce the next season. In this Kickstarter, we’re asking for $8,000 to make season three a reality. And once we tell you what we have in mind, we think you’ll be happy to contribute to making our goal a reality.
To give you a taste of what we want to do with season three, check out the season two finale, starring Chris Haley and Curt Franklin of the Web comic Let's Be Friends Again.
What's coming up?
Our biggest news for the new season is Curt Franklin and Chris Haley of Let's Be Friends Again are joining the cast. Curt and Chris showed up at the end of last season as potential investors in taking Zeus national.
But don't worry, you'll still get plenty of Barry, Keli, Richard, and Vlad. 
The goal!
Our goal is to make six of the funniest Variants episodes you've ever seen. But we'd REALLY love to make even more.
With this Kickstarter for $8,000 we can produce six episodes of The Variants you know and love.
If we reach our kickstarter goal, we'll continue! At $10,000, we'll produce eight episodes, and if we make it all the way to $12,000, we'll produce ten episodes and even produce extra content.
We've got fun incentives like signed DVDs, t-shirts, original art prints, and karaoke parties!
So there it is. Our Kickstarter campaign runs until Memorial Day, and we'll be updating you with special guest spots and videos along the way. 
So please, if you want more Richard, Keli, Barry, and Vlad, please, give generously.
