updates.update_userinfo: DVDs and poster art are off to the printer!
updates.update_content:
Hey Variants fans,
Quick update with some good news! The DVDs and artwork are off to the printer, and the shirts will be joining them soon. Once that's done, we'll get them off to the post office and on to you. We'll keep you posted on further developments.
Best,

Hey, Kickstarters!  
We haven’t forgotten you. In fact, we’re contacting you to let you know the season 2 and season 3 DVDs are in production RIGHT NOW, as are the t-shirts, prints and other incentives you so graciously bid for in your support for our show.
We’ll keep you current as production progresses. Thanks for hanging in there. You’ll get your goodies soon.

Hello Variants, we haven’t forgotten about you!
As you probably know, we published the last episode of Season 3 – “Behind the Svenus” – last Wednesday. The entirety of Season 3 is now online for your perusal and if you haven’t had a chance to catch up, we highly recommend it. We’re very proud of how the episodes tie together, and how individual episode stories feed into the master plot.

We’re very proud of Season 3. We hope you are, too. After all, without you Season 3 wouldn’t exist. We’d love to hear your feedback – what worked for you, what didn’t, and what you’d like to see more of. And if you’re proud, PLEASE SHARE The Variants with anyone you think might like it! This show lives or dies on word of mouth, and we’d love to see the show spread to a wider audience.

Now, your rewards.

Since we’re done with the bulk of the production work, we can start putting together the Kickstarter reward packages. Prints, T-shirts and DVDs will need to be made. The turnaround on those things isn’t quite as long as you might think, but it will take a little bit of time. We’ll keep you posted on our progress.

In the meantime, watch, spread the word, and take a bow. You made this possible.

Thanks,
The Variants Team

updates.update_userinfo: From the cast, crew and creators of "The Variants": Thank you.
updates.update_content:
Due to your tireless financial and vocal support, The Variants has reached and exceeded its last stretch goal, meaning we're filming 10 FULL EPISODES and have room left over to rent the equipment we need to bring you the best web show we can do. That's down to you, so again: thank you.
We won't lie -- it's been an exhausting experience. While we've been raising money for season 3, we've also been in development for season 3 -- writing and re-writing scripts, hosting table reads, lining up props, costumes, extras and locations. We wanted to turn the season around as fast as possible for you, our fans -- so we pressed on even when the fate of the show was uncertain.

There is still time to help fund The Variants™ season three. Right now, our Kickstarter goal has been reached, but we're still trying to get enough funding to produce four additional episodes for this season.
Spread the word about The Variants™ by tweeting it, share it on Facebook, and let your favorite blogs know to cover this show!
Thanks to you all, this is going to be the best season ever!

campaign.story:
"I know what it’s like to enjoy a good comic book. 'So Super Duper' happens to be one." - Mr. Pasty, Ain't It Cool News
Hi Comic Book Friends and Lovers!
My name is Brian Andersen and I've been creating a line of super gay, all-age-ish, way fun comics for the past five or so years! My most well known work would have to be "SO SUPER DUPER," but I've got a few other queer positive titles I've released over the years, like "REIGNBOW & DEE-VA" and "FRIEND OF DOROTHY."
"SO SUPER DUPER" is a giggle-filled, action-packed, superheroic soap opera with tons of heart about a gay superhero named Psyche who at first doesn't realize his own gayness but slowly accepts himself and becomes a better hero because of it.
"To put it bluntly, So Super Duper is a surprise. It’s friggin’ fantastic. I’m hooked." Dave Baxter, Broken Frontier
I'm recently at the end of the 12 issue run on "SO SUPER DUPER" (with issue 12 arriving shortly) and I would love nothing more than to collect all 12 full-color issues - with loads of extras - into 2 beauteous brightly colored trade collections. One that readers can proudly adorn their book shelves with, that I can donate to libraries, hawk at Comic Conventions, maybe try to get into the Diamond Comics Catalog and, probably, use as a box spring in my tiny studio apartment in San Francisco. 
In order for me to print these awesome collections I need your help. 'Cause, like, printing is kinda expensive! Also, I'm working with my artist, inker, colorist, letterer and all around amazing person Celina Hernandez to RE-DO my original "SO SUPER DUPER" pages so that they look prettier and more polished! Celina is going to re-color, re-letter all my original art! And I'd love to pay her for all her stunning skills. And trust me, she has a lot of work ahead of her!
So I'm hoping for enough money to print both "SO SUPER DUPER" trades, each containing 6 issues of the series. Any extra funds I might secure I will put towards collecting the 3 issues of my fabulous miniseries "REIGNBOW & DEE-VA."
"'Reignbow and Dee-Va' is...a fun, absurdist take on the secret agent genre, through the eyes of a gay agent and his straight female partner/best friend." Brian Cronin, Comic Book Resources
"REIGNBOW & DEE-VA" is a cheeky comic book series about two BFF secret agent partners who battle vampires, werewolves, and evil mermaids all the while looking fit and fabulous. It's like an action-filled "Will & Grace" only with more kung-fu.
"Andersen infuses 'Reignbow and Dee-Va' with plenty of those bawdy, spit-out-your-Diet-Coke moments, and Hernandez is perfect for the assignment." Erika Peterman, Girls Gone Geek.
So anyhoot, if you have a few extra bucks and would like to support a comic book loving, comic book creating, raging homo with a heart of gold, then I'll be just so crazy thankful. No joke. 
Thanks so much, peeps!
Brian William Andersen
Here below is my how my old pages looked:
Here is show AWESOME the new pages will look after Celina gets her fab hands on them:
Here is the increds cover to the "Reignbow & Dee-Va" trade:

Hola So Super Duper Friends!
We are nearing the end of the corrections, the edits, and the formatting on this long delayed sure-to-be-awesome So Super Duper trade! Eeeeeee! So excited! It's taken forevs! Right? Totally right!

updates.update_userinfo: Super Close to our Super Printing!
updates.update_content:
Hey girls, heyyyyy!
So, yeah the re-worked "So Super Duper" pages are, like, really and truly done. OMG! I could die. It's only taken about 10 million years! Well, that's an exaggeration, more like 4 million years.
So now it's just editing the lettering (checking for typos etc.) and getting the book together with all the extra pin-up art pieces and backup stories, and then BAM it's print time! Wheeeee!

Hieeeeee!
Wanted to let you all lovely, loverly, fan-tastical peeps know that we're trucking right along with the sure-to-be AH-Mazing trade collection of "So Super Duper!" Fine-effin'-ly! :)
Despite numerous (like tooooo many to count) delays and skipped deadlines, my artist is redoing issue 6 and moving onto issue 7. Thankfully she's doing an increds job and only have issue 8 left to re-color, re-letter, re-ink, and make look re-fab, and then the trade will be D-O-N-E!!!

Wanted to let ya all know that the trade is coming along...a might slower than expected, but Celina is working on it despite some unforeseen obstacles. She's finished re-doing the colors and inks and letters for issue 3 and is trucking through issue 4 now. I wanted to share some before and afters!

Hiya Super Supporters!
Just a quick note to let you all know the trade collection of "So Super Duper" is moving right along. My art team is busy re-doing the original pages, making them shine, making them de-gorgeous, making them beautious! Yay!
New targeted date for the completion of the trade: Jan 2013! Woot woot!

updates.update_userinfo: A super duper update on the So Super Duper Trade!

Hiya Friends!
Thought I'd update you all on the status of the sure-to-be-awesome "So Super Duper" trade! We are in full production of the re-vamped pages, with a hopeful completion before the end of the year! Whoot! Party in my pantaloons!
Also, the final issue of 'So Super Duper',  issue 12, is totally completed and will be out NEXT week in time for San Francisco's APE comic convention! The book looks AH-maze and it's 52 mother-funking pages! I'm stoked to show it to the world!

Hieeee Fab Supporters!
First of all, I just wanted to thank you again for your awesome support of my GLBT comics. It means Super mucho much!
To date I've already completed and published my first collection - the 3 issue action-packed, laugh-riot "Reignbow & Dee-Va." For those of you who get a copy I'll be sending those out shortly. As will all those who donated and will be receiving the single issues of "So Super Duper." Your rewards will be sent soon!

campaign.story:
BENT-CON is the convention for encouraging, celebrating and appreciating LGBT and LGBT-friendly comic-book artists, writers, creators, publishers, directors and producers, creating media targeted directly to LGBT audiences or as part of the larger realm of underground and mainstream pop-culture as a whole.

We want this year’s BENT-CON to bigger and better! We have added film viewing and panel discussions from names you might recognize from various creative industries. Our guests include: Phil Jimenez, comic book writer, artist and penciller, Wonder Woman, Infinite Crisis, New X-Men and The Invisibles. Patrick Fillion, artist, writer, creator and co-publisher of Class Comics Boytoons, Naked Justice and Camili-Cat. Jane Espenson, writer and producer, Husbands, Buffy The Vampire Slayer. Tim Sullivan, director of 2001: Maniacs, I Was A Teenage Wearbear and Chillerama. JT Tepnapa, director, Judas Kiss, Star Trek: Hidden Frontier. Kerry O’Quinn, creator and publisher of Starlog and Fangoria magazines.

Our goal is to continue the excitement we started last year. We want BENT-CON to become a mainstay in the LGBT creative community. We also want to encourage more LGBT artists, writers and filmmakers to showcase their work to the masses.

With your help, BENT-CON can be a must-see event! The funds raised during this Kickstarter campaign will cover:
BENT-CON T-shirts for attendees 
A colorful and exclusive BENT-CON Yearbook for attendees, fans and guests
The BENT-CON mixer for fans and special guests
Production cost
Media and print 
 Your pledge will be paramount to BENT-CON overall success!
  All pledges and donations are welcomed. We will greatly appreciate your contributions and hopefully, we will deliver an effective and exciting BENT-CON for 2011.

updates.update_content: We attended a few panels that piqued our interests. The first panel we attended was Drawn This Way: Gay Male Erotic Comics. Belasco (Boo), Patrick Fillian (Class Comics), Wendy Pini (Masque of the Red Death), John Macy, and Jeff Jacklin hosted the panel. It was interesting for the artists to talk about past work and present work. It was also insightful for gay artists to talk about the hilarity that is yaoi, or gay themed comics aimed at girls. The artists expressed how much their fans praised them for their anatomic details that yaoi seems to lack.

campaign.story:
New approaches to computer science education are under active development. The College Board plans to introduce a new AP course and exam (CS Principles) in the next few years. Google recently launched a portal for Exploring Computational Thinking resources. Many people — and businesses — recognize the importance of computer science education.
But none of these people have cartoons.
We're here to fill that lonely void with professional, CC-licensed illustrations. Did you watch the video? Seriously, you have to see Tim draw. Not only is it amazing to watch the process, but you can see that he really understands how to communicate visually. He did the first illustration on nights and weekends, and will now complete the series of ten.
I wish I already had these cartoons to use in my own classroom. I was even thinking about commissioning them completely out of my own pocket. As I searched for the right illustrator, a mutual friend introducted me to Tim. Together, we had an even better idea: Let's make these cartoons available to everyone, so that students and teachers everywhere can benefit. (And now that we've reached 100% of our funding goal, we have a new goal to do comic strips using the same characters if we can reach 150%!)
The illustrations will all be in a vector format so they can scale cleanly to any size. That means you'll be able to make classroom posters, include them on web pages, or print them in documents. And, most importantly, they will be licensed under Creative Commons (BY-SA) so they will be free for everyone to use forever.
"Computational thinking is a fundamental skill for everyone, not just for computer scientists. To reading, writing, and arithmetic, we should add computational thinking to every child’s analytical ability."        
– Jeannette Marie Wing, Head of the Computer Science Department, Carnegie Mellon University
You can read more about the background and genesis of this project on my blog, And Yet It Moves: http://itmoves.wordpress.com/2011/05/02/computational-thinking-illustrations/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I'm happy to share that the illustrations you supported have been used in an article in the latest issue of ACM Inroads: 
http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=2189835
The article "The CS Principles Project" is by Amy Briggs (Middlebury) and Owen Astrachan (Duke) and explains the framework behind the upcoming new AP CS Principles course.

With the illustrations finished, it's time to get rewards out to our backers! You should have already gotten our survey via email, and the drawings are posted for you to review at http://www.ctillustrated.com/
We still have some work to do on the text and the web site, and any feedback or comments you have are most welcome!

Thanks to all our backers for helping us reach 103% of funding in the first 3 days of this project! The enthusiasm of this response is so encouraging that we're setting a new goal: If we can reach 150% of funding ($2,250), we'll do an additional set of 7 comic strips.
These bonus strips will illustrate the AP CS Principles "Big Ideas". The ideas are related to the computational thinking practices we're already illustrating, but have a level of complexity and nuance that lends itself to the narrative form. The same characters from the computational thinking illustrations will appear in these strips, and we'll learn more about how their world and their powerful abilities. I can't wait to see them in action!

project_data.project_name: Computational Thinking Illustrations
